Hungry Rats.name: 饥饿的巨鼠 Hungry Rats
Hungry Rats.text:
第一场遭遇发生在奥塔里渔场（Otari Fishery）的地下室里。每个玩家都需要对付一只巨鼠，它们已经被布置在房间里了，只是目前处于隐藏状态。当你准备好时，请把下面的内容朗读给玩家听。

通往奥塔里渔场地下室的楼梯因为上了年纪而嘎吱作响，你们下楼去寻找那只吃了所有鱼的野兽。在房间的中央，在支撑着渔场的石柱之间，是装满咸鱼的木桶。其中两个桶被砸开了，里面的东西都洒到了地上。在东面的墙上有一个通向黑暗的大洞。
就在几小时前，你们几个冒险家聚集在塔米莉·坦德威尔（Tamily Tanderveil）的办公室里，她承诺如果你们能解决这场威胁，就能得到每人10金币的报酬。当你们同意帮她完成这个简单的任务时，她很激动，但当你们走下楼梯时，你们不禁觉得这可能比想象的要危险得多。

环顾桌子，询问每个玩家他们希望自己的英雄在房间里做的第一件事是什么。当每个玩家描述他们的行动时，允许他们在这个区域移动他们的棋子，但不要让他们离开房间。

房间南北两侧的架子上堆满了渔业日常用品。如果英雄们调查了房间东侧墙上的洞，会发现房间里侧有成堆的松散的岩石和泥土。好像有什么东西从另一边挖穿了墙壁！

在每个玩家都有机会做完一件事之后，一阵不祥的响动从墙上的洞里传来——巨大的老鼠现身并发动了攻击！向玩家们读以下内容。

墙上的洞里传出一种奇怪的吱吱声。突然，一只狗那么大的巨鼠从黑暗中出现——而且不止一只！巨鼠冲向你们，它们嘴里巨大的牙齿不断上下开合。

战斗和先攻 Combat and Initiative

知识库：战斗

开始一场战斗 Starting a Combat

你需要人数份的巨鼠参加战斗。当你准备好后：

  • 右键巨鼠的指示物，点击右上角的“切换可见”
  • 可以通过框选巨鼠和玩家的token来一次选中多个指示物。右键他或者他们，点击右下角的“切换战斗状态”
  • 当他们都被加入到遭遇里后，你可以用遭遇页面里的“NPC掷骰”键快速给所有NPC骰先攻。
  • 玩家们可以通过点击遭遇页面里角色旁边的D20图标来骰先攻

弹出一个侧边栏 Popping Out a Sidebar Tab

当战斗开始后，你也许需要时常查看聊天栏以确认各类投骰的结果。为了避免来回切换遭遇和聊天侧边栏带来的麻烦，你可以右键它们的图标来弹出一个侧边栏便于观察。（这个功能对所有侧边栏都有效）

在战斗中，每个玩家都要轮流遵守关于他们能做什么和不能做什么的特定规则。详见@UUID[JournalEntry.OxJPjPEL0hZAvHw2]{遭遇 Encounters}关于如何进行战斗的指南。

遭遇 Encounter

@Actor[AYwdybUfm4meGUTJ]{巨鼠 Giant Rats (4)}

巨鼠的属性值可以通过点击上面的按钮来查看。

在它们的回合中，每只老鼠都会移动到不同的英雄身边并进行攻击。如果英雄失去意识（unconscious），老鼠就会移动到另一个最近的敌人身边发动攻击。

攻击 Attacks

当一个生物使用打击动作来进行一次攻击时，首先选择一个你武器攻击范围内的目标，然后鼠标悬停在目标的指示物上的时候按下T键，这样就可以选中目标。你也可以右键指示物然后选择左下角的选中目标按钮来做到这点。如果你是GM且你需要同时选中多个目标，你可以选择多个指示物然后按T键。如果你是玩家且你需要同时选中多个目标，你可以在悬停按T键时长按Shift来多选目标。

当你想使用巨鼠的啃咬攻击时，打开巨鼠的人物卡（双击巨鼠的指示物）并点击【攻击】部分里的【啃咬 Jaws】下面的【攻击+7】即可。这会打开一个投骰界面且自动帮你算好所有当前应应用的加值。

系统会自动计算并比较你的投骰结果和目标的AC（甚至会自动计算夹击！）这会帮GM节省不少计算的工夫。不过你有空的时候还是可以检查一下是否遗漏了什么加值减值（比如掩蔽Cover）。

如果你骰出了一个自然20（骰面上的数字就是20）或你的投骰结果高于目标的AC10点以上，则你造成一次重击！这在聊天栏中会以绿色标出，且能造成双倍伤害。

当你想骰伤害时，点击聊天侧边栏里的“伤害”按钮（或者“重击”按钮当你骰了一个重击时）。当伤害被骰出后会同样被发送到聊天栏里，你可以选择要受伤的指示物然后按下伤害消息框下面的按钮将伤害造成给目标指示物。

经验值 Experience Points

击败巨鼠之后，奖励每位英雄80XP。

战斗之后 After Combat

一旦战斗的一方被打败或逃跑，你就不再需要关注行动顺序，英雄也不再需要再依照顺序行动。相反，你应该环顾桌子，询问玩家他们的英雄下一步想做什么。如果英雄们回到楼上和塔米莉谈话，她得知老鼠死后会松一口气，但她确定老鼠不可能是造成地下室所有破坏的元凶。如果英雄们想要获得奖励，他们就必须进一步探索地下。当玩家决定探索这个房间之外的其他地方时，请转到@UUID[.VLztUZ1H5YEYPcx9]{02: 深入黑暗 Drop into Darkness}。

Being a Gamemaster.text:
每场Pathfinder游戏都需要一位游戏主持人（简称GM）。作为游戏主持人，你负责运行每次游戏团期，在玩家与游戏世界之间搭建桥梁。你需要设定场景，让英雄们与怪物战斗、与他人互动，并探索这个世界。

成为一名GM就像为朋友们组织派对一样。你希望确保他们准时到达，有充足的事情可做，并度过一段愉快的时光。你负责……

  • 以引人入胜且前后一致的方式讲述团队冒险的故事。
  • 充实游戏发生的世界。
  • 娱乐玩家和你自己，并奖励有创意的点子。
  • 通过研读或编写冒险，以及创建角色与情节来为游戏团期做准备。
  • 当玩家做出意料之外的行动时，即兴演绎英雄所遇见角色的反应。
  • 进行规则裁定，以确保公平，并让游戏以良好的节奏推进。
  • 以经验点（XP）和宝藏奖励英雄们的功绩。

你并不是要通过打败英雄来“赢”游戏。你的工作是提供一段有趣、并带有一些挑战的故事。这些挑战可能很难克服，英雄有时也可能失败，甚至偶尔会死亡。但他们始终都应该有一搏的机会！

讲述故事

作为游戏主持人，你要与其他所有玩家一起合作，看看这场冒险的故事将如何展开。当他们各自扮演自己的英雄时，你将承担所有怪物、村民以及他们所遭遇的其他角色的身份。你决定这些人和怪物如何行动、他们在战斗中会做什么，以及他们可能给英雄留下些什么引人入胜的线索。你还会描述英雄探索的每个区域，让其他玩家能够想象设定，并决定他们的英雄如何回应周围正在发生的一切。这些就是你用来与其他玩家共同塑造故事的工具。

请务必记住，你不是在和其他玩家对抗。这是一种只要大家都玩得开心就算大家都赢的游戏。怪物就是用来被击败的，宝藏就是用来被发现的。尽量让玩家觉得他们的成功是靠自己赢得的，同时又不要对他们所扮演的英雄过于苛刻。



原文:

Every Pathfinder game needs a Game Master (GM for short). As Game Master, you run each game session, providing the link between the players and the world of the game. It’s up to you to set the scene as the heroes battle monsters, interact with other people, and explore the world.

Being a GM is like organizing a party for your friends. You want to make sure they arrive on time, have plenty to do, and have a good time. You’re in charge of...

  • Telling the story of the group’s adventures in a compelling and consistent way.
  • Fleshing out the world in which the game takes place.
  • Entertaining the players and yourself and rewarding creative ideas.
  • Preparing for game sessions by studying or building adventures and creating characters and plots.
  • Improvising the reactions of characters the heroes meet as the players do unexpected things.
  • Making rules decisions to ensure fairness and keep the game moving at a good pace.
  • Rewarding the heroes for their deeds with Experience Points (XP) and treasure.
  • You’re not trying to “win” the game by beating the heroes. Your job is to provide a fun story with some challenges. Those challenges can be tough to beat, and the heroes can fail sometimes or even die on occasion. But they should always have a fighting chance!

Telling a Story

As the Game Master, you get to work with all the other players to see how the story of the adventure unfolds. While they’ll each play their individual heroes, you’ll assume the role of all the monsters, villagers, and other characters that they encounter. You decide how those people and monsters act, what they do in combat, and what intriguing clues they might give to the heroes. You’ll also describe each area the heroes explore so the other players can imagine the setting and decide how their heroes respond to what’s going on around them. These are the tools you use to help shape the story with the other players.

It’s important to remember that you’re not playing against the other players. This is a game where everyone wins if everyone has a fun time. Monsters are meant to be defeated, and treasure is there to be found. Try to make the players feel like they have earned their success without being too tough on the heroes they’re playing.

Getting Started.name: 开始 Getting Started
Getting Started.text:
踏入奇幻冒险的精彩世界！《Pathfinder新手包》包含了你学习如何游玩《Pathfinder》角色扮演游戏所需的一切，包括创建你自己的奇幻英雄的规则，以及创作你自己的精彩故事的工具。

欢迎来到《Pathfinder新手包》！本模组从零开始构建，旨在为你提供对《Pathfinder》第二版游戏系统既简明又详尽的入门介绍，同时也会说明如何在Foundry Virtual Tabletop中充分发挥其各项功能。随着你推进《奥塔里地下的威胁》冒险，你所阅读的日志条目将为你提供从游戏规则到软件使用的各类指导。

从哪开始？

本模组的大部分内容都彼此紧密链接，这意味着你不必过于担心阅读顺序。如果某些内容与当前页面相关，我们会尽量提供链接，因此在任何时候，你通常都只需点击一下就能获得所需的上下文。不过，直接一头扎进去仍可能让人望而生畏，因此这里提供一些推荐的起点！

  • 如果你是Foundry新手，那么左侧的一些选项卡会说明如何使用本冒险中包含的各类内容。

  • 如果你想了解更多《Pathfinder》第二版系统的规则，那么@UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.pgOC3zCWvUFGiuTj]{什么是角色扮演游戏？}这篇日志将引导你掌握关键概念与核心思路。

  • 如果你想直接开始《奥塔里地下的威胁》冒险，那么你只需要召集一些玩家，并查阅@UUID[JournalEntry.qFSLpCM2cpRQWCR2.JournalEntryPage.UP1WB6tI0SFgMMzC]{介绍}了解如何开始。也别忘了把@UUID[JournalEntry.KIpNnMtah73eyPC8]{创建你的角色}这篇日志分享给你的玩家！

  • 如果你还没有组到团，单人冒险@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-beginner-box.adventures.5KQWZpnK28WGytlL]{海贼王的财宝}会是一个很好的入门选择，让你能循序渐进地投入行动。

文件夹与组织

虽然本模组的大部分内容是为游戏主持人（GM）设计的，但其中仍有大量对玩家也很有用的信息与指引！每个选项卡中的文件夹都已用颜色进行标记，以指示谁可以查看其内容。若文件夹带有红色色调，则所有玩家都可见。若文件夹未分配颜色，则仅包含参考资料（如致谢或法律信息）。若文件夹为绿色，则其中信息仅GM可见。



原文:

Take the first step into an amazing world of fantasy adventure! The Pathfinder Beginner Box contains everything you need to learn how to play the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, including rules to create your own fantasy hero and tools to make your own amazing stories.

Welcome to the Pathfinder Beginner Box! This module has been constructed from the ground up to provide you with a simple but detailed introduction to the Pathfinder Second Edition game system, as well as how to make the most out of its features in Foundry Virtual Tabletop. As you progress through the Menace Under Otari adventure, the Journal Entries you read will provide you with instructions on everything from game rules to software usage.

Where to start?

Most of the contents of this module are heavily interlinked, which means that you don't need to worry too much about reading something out of order. If something is relevant, we'll try to link to it, so you should always only be a click away from context at any point. However, it can be daunting to just dive in, so here are some recommended starting points!

  • If you're new to Foundry, then some of the tabs on the left hand side will explain how to use the various types of content included in this adventure.

  • If you'd like to learn more about the rules of the Pathfinder Second Edition system, then the @UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.pgOC3zCWvUFGiuTj]{What's a Roleplaying Game?} journal exists to walk you through the key concepts and ideas.

  • If you'd like to dive right in to the Menace Under Otari adventure, then all you need to do is gather up some players and consult the @UUID[JournalEntry.qFSLpCM2cpRQWCR2.JournalEntryPage.UP1WB6tI0SFgMMzC]{Introduction} to see how to get started. Make sure to share the @UUID[JournalEntry.KIpNnMtah73eyPC8]{Creating Your Hero} journal with your players, as well!

  • If you don't have a group yet, the solo adventure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-beginner-box.adventures.5KQWZpnK28WGytlL]{Pirate King's Plunder} can be a great introduction to ease you into the action.

Folders and Organisation

While most of this module was designed to be read by the Gamemaster, there is still plenty of useful information and instruction in this module for players! The folders in each tab have been color-coded to indicate who can see their contents. If the folder has a red hue it is visible to all players. If the folder has no color assigned, it contains reference material only (such as credits or legal information). If the folder is green, it contains information that is visible to GMs only.

Informational Boxes.name: 信息栏 Informational Boxes
Informational Boxes.text:
为了让一切井然有序，右侧「日志条目」侧边栏标签中的日志，采用了标准化的「框中文本」写法来编排，以便更容易上手。以下是贯穿全文所使用之规范样式的示例：

这是一个叙事框。在奥塔里地下的威胁 Menace Under Otari冒险中，看起来像这样的文字通常是给游戏主持人读给玩家听的。

Foundry VTT 建议

这是最常用的提示框之一；看起来像这样的框会提供与你使用 Foundry VTT 功能相关的专门指引。

遭遇

看起来像这样的框包含对玩家角色而言危险的生物或威胁的参考信息，以及用于协助主持遭遇的战术与建议。通常，这个框的顶部会包含指向相关「行动者」角色卡的动态链接，便于你快速查阅角色数据或进行掷骰。

财宝

财宝文本框包含对特殊物品与货品的摘要，用以在玩家取得成功后给予奖励，并且通常出现在一次遭遇之后。你会发现其中大多数会链接到一种称为「战利品角色卡」（Loot Sheet）的特殊行动者卡片类型，其中包含所有要分配的特殊物品与现金。

To keep everything organized, the Journals contained on the Journal Entry Sidebar tab on the right were built with a standardized approach to 'box text' to make it easier to learn. The following are examples of the codified styles used throughout:

This is a Narrative box. Within the Menace Under Otari adventure, text which looks like this is usually intended to be read aloud to the players by the Gamemaster.

Foundry VTT Advice

One of the most commonly used call-outs, a box which looks like this one will give you instructions specific to using features of Foundry VTT.

Encounters

A box which looks like this one contains references to creatures or threats that are dangerous to the player characters, as well as tactics and advice for how to facilitate the encounter. Usually, the top of the box will contain a dynamic link to relevant Actor sheets so that you can quickly reference character stats or make rolls.

Treasure

Treasure text boxes contain a summary of special items and goods to reward your players for their successes, and usually follow an encounter. You will find that most of these link to a special type of Actor Sheet called a "Loot Sheet" which contains all the special items and currency to be shared.

Preparing an Adventure.name: 准备一场冒险 Preparing an Adventure
Preparing an Adventure.text:
在您主持一场游戏之前，您需要准备好团队将要进行的冒险。冒险是一组自成一体的故事元素、角色与场景，这些将成为您和其他玩家共同讲述故事的基础。把冒险当作故事的大纲即可。您会有想要纳入的主要情节点、一些固定会登场的角色，以及希望传达的主题，但在把大纲变成完整故事的过程中，各种事情都可能发生变化！

共同术语 Common Terms

以下术语用于描述某些常见的游戏元素。

挑战 Challenge: 挑战是一个短场景，用来考验英雄们。这可能是与怪物战斗、追逐小偷，或设法通过致命陷阱等。

遭遇 Encounter: 遭遇是一场战斗，以一系列轮次进行，各个生物在自己的回合中执行动作。

探索 Exploration: 在遭遇之间，英雄们会进行探索。通常这表示探索某个环境，但他们也可能在探索社交情境、谜题或其他事物。

团期 Session: 团期是一次游戏时段，从大约2小时到整个周末不等。在一个团期中，您可能会完成整个冒险，也可能只完成其中一部分。

冒险 Adventure: 冒险是英雄们经历的一段故事。它由一系列探索构成，并由一系列遭遇穿插分隔。冒险可能需要一个或多个团期才能完成。

战役 Campaign: 战役是用来描述英雄们所经历全部冒险的术语。这些冒险可能彼此相关，但并非每个冒险都必须与同一个宏大主线情节相连。

冒险的类型 Types of Adventures

冒险可以用不同方式构建。线性冒险有一条固定路径，一个遭遇引出下一个遭遇。非线性冒险则是创建一个有多条路径的环境，让英雄们能以任意顺序探索。最后，沙盒式冒险发生在广阔的环境中，由玩家自行设定目标。对于您的第一次冒险，建议从简单开始：选择完全线性的冒险，或只有少量可选路径的冒险。

预写冒险 Prewritten Adventures

@UUID[JournalEntry.qFSLpCM2cpRQWCR2]冒险已经为您完成了大量准备工作。只要阅读该冒险，并查看新手包中的材料，您就有足够的准备来主持这场冒险了。《奥塔里地下的威胁》以及其他预写冒险，都是为特定等级的团队打造的。它们包含故事所需的开场设定信息与非玩家角色（NPC），以及所有地点、地图和怪物群；同时也会给出适当数量的XP与宝藏。把预写冒险作为您的第一场游戏，可以帮助您了解冒险的结构；若您之后想自己编写冒险，这会让过程更容易。即便出版的冒险是预先写好的，其事件也不是板上钉钉。为了迎合您的团队而调整冒险细节不仅没问题，而且是更推荐的做法！调整内容，让冒险更能吸引您的玩家，并以能让玩家开心的方式为冒险增添内容。

撰写冒险 Writing an Adventure

当您编写自己的冒险时，您需要做更多准备：挑选怪物、绘制地图，并构思生活在世界中的NPC。这会占用您更多时间，但也能让您按团队需求定制游戏。如果您有兴趣，请翻到@UUID[.UyPEle3d3z9ncJzy]，获取创作原创冒险的指导！



原文:

Before you can run a game, you need to prepare the adventure your group will play through. An adventure is a self-contained collection of story elements, characters, and settings that become the basis for the story you and the other players tell. Think of the adventure as an outline for your story. You’ll have major plot points you want to include, some consistent characters, and themes you want to convey, but all sorts of things can change during the process of turning the outline into a completed story!

Common Terms

The following terms are used to describe certain common game elements.

Challenge: A challenge is one short scene that puts the heroes to the test. This could be anything from fighting a monster to chasing a thief or getting past a deadly trap.

Encounter: An encounter is a combat that plays out in a series of rounds with creatures taking actions in turn.

Exploration: Between encounters, heroes are exploring. Usually, this means exploring an environment, but they might explore a social situation, a puzzle, or something else.

Session: A session is a single period of gaming, ranging from about 2 hours up to an entire weekend. In a session, you might complete a whole adventure or just part of one.

Adventure: An adventure is one story that the heroes experience. It’s made up of a series of explorations broken up by a series of encounters. Adventures might take one or more sessions to complete.

Campaign: Campaign is a term used to describe all of the adventures that the heroes experience. The adventures might relate to one another, but not all of the adventures have to be tied into the same overarching plot.

Types of Adventures

Adventures can be structured in different ways. A linear adventure has a set path with one encounter leading to another. A nonlinear adventure involves creating an environment with multiple paths the heroes can explore in any order. Finally, a sandbox adventure takes place over a wide environment with the players setting their own goals. For your first adventures, start simple with either a fully linear adventure or one with only a small number of optional paths.

Prewritten Adventures

The @UUID[JournalEntry.qFSLpCM2cpRQWCR2]{Menace Under Otari} adventure has much of the preparation done for you. Reading the adventure and looking over the materials in the Beginner Box gives you enough preparation to run that adventure. “Menace Under Otari” and other prewritten adventures are built for groups of a specific level. They include setup information and nonplayer characters (NPCs) needed for the story, plus all the locations, maps, and monster groups; they also give out the appropriate amount of XP and treasure. Running one as your first game can help you see how adventures are structured, which makes it easier to write your own later if you choose. Though a published adventure is prewritten, its events aren’t set in stone. Changing the details of an adventure to suit your group isn’t just OK, it’s preferred! Adjust things to make the adventure appeal to your players more, and add to the adventure in ways that will make your players happy.

Writing an Adventure

When writing your own adventures, you’ll need to prepare further by picking monsters, drawing maps, and coming up with NPCs that live in the world. This takes more time on your part but also lets you customize your game to your group. If you're interesting, turn to @UUID[.UyPEle3d3z9ncJzy]{Creating Your Own} for guidance on creating original adventures!

As the Game Master, it’s up to you to set the difficulty classes (DCs) for checks that don’t already say what the DC is. Most adventures include the most important DCs in them, but the players will improvise and try things the adventure writer didn’t think of! Always base the DC on how hard the task is, regardless of how good at it the heroes are. Sometimes the players will attempt something that’s really easy for them, and that’s okay!

If the DC is for something with a level, like a spell or item, see Level-Based DCs below.

Table 10-4: Simple DCs

You can select a simple DC from the table below by estimating which proficiency rank best matches the task (that rank isn't required to succeed at the task, just used for guidance).

• If pretty much anyone would have a decent chance, use the untrained DC.

• If anyone with some training has a solid chance, use the trained DC.

• If someone has to be highly skilled, use the expert DC.

• If this task is highly unlikely for a hero to be able to achieve, use the master DC.

Rules Disputes.text:
作为GM，你负责裁定并解决任何关于规则的问题或争议。请记住，让你的游戏保持推进比做到100%正确更重要。在桌上查规则可能会拖慢游戏进度，因此在许多情况下，做出你认为最合理的判断，往往比翻遍书本寻找精确条文更好。为了便于临场裁决，请使用以下指导原则。

• 如果你不知道一个快速任务需要多长时间，就当作1个动作；若该角色不应能在每轮内做三次，则改为2个动作。

• 如果你不确定某个任务应使用什么动作，就寻找最相近的基础动作作为参考。

• 当双方彼此对抗时，让一方掷骰对抗另一方的DC。不要让双方都掷骰（先攻是此规则的例外）。通常应由正在采取行动的角色来掷骰，豁免检定则例外。

• 若角色所做之事提高或降低了成功的机会，则给予+1环境加值或-1环境减值。

• 如果你不知道英雄尝试某事应使用哪种检定，就选择最合适的技能。

• 当英雄完成了值得一提、但规则中并未已规定给予XP的事迹时，根据其属于轻微或中等成就来奖励XP（10到30 XP）。

• 当英雄在任务中失败时，尝试寻找一种“向前失败”的方式：也就是让故事仍然推进，但附带负面后果，而不是让失败完全阻断进展。



原文:

As the GM, you're responsible for resolving any questions or disputes about the rules. Remember that keeping your game moving is more important than being 100% correct. Looking up rules at the table can slow the game down, so in many cases, it's better to make your best guess rather than scour the book for the exact rule. To make calls on the fly, use the following guidelines.

• If you don't know how long a quick task takes, go with 1 action, or 2 actions if a character shouldn't be able to perform it three times per round.

• If you're not sure what action a task uses, look for the most similar basic action.

• When two sides are opposed, have one roll against the other's DC. Don't have both sides roll (initiative is the exception to this rule). The character who should roll is the one acting, except in the case of saving throws.

• If something a character does raises or lowers the chances of success, grant a +1 circumstance bonus or a -1 circumstance penalty.

• If you don't know what check to use for something a hero is attempting, pick the most appropriate skill.

• When a hero accomplishes something noteworthy that doesn't have already give XP, award them XP for a minor or moderate accomplishment (10 to 30 XP).

• When the heroes fail at a task, look for a way they might fail forward, meaning the story moves forward with a negative consequence rather than the failure halting progress entirely.
Rules Disputes.name: 规则争议 Rules Disputes

Ending Encounters.text:
一场遭遇通常会在一方的所有生物都被杀死或被击至昏迷时结束。一旦发生这种情况，你就可以停止按先攻顺序行动——除非有任何英雄正处于濒死状态，或处在其他每一刻都关系到其生存的情境中。

  • 投降：当一方几乎所有成员都被击败，或法术与技能彻底打击了他们的士气时，一方可能会投降。一旦有人投降，就退出先攻顺序，让英雄们进行一段简短的谈判，看看胜利者是否会手下留情。

  • 逃跑：让敌人逃跑可能会带来问题。英雄 Heroes往往想追击逃跑的敌人，因为他们认为敌人之后可能会回来构成威胁。如果你按每一轮来跑这段追逐，你的游戏很快就会变得无聊！相反，询问任何想追击逃敌的人：他们打算如何追击。若他们使用了看起来非常有帮助的能力或法术，并且他们的速度并未比逃跑的敌人慢太多，那么他们就能追上敌人。否则，除非敌人的速度比英雄们慢很多，不然敌人就会暂时逃脱。

如果英雄决定逃跑，通常最好让他们逃走。选择地图上的一个特定地点，并允许他们在全都触及该地点后逃脱。

绕过的遭遇

如果你计划了一场战斗或挑战，而英雄们找到了完全避开的方法，会发生什么？这可能会让他们在XP上落后，或导致他们错过重要信息或宝藏。

在XP方面，指南很简单：如果英雄们用聪明的思考与规划避开了挑战，就给予他们本应获得的正常XP！如果他们做的事更像是走运，比如发现一条能绕过战斗的秘密通道，那么改为给予他们因一次轻微或中等成就而获得的XP。

如果信息或物品被跳过，就在冒险中的其他合理位置重新安置信息或物品。如果合理，将原本的遭遇移到冒险的另一部分，并在英雄们触及该遭遇时给予他们一个重大优势，因为他们绕过了原本的遭遇。



原文:

An encounter typically ends when all the creatures on one side are killed or knocked unconscious. Once this happens, you can stop acting in initiative order—unless any heroes are dying or in some other situation where every moment matters for their survival.

  • Surrender: One side might surrender when almost all its members are defeated or if spells or skills thoroughly demoralize them. Once there’s a surrender, come out of initiative order and have the heroes enter into a short negotiation to see whether the winners show mercy.

  • Escape: Having enemies flee can cause problems. Heroes often want to pursue foes that flee because they think an enemy might return as a threat later on. If you run this round-by-round, your game will get boring quickly! Instead, ask anyone who wants to pursue their fleeing enemy how they pursue. If they use an ability or spell that seems really helpful, and if their Speed isn’t much slower than the escaping enemy, they catch the enemy. If not, the enemy escapes for now unless it’s much slower than the heroes.

If the heroes decide to flee, it’s usually best to let them do so. Pick a particular location on the map and allow them to escape once they all reach it.

Bypassed Encounters

What happens if you plan a fight or challenge and the heroes find a way to avoid it entirely? This could leave them behind on XP or cause them to miss important information or treasure.

In the case of XP, the guidelines are simple: If the heroes avoided the challenge with smart thinking and planning, award them the normal XP they would have received! If they did something that was more of a lucky break, like finding a secret passage past the fight, instead award them XP for a minor or moderate accomplishment.

If information or items get skipped, look for another reasonable place elsewhere in the adventure to place the information or item. If it makes sense, move the original encounter to another part of the adventure and give the heroes a major advantage when they reach that encounter since they bypassed the original encounter.

Weather.text:
天气可以与 @UUID[.AJZOnRliAzq7nbDM]{环境} 结合，用来营造氛围或让遭遇更令人难忘。天气会根据严重程度，对某些检定施加 -1 到 -4 的环境减值。

雾

雾会对视觉察觉检定施加环境减值：轻雾为 -1，浓雾为 -2。透过明显浓厚的雾观察到的生物具有 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽} 状态。你决定这种隐蔽的距离，但通常轻雾约为 30 英尺，浓雾约为 15 英尺。

降水

降水包括雨、雪、雨夹雪与冰雹。湿性降水会浇熄火焰，而冻结降水会在地面形成积雪或结冰区域。毛毛雨或小雪除了能见度受限外，几乎没有其他机制效果。

大多数降水会对基于视觉的察觉检定施加环境减值，通常为 -1 的环境减值；较强的降水则为 -2。冰雹往往更稀疏但噪声很大，改为对基于听觉的察觉检定造成 -2 的环境减值。特别强的降水（例如暴雨或大雪）可能会使远处的生物变为隐蔽。

雷暴

许多雷暴伴随着强风与强降水。此外，在暴风雨期间，生物被闪电击中的概率非常小。一次闪电打击通常造成 [[/r 5d6 #electricity]] 电击伤害。

气温

在大多数地方，即使非常寒冷或炎热，天气本身也不会主动构成危险。然而，华氏 105º 及以上或华氏 12º 及以下的气温可能有害！在华氏 105º 至 114º 的气温中每逗留 1 小时，生物承受 [[/r 1d6 #fire]] 火焰伤害。在华氏 -21º 至 12º 的气温中每逗留 1 小时，生物承受 [[/r 1d6 #cold]] 寒冷伤害。超出这些范围的气温对 1–3 级角色来说过于危险。

风

风会对用来听的察觉检定，以及诸如箭矢等实体远程攻击施加减值。该环境减值在微风时为 -1，在较强的风时为 -2。强烈的风暴甚至会使实体远程攻击无法进行！风会吹灭手持火焰。特别强的风可能要求生物每次尝试移动时都必须成功通过一次 DC 15 的运动检定。若失败，该生物在该动作中不会移动；若大失败，它会被击退 5 英尺并倒地。任何中等或强风，对逆风飞行的怪物而言都属于困难地形。



原文:

Weather can be combined with @UUID[.AJZOnRliAzq7nbDM]{Environments} to establish a mood or to make more memorable encounters. Weather can impose circumstance penalties on certain checks, from -1 to -4 based on severity.

Fog

Fog imposes a circumstance penalty on visual Perception checks: -1 for light fog or -2 for heavy fog. Creatures viewed through significantly thick fog have the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition. You decide the distance of that concealment, but it’s usually around 30 feet for a light fog and 15 feet for a heavy fog.

Precipitation

Precipitation includes rain, snow, sleet, and hail. Wet precipitation douses flames, and frozen precipitation can create areas of snow or ice on the ground. Drizzle or light snowfall has little mechanical effect beyond limited visibility.

Most forms of precipitation impose circumstance penalties on vision-based Perception checks, usually a -1 circumstance penalty or -2 for heavier precipitation. Hail often is sparser but loud, instead causing a -2 circumstance penalty on hearing-based Perception checks. Especially heavy precipitation, such as a downpour of rain or heavy snow, might make creatures concealed if they’re far away.

Thunderstorms

High winds and heavy precipitation accompany many thunderstorms. There’s also a very small chance that a creature might be struck by lightning during a storm. A lightning strike usually deals [[/r 5d6 #electricity]] electricity damage.

Temperature

In most places, even if it’s very cold or hot, the weather isn’t actively dangerous. However, temperatures of 105º F and above or 12º F or below can be harmful! For every hour spent in temperatures from 105º to 114º, a creature takes [[/r 1d6 #fire]] fire damage. For every hour spent in temperatures from -21º to 12º, a creature takes [[/r 1d6 #cold]] cold damage. Temperatures beyond those ranges are too dangerous for characters of levels 1-3.

Wind

Wind imposes a penalty on Perception checks to hear and on physical ranged attacks such as arrows. This circumstance penalty is -1 for a weak wind or -2 for a stronger wind. Powerful windstorms can make physical ranged attacks impossible! Wind snuffs out handheld flames. Particularly strong winds might require a creature to succeed at a DC 15 Athletics check each time it attempts to move. On a failure, the creature doesn’t move on that action, and on a critical failure, it’s knocked back 5 feet and falls prone. Any moderate or strong wind is difficult terrain for a flying monster moving against the wind.
Weather.name: 天气 Weather

Differences.name: 不同点 Differences
Differences.text:
《Pathfinder新手包》在其印刷版中，为了让新用户更容易上手，简化了Pathfinder系统中的许多规则。

然而，Foundry Virtual Tabletop 的《Pathfinder第二版》游戏系统同样为了让新手与老手都能更顺畅地进行游戏，自动化了许多游戏机制，以精简游戏流程。

在转换这些内容时，我们意识到，使用新手包规则反而会让新用户的游戏体验变得更复杂，因为他们会发现系统正在应用一些他们从未听说过的规则。相对地，当系统的自动化能够取代运行游戏时那些细碎繁琐的细节时，我们也认为对规则进行简化并没有那么必要。

为了为游戏主持人和玩家提供尽可能最佳的游戏体验，我们决定尝试与《Pathfinder第二版》系统进行整合，并在必要时对新手包的原文进行修订，以打造一个连贯统一的体验。因此，这些日志条目的内容并非对照PDF或印刷版新手包中《游戏主持人指南》或《英雄》手册所述规则文本的逐字对应复制。若您更希望使用原始资料中呈现的新手包规则，购买本产品也会提供对这些文本PDF副本的访问权限。

《奥塔里地下的威胁》与《海盗王的财宝》的冒险文本保持不变，除了那些指导用户如何使用 Foundry VTT 的《Pathfinder第二版》游戏系统的内容。



原文:

The Pathfinder Beginner Box, in its print form, simplifies many of the rules of the Pathfinder system in the interest of making it easier to get started for new users.

However, the Pathfinder Second Edition game system for Foundry Virtual Tabletop automates many game mechanics in the interest of streamlining gameplay activities for newcomers and veterans alike.

When converting this content, we realised that using the Beginner Box rules would, paradoxically, create a more complicated play experience for new users, as they would find that the system was applying rules that they hadn't heard of. Conversely, we also felt that simplification to the rules was not as necessary when the system's automation was able to supplant some of the nitty-gritty minutia of running the game.

In order to provide the best possible gameplay for Game Masters as well as players, we decided that we would attempt to integrate with the Pathfinder Second Edition system and, where necessary, make revisions to the original text of the Beginner Box in order to create a cohesive and unified experience. As such, the contents of the journal entries are not a one-to-one copy from the rules text outlined in the Game Master's Guide or Heroes Handbook from the PDF or Printed copy of the Beginner box. If you would prefer to use the Beginner Box rules as they are presented in the original source material, the purchase of this product also provides access to PDF copies of those texts.

The adventure text for Menace Under Otari and Pirate King's Plunder remain unchanged, except for places which instruct users on how to use the Pathfinder Second Edition game system for Foundry VTT.

A closed book is special - these lead to an external website outside of your Foundry world, usually to our official Knowledge Base, which contains more in-depth information on how to use Foundry VTT.

Journals

While this module includes characters, artwork, maps, audio, and much more, most of the text of the Beginner Box is contained within journals, which you can find by clicking on the associated tab of your right-hand sidebar (the open book icon). Assuming you completed a full import of all content, the folders are structured as follows:

  • Beginner's Guide - Contains subfolders for Character Creation, Game Mechanics, and Gamemastering which hold the instructions for everything related to running and playing Pathfinder Second Edition.
  • Menace Under Otari - This folder contains the text and artwork needed to run a short adventure designed for up to four players, though clever GMs can increase the difficulty of encounters to accommodate more. The average completion time of the adventure is about two sessions. There is also a subfolder which contains information on the town of Otari, with key locations, NPCs, and even story seeds and quest hooks for any GM that wants to expand the role of the town or use it to run a campaign of their own.
  • Pirate King's Plunder - A simple adventure designed for solo-play as an introduction to Pathfinder lore and adventure content.

Scenes and Maps.text:
本冒险和大多数已出版的冒险一样，是以一系列可供探索的区域与需要面对的挑战来呈现的。每个区域都对应地城地图上的一个地点，并以编号标示。本冒险中的地城由两层组成。

Foundry VTT 建议

 知识库：场景  知识库：地图注记

本模组同时包含 Paizo 的原始地图，以及一些 Foundry 独占的重制版本；这些重制地图由 Narchy Maps 设计，供本冒险使用。你可以选择你觉得最适合你们团的风格。

本模组提供的场景包含每个房间的描述，并以地图注记（Map Notes）的形式钉在地图上。你可以通过工具栏上的“日志注记（Journal Notes）”工具，按下“切换注记显示（Toggle Notes Display）”按钮来确保它们始终可见。关于地图注记的更多信息，请参阅上方链接的“地图注记”文章。

若要在不让玩家看到的情况下提前查看某张地图，请右键点击它并选择“查看场景（view scene）”。这也是个不错的时代，可以把英雄的指示物放在 @UUID[JournalEntry.qFSLpCM2cpRQWCR2.JournalEntryPage.UEuiUcrrPdr9eFqN]{饥饿的巨鼠 Hungry Rats} 的入口附近——他们将从这里开始对地城的探索。当你准备好让玩家加入某个场景时，再次右键点击它，这一次选择“启用（activate）”。 

所有地图都已完整设置墙体，并具备动态光照，会在英雄探索时逐步揭示地图内容。即使玩家看不到整张地图也没关系——他们在进入房间之前不会知道里面有什么。

探索地城

随着游戏进行，玩家将通过在地图上移动他们的指示物来探索地城。每个房间的描述都收录在日志中，并作为地图注记钉在场景对应的房间位置——每当英雄进入一个新的区域时，请参照钉在那里的日志，了解房间描述及其中包含的任何遭遇。

每条记录都以简短的介绍开头，让你知道将会发生什么；接着是以绿色标示、供你朗读的文本。休息的区域文本包含你所需的全部信息，说明英雄在该区域会遇到什么。这些文字包含该房间的剧透——会告诉你英雄在探索该区域时要面对哪些挑战。若该区域包含战斗、陷阱、危害或宝藏，相关规则也都在这段文本中。

当他们穿行于地城各层时，玩家会运用英雄的技能与能力来探索区域并克服障碍。他们很可能会提出问题，并尝试一些规则未涵盖的动作。作为 GM，你可以自行给出答案并决定会发生什么，但务必尽量公平，并记住游戏的目标是让每个人都度过一段愉快的时代。你应该鼓励英雄在学习过程中尝试新事物，但也别忘了：作为新手冒险者，英雄的能力仍然有限。

如果玩家卡关或对下一步该做什么感到困惑，你可以给他们一些提示或点子来帮助他们开始行动，例如：“你们想打开那扇门吗？”或“谁想找找有没有隐藏的宝藏？”也要记得，这也是他们的第一场游戏；如果每个人都能参与其中，他们会玩得更开心。



原文:

This adventure, like most published adventures, is presented as a series of areas to explore and challenges to face. Each one is tied to a location on the map of the dungeon and coded with a number. The dungeon in this adventure consists of two levels.

Foundry VTT Advice

 Knowledge Base: Scenes  Knowledge Base: Map Notes

This module includes both Paizo's original maps as well as some Foundry-exclusive remakes which were designed by Narchy Maps for use with this adventure. You can choose whichever style you feel is right for your table.

The scenes provided in this module include descriptions for each room, pinned as Map Notes. You can ensure they are always visible by pressing the "Toggle Notes Display" button from the Journal Notes tool on the toolbar. For more information about map notes, please see the Map Notes article linked above.

To view a map ahead of time without showing it to your players, right click it and choose "view scene". This is a good time to place down your heroes' tokens near the entrance of @UUID[JournalEntry.qFSLpCM2cpRQWCR2.JournalEntryPage.UEuiUcrrPdr9eFqN]{Hungry Rats}- the point from which they'll begin their exploration of the dungeon. When you're ready for your players to join you on a scene, you'll right-click it again and this time, choose "activate". 

All of the maps are fully walled and feature dynamic lighting which will reveal the map as the heroes explore it. It's OK if the players can't see the entire map- they won't know what's in each room until they enter it.

Exploring the Dungeon

As the game proceeds, the players explore the dungeon by moving their tokens around the map. The descriptions for each room are contained in journals which are pinned as Map Notes to the room on the scene- whenever the heroes enter a new area, refer to the pinned journal for a description of the room and any encounters it contains.

Each entry begins with a brief introduction so you know what to expect, followed by text set in green for you to read aloud. The rest of the area’s text includes all the information you need about what the heroes will come across in this area. This text contains spoilers for the room—it gives you information about the challenges the heroes face as they explore the area. If the area includes combat, traps, hazards, or treasure, the rules for those are in this text.

As they move through the dungeon levels, the players will use their heroes’ skills and abilities to explore the area and overcome its obstacles. It’s likely they’ll have questions and try actions that aren’t covered by the rules. As the GM, you get to make up the answers and decide what happens, but always try to be fair, and remember that the goal of the game is for everyone to have a fun time. You should encourage the heroes to try new things as they learn, but don’t forget that, as new adventurers, their heroes’ abilities are limited.

If the players get stuck or confused about what to do next, you can give them a few hints or ideas to get them started, like “Do you want to open the door?” or “Who wants to look for hidden treasure?” Remember that this is their first game, too, and they will have more fun if everyone is participating.

Audio and Playlists.text:
这个付费内容包包含由 Syrinscape 提供的精彩音频合集的混音，其中包括一些已在场景关键位置便捷放置的环境音源。

环境音 Ambient Sounds

环境音被放置在场景中，当玩家的指示物进入其射程时，会自动向玩家播放音频。它们可用于创建背景氛围音，以增强沉浸感，而无需GM进行繁琐的微操管理。

通常在玩家首次遭遇场景中的环境音时，会有关于如何处理这些环境音的具体说明；但默认你应当清楚何时有环境音在播放，并在适当时机通过右键单击将其禁用。

你知道吗？ Did you know?

侧边栏中的播放列表分页可以通过右键单击其图标（音符图标）便捷地弹出为独立窗口。

播放列表 Playlists

其他声音以播放列表的形式提供，你可以精确控制它们何时、何地播放，以最佳方式营造气氛、为玩家提供音频提示，或对游戏事件作出响应。

作为GM，你应该花几分钟熟悉播放列表选项卡中可用的声音，这样你就知道在整个冒险过程中有哪些声音可供使用。下面还提供了关于如何使用所附播放列表的额外指引。

本模组中的播放列表 Playlists In This Module

知识库：播放列表

曲目列表及其预期用途如下：

环境音

  • 探索循环 Exploration Loops（同时播放）- 包含轻微循环的音频，用于为探索行为增添氛围。它们可以单独播放，但点击播放该播放列表会同时激活三个音轨，从而提供一套声景：地下空间的微弱低频嗡鸣、间歇性的潮湿滴水声（暗示海边洞穴结构），以及啮齿动物的吱吱声与抓挠声。
  • 第一层探索环境音 Floor 1 Exploration Ambience - 此播放列表仅包含一个音频文件：循环的戏剧性钢琴音符串，用于为潜行式探索增添音乐主题。最好与其他环境音播放列表配合使用。
  • 第二层探索环境音 Floor 2 Exploration Ambience - 此播放列表仅包含一个音频文件：循环的嗡鸣声，旨在传达探索更深地下洞穴的感觉。最好与其他环境音播放列表配合使用。
  • 第二层美人鱼喷泉 Floor 2 Mermaid Fountain - 微弱而不祥的嗡鸣与放大的流水声；当与场景中流水的环境音一同使用时，应能向玩家提供清晰的音频提示：喷泉可能出了问题，而且很危险。
  • 第二层浸水的路口 Floor 2 Soggy Crossroads - 当玩家进入二层不久后突破路障、并在靠近水域时使用该播放列表。它将第一层的微弱探索钢琴声与厚重的流水声混合在一起。
  • 奥塔里渔场 Otari Fishery - 该音轨旨在传达一个繁忙喧闹的场所：供应饮品与游戏，并伴有工人劳作的声音。玩家与塔米莉交谈时使用。
  • 奥塔里码头 Otari Wharf - 海鸟与海浪的混合音景，将玩家的想象引向海滨小镇的声音。
  • 音板循环 Soundboard Loops - 这是一个包含循环曲目的音板，可用于营造特定音效。例如，在与煤渣鼠 Cinder Rat的遭遇中，你可能希望播放“Everything is Fire”直至老鼠被击败；或者当玩家突破第一道路障向北探索时，你可能希望开始播放“邪恶的死者 The Malevolent Dead”。

音效 Sound Effects

  • 路障 Barricades - 这些是玩家移除路障时触发的音效曲目；若玩家错过聆听，也可以从此处重放。
  • 巨龙音板 Dragon Soundboard - 供玩家进入蘑菇洞穴 Mushroom Grotto时使用；这些音效能用来暗示巨龙的存在，并在战斗开始后播放巨龙攻击或受伤的声音。
  • 煤渣鼠 The Cinder Rat - 当煤渣鼠 Cinder Rat在@UUID[JournalEntry.qFSLpCM2cpRQWCR2.JournalEntryPage.7Ko4GJeI1K3Vy1Xp]中的球体里爆出时所播放的音效。


原文:

This premium content package includes audio mixed from the awesome sound collection provided by Syrinscape, including some conveniently placed Ambient Audio sources that are placed in key locations on the scene.

Ambient Sounds

Ambient Sounds are placed onto a scene, and will automatically play audio to players whose tokens are within their range. These can be used to create background atmospheric sounds that enhance immersion without needing micromanagement from the Gamemaster.

There will usually be specific instructions for how to handle the on-scene Ambient Sounds when your players first encounter them, but there is an expectation that you will know when an ambient sound is playing and disable it by right-clicking when appropriate. 

Did you know?

The playlists tab in the sidebar can be conveniently popped out into its own window by right-clicking its icon (the music note) in the sidebar.

Playlists

Other sounds are included as Playlists, which allow you to control exactly when and where they play in order to best set the mood, give your players audio cues, or respond to the events of the game.

As Gamemaster, you should take a few moments to familiarize yourself with the available sounds in the Playlists tab, so that you know which ones are available for your use throughout the adventure. Additional guidance on using the included playlists is included below.

Playlists In This Module

 Knowledge Base: Playlists

The tracklist and their intended uses are as follows:

Ambience

  • Exploration Loops (Simultaneous) - contains subtly looping audio to add some atmosphere to the act of exploring. They can be played individually, but clicking play on the playlist activates all three simultaneously, providing a soundscape with a faint bass drone of being underground, periodic wet drips to indicate a seaside cavern structure, and the sounds of rodents chittering and scratching.
  • Floor 1 Exploration Ambience - This playlist only contains a single audio file, a looping string of dramatic piano notes to add some musical themes of sneaky exploration. It is best used in conjunction with other ambience playlists.
  • Floor 2 Exploration Ambience - This playlist only contains a single audio file, a looping drone meant to convey the feeling of exploring a cavern deeper underground. It is best used in conjunction with other ambience playlists.
  • Floor 2 Mermaid Fountain - a faint ominous drone and amplified sounds of running water which, when coupled with the on-scene Ambient sounds of water running should provide a clear audio cue to players that something might be wrong and dangerous with the fountain.
  • Floor 2 Soggy Crossroads - This playlist should be used when players breach the barricade shortly after entering the second floor, as they near the water. It mixes the faint exploration piano from the first floor with heavy sounds of running water.
  • Otari Fishery - The goal of this track is to convey the sounds of a busy and bustling establishment, with drink and games served and the sounds of workers. It should be used when the players speak with Tamily.
  • Otari Wharf - A mix of sea birds and ocean waves to draw the players imagination to the sounds of a seaside town.
  • Soundboard Loops - This is a soundboard containing looping tracks which can be drawn upon to evoke particular sound effects. For example, during the encounter with the Cinder Rat you may wish to play the "Everything is Fire" track until the rat is defeated, or when your players breach the first barricade to explore northward, you may wish to begin playing "The Malevolent Dead".

Sound Effects

  • Barricades - these are the sound effect tracks which occur when players are removing the barricades, and can be replayed from here if the players miss out on hearing them.
  • Dragon Soundboard - Intended for use while players move into the Mushroom Grotto, these effects allow you to indicate the presence of a dragon and then, as combat begins, the sounds of the dragon attacking or being injured.
  • The Cinder Rat - The sound effect which plays when the Cinder Rat explodes out of the orb in @UUID[JournalEntry.qFSLpCM2cpRQWCR2.JournalEntryPage.7Ko4GJeI1K3Vy1Xp]{Area 14: Elements of Chaos}

Creating Your Own Adventure.name: 创建你自己的冒险 Creating Your Own Adventure
Creating Your Own Adventure.text:
亲自构建你自己的冒险，比起使用已出版的内容更具挑战；但它能让你更好地表达自我、投入更多创意，并将游戏直接调整为贴合玩家与他们的英雄！

即使你正在使用预写的冒险，你也可以运用这些指导原则来改动故事以符合你的偏好，或在该冒险结束后继续推进游戏。

构建一场战役

仅仅因为一段冒险结束了，并不代表整场游戏就必须结束！你可以让同一群玩家与英雄在持续进行的战役中继续前进。战役是彼此相连的一系列冒险。你可以根据至今发生的事件来构建新的冒险，或改编预写的冒险。

若你能在不同冒险之间延续部分NPC、主题与反派，战役通常会运作得更好。举例来说，在《奥塔里之下的威胁》之后，你可以使用@UUID[Scene.c7E7PXzgT5RBkT7S]{奥塔里 Otari}章节来获取一些点子，作为你下一段冒险的内容。你也可以通过《探路者冒险》书籍《奥塔里疑云》（Troubles in 奥塔里 Otari）或三册制的冒险 Path《畸变魔窟》（Abomination Vaults）为你的战役取得更多冒险。

故事

当你决定构建一段冒险时，首先为它想出一个基础剧情或主题。把这一步想成是在为一出戏选角，而不是把每一幕都写死。你在挑选敌人、地点与能发生酷炫事件的舞台，但只有在游戏过程中与其他玩家即兴互动，你才会发现究竟发生了什么！

冒险的剧情规划可以从许多不同的起点开始。你可能从一个特定的对立者着手，然后构建一段符合该反派主题、并引导队伍走向对方的冒险。或者，你也可以先从一个适合探索的有趣地点开始，再为其填入与该设定相称的敌人与挑战。

如果你卡在灵感上，就掷[[/r 1d8]]并在下表查找结果！你可以按自己的喜好随意自定义与改动这些点子。

[[/r 1d8]]

剧情线

1

镇上的水源里有什么东西让动物变得野性暴走。英雄们必须旅行到山中洞穴里的河流源头，抓住负责这一切的普格旺皮小鬼（pugwampi）格雷姆林。

2

矮人矿工被卷入兽人要塞与一群地精部族联盟的争斗交火之中，他们需要有人出面谈判，或处理矿坑中的危险。

3

当地博物馆馆藏中的一个古怪谜题盒每晚都会冒出一对暗影，它们似乎迫切地想找到打开这只邪恶盒子的方法。

4

一名喜欢喂下水道老鼠的当地人担心它们变得具有攻击性。一只下水道软泥怪占据了老鼠的巢穴，把它们赶了出来。

5

某庄园的住户接连遭到谋杀；该庄园的主人最近继承了数件古董护甲，而其中一套其实是活化护甲。

6

一位贵族雇佣英雄去猎杀一只巨魔（特征），以便她能开采其洞穴中的稀有矿石。

7

从十字路口方向来的旅人谈起那里有些奇怪的雕像，而且每一次新的目击说法都会让雕像数量增加。附近有一只蛇发女怪（basilisk）建立了巢穴，正把路人变成石头。

8

一名珠宝匠声称狗头人一直在骚扰他，但它们只是想取回一条他从它们那里偷走的坠饰。



原文:

Building your own adventure is more challenging than using a published one, but it lets you express yourself, apply even more creativity, and tailor the game directly to the players and their heroes!

Even if you're using a prewritten adventure, you can also use these guidelines to alter the story to suit your preferences, or to continue the game after the adventure ends.

Building a Campaign

Just because an adventure ends, it doesn’t mean the whole game has to! You can continue with the same group and heroes in an ongoing campaign. A campaign is a connected series of adventures. You can build new adventures based on what has happened so far, or adapt prewritten adventures.

Campaigns work better if you carry forward some NPCs, themes, and villains from adventure to adventure. For example, after Menace under Otari, you can use the @UUID[Scene.c7E7PXzgT5RBkT7S]{Otari} section to get some ideas for what you might include in your next adventure. You can also get more adventures for your campaign with the Pathfinder Adventures book Troubles in Otari or the three-book Adventure Path Abomination Vaults.

The Story

When you decide to build an adventure, first come up with a basic plot or theme for it. Think of this step like casting a play rather than writing out every scene. You’re picking enemies and places where cool things can take place, but only by improvising with the other players during play will you find out what happens!

Adventure plotting can start at many different points. You might begin with a particular antagonist, then construct an adventure that fits that villain’s theme and leads the group to them. Alternatively, you could start with an interesting location for exploration, then populate it with adversaries and challenges appropriate to the setting.

If you’re stuck for ideas, roll [[/r 1d8]] and look up the result on the table below! You can customize and change these ideas however you like.

[[/r 1d8]]

Storyline

1

Something in the town’s water is making animals go feral. The heroes must travel to the river’s source in a mountain cave and apprehend the pugwampi gremlins responsible.

2

Dwarven miners got caught in the crossfire of a squabble between an orc hold and an alliance of goblin tribes, and they need someone to negotiate or take care of the danger in the mines.

3

A pair of shadows emerge each night from a strange puzzle box in the local museum's collection and seem desperate to find a way to open the sinister box.

4

A local who likes to feed the sewer rats is concerned they’ve become aggressive. A sewer ooze has occupied the rats’ home, driving them out.

5

Residents of an estate whose owner recently inherited several pieces of antique armor are found murdered, as one of the suits is actually animated armor.

6

A noble hires the heroes to slay an troll so that she can harvest the rare ore in its cave.

7

Travelers coming from the crossroads speak of strange statues there, the number increasing with every new account. A basilisk has made a lair nearby and is turning wanderers into stone.

8

A jeweler claims kobolds are bothering him, but they’re just trying to reclaim a pendant he stole from them.

Game Sessions.name: 游戏场次 Game Sessions
Game Sessions.text:
你会在一连串团期中演绎一场冒险；这些团期通常会持续数小时，包含多场遭遇以及一定量的探索。每个团期都可能与上一次有显著差异。把一次团期想成电视剧的一集——它应当包含一些转折、变化与新展开，让玩家对接下来会发生什么感到兴奋。

规划一次团期

通常，由于你需要在团期之间为游戏做准备，安排游戏时间的责任往往会落在你这位GM身上。选择一个所有人都能参加的时代，以及一个集合地点——不管是围坐在厨房餐桌旁，还是在一个线上空间中。许多游戏都有固定日程，例如每周一次、每两周一次或每月一次。（不过你们的第一场游戏可能没那么可预测！）你们见面的频率越低，你就越需要更好的笔记与回顾，才能让所有人保持同步。如果有其他玩家愿意做团期笔记，那也很好——尤其是他们建立一个所有人都能在线查阅的共享文档时。

为所有人到场安排一个时代，并尽量也设定一个正式开始游戏的时代。提前规划能让大家更容易完成寒暄与回到状态，从而尽快进入游戏。心里也要有一个结束的时代，这同样重要。一次典型的游戏团期大约持续4小时；少于2小时通常不足以完成多少内容。

开始一次团期

当所有人都准备好开始玩时，集中大家注意力，并掩蔽以下主题。这些主题有一个大致顺序，你可以根据团里的风格或某次团期的需要进行调整。

• 回顾前几次团期发生了什么（如果这不是第一次团期）。

• 确立英雄们在本次团期开始时身在何处。他们自上次挑战后一直在休整吗？还是你们上次停在一条走廊里，正准备突袭地城的下一间房？告知玩家，他们的英雄自上次团期以来是否有时代进行休息或恢复。

• 确立目标。重复队伍原本就有的任何目标，然后让玩家讨论这些目标是否仍然适用，以及他们是否还希望在本次团期中完成其他事情。

• 开始冒险！通常，一次团期的第一件事是描述围绕英雄们的环境与感官细节，让他们能够当下做出反应。

进行一次团期

在一次团期中，你负责推动游戏行动的进行、回答问题，以及做出规则裁决。你也会想要大致关注时代，以便在对团里最方便的时候结束。

你是那个从你与其他玩家共同想象的世界中，挑选并定制你所需要规则的人。世界里什么是真实由你来确立，但你并非孤军奋战！你会受到设定背景故事、你的准备，以及其他玩家建议的启发。你也可以根据现场情况，对原先计划进行临机调整。你笔记里原本的某个想法，可能会因某位玩家做出意料之外的举动而改变。

你将决定英雄与敌人何时需要进行检定，以及他们掷骰结果会引发什么后果——这在探索中最常出现。在遭遇里，玩家通常可以自行决定其英雄的回合如何行动，你只需适时插话，例如告知一次攻击是否命中，或是环境中的某些要素是否需要英雄进行检定。

聚光灯

当你主持游戏时，要留意哪位玩家正处在聚光灯下。你很容易把注意力放在最外向的玩家或英雄身上，但你需要与所有玩家都检定一下。如果某位玩家有一段时代没有贡献内容了，停下来问一句：“你现在的英雄在做什么？”如果该玩家不确定，就在场景里加入一个细节或NPC，让这位玩家可能会感兴趣。

分心与打断

维持玩家注意力能让游戏持续推进，并在所有人都进入状态时创造难忘时刻。打断太多会破坏节奏。有些分心总是会发生，比如桌边的玩笑话，但要确保打断不要过于频繁。把休息安排进游戏流程会有所帮助。一次10分钟的休息，是拿点零食、上洗手间或用手机查点东西的绝佳时代。

结束一次团期

最好在你的团期开始前就规划好结束的时代。当游戏进行时，留意时代。当本次团期还剩大约20分钟时，就开始寻找合适的收尾点。除非你正在完成一场冒险，否则尽量找一个好的悬念点作为结尾：可以是在战斗即将开始之前、英雄得知一条新情报或进入一个新区域的当下，或任何能制造紧张感的节点！

在大家离开前，让他们结算自己的XP。如果总量超过1,000，他们需要在下次团期前等级提升！角色也可以分配宝藏与物品。

在下一次团期之前，你可能需要为冒险的下一阶段做准备。如果这次团期已经结束了这场冒险，就与玩家讨论他们是否想开启一场新的冒险。如果想，就为即将到来的团期开始准备下一场冒险吧！



原文:

You play out an adventure over a series of sessions, which usually last several hours and involve multiple encounters and some exploration. Each session can noticeably differ from the last. Think of a session as an episode of a TV show—  it should include some twists, turns, and changes so that the players are excited about what comes next.

Planning a Session

Often, the responsibility of scheduling the game falls on you as the GM since you have to prepare the game between sessions. Choose a time everyone can attend and a place to gather, whether it's around the kitchen table or in an online space. Many games have a set schedule, such as once per week, once every 2 weeks, or once per month. (Your first game might not be so predictable, though!) The less frequently your group meets, the better notes and recaps you'll need to keep everyone on the same page. If another player wants to take session notes, that's great too, especially if they set up a shared document everyone can reference online.

Plan a time for everybody to arrive, and also try to set a time when playing the game will begin. Having this planned can make it easier for everyone to finish catching up so you can start playing the game. Having an end time in mind is also important. A typical game session lasts about 4 hours. Less than 2 hours usually isn't enough time to get much done.

Starting a Session

Once everyone is ready to play, get everyone's attention and cover the following topics. These are in a rough order that you can change based on your group's style or a session's needs.

• Recap what happened during the previous sessions (if this isn't the first session).

• Establish where the heroes are at the beginning of this session. Have they been resting since their last challenge? Did you leave off with them in a hallway, preparing to raid the next room of a dungeon? Tell players whether their heroes had time to rest or recover since the last session.

• Establish goals. Repeat any goals the group already had, then let the players weigh in on whether these goals still apply and on whether there's anything else they hope to accomplish during the session.

• Commence adventuring! Usually the first thing you'll do in a session is describe the environment and sensations that surround the heroes, allowing them to react in the moment.

Running a Session

During a session, you're in charge of keeping the game's action moving, answering questions, and making rules decisions. You'll also want to keep a rough eye on the time, so you can end when it's most convenient for the group.

You're the one who customizes the rules you need from the imagined world you and the other players share. It's up to you to establish what's true in the world, but you have help in doing so! You're informed by the setting's backstory, your preparations, and the suggestions the other players make. You can adjust things on the fly from what you planned, too. You might have an idea in your notes that changes when a player does something unexpected.

You'll determine when heroes and foes need to attempt checks as well as what happens as a result of their rolls, which comes up most often during exploration. In an encounter, a player can usually determine their own hero's turn with you chiming in only to say whether an attack hits or if something in the environment requires a hero to attempt a check.

The Spotlight

As you run the game, keep track of which player has the spotlight. You can easily keep attention on the most outgoing player or hero, but you need to check in with all the players. If a player hasn't contributed in some time, stop and ask, "What's your hero doing at this point?" If the player isn't sure, add a detail or NPC to the scene that the player might find interesting.

Distractions and Interruptions

Maintaining the players' attention keeps a game moving and leads to memorable moments when everyone's in the zone. Too many interruptions break the flow. Some distractions will always happen, like jokes at the table, but make sure interruptions aren't too frequent. It helps to plan breaks into the game. A 10-minute break is a great time to grab a snack, use the restroom, or look up something on your phone.

Ending a Session

It's best to have a planned end time before your session starts. As your game goes on, keep an eye on the time. When you have around 20 minutes left in your session, start looking for good stopping places. Unless you're finishing up an adventure, try to find a good cliffhanger to end on. This can be just before a fight starts, the moment the heroes find out a new piece of information or enter a new area, or any other point that creates suspense!

Before everybody leaves, have them tally up their XP. They'll need to level up before the next session if it's over 1,000! The characters can also divide treasure and items.

Before your next session, you might need to prepare for the next stage of the adventure. If the adventure concluded this session, talk with the players about whether they want to start a new adventure. If so, start preparing the next adventure for your upcoming session!

Example DCs.name: 示例DC Example DCs
Example DCs.text:
本书的若干部分——尤其是技能 Skills——会提到由你这位GM来为某些检定设定DC，或决定其他参数。以下是最常见任务的指引，并将欺瞒、交涉与威吓归类在“社交技能 Skills”之下。任何难度高于此处所列的情况，使用DC 30的大师 DC。请记住，这些都只是指引，你可以依情况需要进行调整。

保持平衡（特技）

依据角色试图在其上保持平衡的事物，使用@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{简易DC}。

• 未受训：（DC 10）纠结的树根、不平整的鹅卵石路

• 受训：（DC 15）木梁

• 专家：（DC 20）深且松散的碎石

攀爬（运动）

依据角色试图向上或横向攀爬的目标，使用@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{简易DC}。

• 未受训：（DC 10）梯子、低枝树、陡坡

• 受训：（DC 15）船帆索具、绳索、一般的树

• 专家：（DC 20）带有少量可抓握与可踩踏点的墙面

破译文字

DC取决于文本的复杂度与理解难度。若文本以浅白语言书写，英雄无需掷骰即可阅读。

• 受训：（DC 15）入门等级的哲学论著

• 专家：（DC 20）复杂的编码，例如密码

搜集情报（交涉）

为“搜集情报”设定DC时，使用一个代表该主题相关信息可得性的@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{简易DC}。若英雄寻求更深入的资讯，则上调DC。

• 未受训：（DC 10）街谈巷议

• 受训：（DC 15）常见传闻

• 专家：（DC 20）晦涩的流言、看守不严的秘密

鉴定魔法或学习法术

鉴定魔法或学习法术的DC，为该法术或物品的等级对应的@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-5:-level-based-dcs]{基于等级的DC}。

表演（表演）

选择@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{简易DC}时，考虑观众接触艺术的程度：他们有多容易被打动？

• 未受训：（DC 10）平民观众

• 受训：（DC 15）工匠观众

• 专家：（DC 20）商人或小贵族观众

回忆知识

对于大多数主题，你可以用基础DC进行“回忆知识”的检定。若是关于某个具有等级的特定生物、陷阱或其他对象的检定，则使用@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-5:-level-based-dcs]{基于等级的DC}。你也可以下调难度；若对象很有名，甚至可以大幅下调。

• 未受训：（DC 10）统治者、关键贵族或重要神祇的名字

• 受训：（DC 15）某大贵族家族的继承顺位、重要神祇的核心教义

• 专家：（DC 20）某小贵族的家谱、远古祭司的教诲

有时英雄会想在一次“回忆知识”的检定后继续追问，通过再进行一次检定来发现更多资讯。这有时可行，但你应让每次后续尝试的难度提高。一旦英雄尝试过难到离谱的检定，或已经在检定中失败，后续尝试将毫无收获——英雄已经想起了他们对该主题所知的一切。

有关使用“回忆知识”来辨识怪物的资讯，见@UUID[.ZVyi2AkmgpWOHvSq]{生物 Creatures}讲义。

辨别方向（生存）

当有人使用生存来“辨别方向”时，选用最合适的@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{简易DC}。

• 未受训：（DC 10）利用太阳判断基本方位

• 受训：（DC 15）在森林中找到被杂草掩盖的小径

• 专家：（DC 20）在树篱迷宫中导航

社交技能

当英雄用欺瞒、交涉或威吓去影响或打动某人，而你不知道对方的等级或意志 DC时，估算该生物的等级并使用对应DC。平民的等级通常为0或1。不必追求精确。根据目标的态度来调整DC往往也很合理：若该生物更友善，就用一次“容易DC调整”；若他们不喜欢英雄，就用一次“困难DC调整”。记住，NPC不是机器人。如果他们本就不太可能做某件事，你可以让DC更难，甚至设为不可能！

游泳（运动）

依据水流湍急程度使用@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{简易DCs}。

• 未受训：（DC 10）湖泊或其他静水

• 受训：（DC 15）流动的水，例如河流

• 专家：（DC 20）湍急的河流

追踪（生存）

选择一个@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{简易DC}。你可以根据天气、地形与其他因素来调整“追踪”的DC。

• 未受训：（DC 10）一支大军沿道路行军的路线

• 受训：（DC 15）一头暴走熊穿越苔原留下的相对新鲜的足迹

• 专家：（DC 20）敏捷黑豹穿越丛林的足迹、被降雨模糊的足迹



原文:

Several parts of this book, most notably Skills, state that you as the GM set the DCs for certain checks or determine other parameters. Here are guidelines for the most common tasks, with Deception, Diplomacy, and Intimidation grouped together under “Social Skills.” Anything more difficult than what’s listed here uses the Master DC of 30. Remember that all of these are guidelines, and you can adjust them as necessary to suit the situation.

Balance (Acrobatics)

Use @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{Simple DCs} based on what the character is trying to balance across.

• Untrained: (DC 10) tangled roots, uneven cobblestones

• Trained: (DC 15) wooden beam

• Expert: (DC 20) deep, loose gravel

Climb (Athletics)

Use @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{Simple DCs} based on what the character is trying to climb up or across.

• Untrained: (DC 10) ladder, low-branched tree, steep slope

• Trained: (DC 15) rigging, rope, typical tree

• Expert: (DC 20) wall with small handholds and footholds

Decipher Writing

Base the DC on how complex and hard to understand the text is. A hero doesn’t need to roll to read a text that’s written in plain language.

• Trained: (DC 15) entry-level philosophy treatise

• Expert: (DC 20) complex code, such as a cipher

Gather Information (Diplomacy)

To set the DC to Gather Information, use a  @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{Simple DC} representing the availability of information about the subject. Adjust the DC upward if the hero seeks in-depth information.

• Untrained: (DC 10) talk of the town

• Trained: (DC 15) common rumor

• Expert: (DC 20) obscure rumor, poorly guarded secret

Identify Magic or Learn a Spell

The DC to Identify Magic or Learn a Spell is the @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-5:-level-based-dcs]{Level-Based DC} for the spell or item’s level.

Perform (Performance)

Consider the audience’s exposure to the arts when picking the @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{Simple DC}. How easy are they to impress?

• Untrained: (DC 10) audience of commoners

• Trained: (DC 15) audience of artisans

• Expert: (DC 20) audience of merchants or minor nobles

Recall Knowledge

On most topics, you can use simple DCs for checks to Recall Knowledge. For a check about a specific creature, trap, or other subject with a level, use a  @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-5:-level-based-dcs]{Level-Based DC}. You might adjust the difficulty down, maybe even drastically if the subject is famous.

• Untrained: (DC 10) name of a ruler, key noble, or major deity

• Trained: (DC 15) line of succession for a major noble family, core doctrines of a major deity

• Expert: (DC 20) genealogy of a minor noble, teachings of an ancient priest

Sometimes a hero might want to follow up on a check to Recall Knowledge by attempting another check to discover more information. This can sometimes work, but you should adjust the difficulty to be higher for each follow-up attempt. Once a hero has attempted an incredibly hard check or failed a check, further attempts are fruitless—the hero has recalled everything they know about the subject.

Information on using Recall Knowledge to identify monsters is in the @UUID[.ZVyi2AkmgpWOHvSq]{Creatures} handout.

Sense Direction (Survival)

Pick the most appropriate @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{Simple DC} when someone uses Survival to Sense Direction.

• Untrained: (DC 10) determine a cardinal direction using the sun

• Trained: (DC 15) find an overgrown path in a forest

• Expert: (DC 20) navigate a hedge maze

Social Skills

When a hero uses Deception, Diplomacy, or Intimidation to influence or impress someone whose level or Will DC you don’t know, estimate the level of the creature and use that DC. A commoner’s level is usually 0 or 1. Don’t worry about being exact. It often makes sense to adjust the DC based on the target’s attitude, using one of the easy DC adjustments if the creature is more friendly or a hard DC adjustment if they dislike the hero. Remember that NPCs aren’t robots. If they’d be unlikely to do something, you can make the DC harder or even impossible!

Swim (Athletics)

Use @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{Simple DCs} based on how turbulent the water is.

• Untrained: (DC 10) lake or other still water

• Trained: (DC 15) flowing water, like a river

• Expert: (DC 20) swiftly flowing river

Track (Survival)

Pick a @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy#table-10-4:-simple-dcs]{Simple DC}. You can adjust the DC to Track based on weather, terrain, and other factors.

• Untrained: (DC 10) the path of a large army following a road

• Trained: (DC 15) relatively fresh tracks of a rampaging bear across the tundra

• Expert: (DC 20) a nimble panther’s tracks through a jungle, tracks obscured by rainfall

Encounters.name: 遭遇 Encounters
Encounters.text:
遭遇是你冒险中那些重大而戏剧化的节点。它们通常以与其他生物的战斗为主，但也可以包含@UUID[.f82BLxCvoOGIzQ7U]{危害 Hazards}；或者你也可以设计社交挑战，让角色仅凭言辞交锋。本日志包含了如何根据你的小队等级来构建合适的挑战，以及如何主持这些挑战的规则。

有些冒险具有清晰直接的推进方式，挑战会在特定时间点出现，或按特定顺序发生。另一些冒险则是非线性的，例如充满相互连通房间的地城，队伍可以按任意顺序调查；在这种情况下，队伍可以按任意顺序面对挑战——甚至完全避开它们。大多数冒险介于两者之间：既有你知道英雄们必然要面对的关键挑战，也有英雄们可以避开的可选挑战。

遭遇的类型

战斗遭遇

最常见的挑战类型是战斗遭遇，英雄与其他生物交战。在规划你的冒险时，想想哪些生物符合你的故事。它们不一定都要与剧情密切相关；加入一些你觉得用起来很有趣的怪物也完全没问题！也要考虑你的玩家：根据他们的个性，加入你认为他们会喜欢对抗的怪物。

当你为你的冒险挑选遭遇时，记下每个遭遇出现在哪个区域，以及相关生物的细节。这包括它们在冒险剧情中的位置，以及你希望它们携带的任何宝藏。你可以参考“奥塔里 Otari下的威胁（Menace under Otari）”中的房间，了解应包含哪些信息类型；当然，你也可以只用简要笔记，而不必把所有内容都详尽写出。

社交互动

有些对话和其他社交互动足够重要，你应该以与遭遇相同的重视程度来对待它们。如果一次谈话可能导致重大后果，那么成功或失败就真的很关键。这些互动应当值得给予 XP。通常它算作一次中等成就，但若是例如说服国王放弃开战之类的事情，它也可能是一次重大成就！

社交互动不遵循与战斗相同的规则。将其作为对话来扮演，并在适当时让英雄进行技能检定。通常会用到欺瞒（Deception）、交涉（Diplomacy）与威吓（Intimidation），但玩家也可能想出更巧妙的方式，例如用宗教与当地牧师交朋友。记住：如果英雄的做法确实很可能对谈话对象奏效，你可以给予英雄情境加值（通常为 +1 或 +2）。



原文:

Encounters are the big, dramatic points in your adventure. They often feature combat with other creatures, but they can also include @UUID[.f82BLxCvoOGIzQ7U]{Hazards}, or you might create social challenges in which characters duel only with words. The rules for building challenges appropriate to your group’s level, as well as how to run them, are contained within this journal.

Some adventures have a clear and direct progression, with challenges occurring at specific times or in a specific order. Others, such as a dungeon filled with interconnected rooms the group can investigate in any order, are nonlinear, and the group can face challenges in any order—or even avoid them entirely. Most adventures are somewhere in between, with some keystone challenges you know the heroes must contend with and some optional ones that the heroes could avoid.

Types of Encounter

Combat Encounters

The most common type of challenge is a combat encounter, where the heroes fight other creatures. As you plan your adventure, think about the kinds of creatures that fit your story. Not all of them have to be important to the plot. It’s okay to include monsters you think would just be fun to use! Think about your players, too. Include monsters you think they’d like going up against based on the players’ personalities.

While you’re picking encounters for your adventure, make notes about which area each encounter appears in and details about the creatures involved. This includes notes on their place in the adventure’s plot and any treasure you want them to carry. You can look at the rooms in “Menace under Otari” for the types of information to include, though you can just use brief notes instead of writing everything out in detail.

Social Interactions

Some conversations and other social interactions are important enough that you should treat them with the same importance as encounters. If major consequences can come from the conversation, success or failure really matters. These interactions should be worth XP. It’s usually a moderate accomplishment, but it might be a major one for something like talking a king out of going to war!

Social interactions don’t follow the same rules as combat. Roleplay them as a conversation, and have the heroes roll skill checks as appropriate. These are usually Deception, Diplomacy, and Intimidation, but players might think of something clever, like using Religion to make friends with a local priest. Remember that you can give heroes circumstance bonuses (usually +1 or +2) if their approach is really likely to work on the person they’re talking to.

Building Encounters.name: 构建遭遇 Building Encounters
Building Encounters.text:
要构建一场战斗遭遇，首先决定这场遭遇在整体冒险中扮演的角色。接着，估算你希望这场遭遇带来多大的威胁。一场遭遇有一个 XP 预算：也就是其中所有怪物合计值多少 XP。这个预算取决于敌人有多大的威胁。

@UUID[.LhKbKh6JlJKFhwbO]{遭遇预算} 讲义把你所需的所有表格都汇总在同一处——一旦你对规则足够熟悉，就能用它快速构建有趣且平衡的遭遇。不过，如果这是你第一次构建遭遇，下面的步骤会引导你完成整个流程。

步骤 1：遭遇难度

在我们选择会出现在这场遭遇中的 @UUID[.ZVyi2AkmgpWOHvSq]{生物 Creatures} 之前，需要先决定你希望这场遭遇有多难。这将决定我们的遭遇预算。你可以从下列选项中选择，或使用 @UUID[.LhKbKh6JlJKFhwbO]{遭遇预算} 讲义中的表 10-1。

• 低威胁遭遇（预算 = 60 XP）会消耗队伍的一些资源，但并不那么可怕。整支队伍受到严重威胁的可能性很低（除非战术非常糟糕）。

• 中等威胁遭遇（预算 = 80 XP）对英雄而言是严峻挑战，但不太可能彻底压制他们。英雄 Heroes通常需要采用稳健战术并明智管理资源。

• 严重威胁遭遇（预算 = 120 XP）是大多数英雄小队能够稳定战胜的最困难类型。此类遭遇应当留作故事中的重要时刻，例如直面最终首领。霉运、糟糕战术，或因先前遭遇而资源匮乏，都很容易让一场严重威胁遭遇对英雄变得不利；而明智的队伍会保留脱离战斗的选择。

当玩家进入一场严重战斗时，你可以提醒他们，尤其是他们刚接触《开拓者》时更应如此。即使玩家尚不确定，他们的英雄多半也能看出自己面对的是一个看起来非常强悍的敌人！

步骤 2：花费你的预算

接下来，我们可以用预算来选择生物与危害，为我们的遭遇填充内容。为此，请查阅 @UUID[.LhKbKh6JlJKFhwbO]{遭遇预算} 讲义中的表 10-3 与表 10-4。

《开拓者》第二版系统包含数量庞大的生物，你可以在系统的资料库中找到它们。你可以使用 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pf2e-macros.s2sa8lo9dcIA6UGe]{资料库浏览器} 在各本《怪物图鉴》中搜索符合相应等级的生物；如果想缩小范围，也可以选择按特征筛选。

尽量考虑这场遭遇发生的地点，并选择可能出现在那里、或能很好利用地形的生物。目标是让玩家投入并进行战术思考，同时也让世界显得更真实。

当你选定构成这场遭遇的具体生物后，请确保将它们从资料库浏览器拖入你的世界中。它们会出现在侧边栏的“角色（Actors）”标签页（剪影图标）里。如有需要，你也可以在这里为它们指定头像与指示物（token），但这完全是可选的。

步骤 3：运行这场遭遇！

没错——就这么简单！现在你已经知道要用哪些生物了，接下来就可以开始运行这场遭遇。关于遭遇如何展开的规则，详述于 @UUID[.hZz7TLxyIJpNZbHF]{运行遭遇} 页面。



原文:

To build a combat encounter, first decide how the encounter fits into the adventure as a whole. Then, estimate how much of a threat you want the encounter to pose. An encounter has an XP budget. This is how much XP all the monsters in it are worth. This budget depends on how much of a threat the foes are.

The @UUID[.LhKbKh6JlJKFhwbO]{Encounter Budget} handout has all of the tables you'll need in one place— once you're familiar with the rules, you'll be able to use it to quickly build engaging and balanced encounters. If this is the first time you've built an encounter, though, the steps below will guide you through the process.

Step 1: Encounter Difficulty

Before we can choose the @UUID[.ZVyi2AkmgpWOHvSq]{Creatures} that will appear in our encounter, we'll need to decide how difficult we want the encounter to be. This will tell us our Encounter Budget. You can choose from the list below, or use Table 10-1 on the @UUID[.LhKbKh6JlJKFhwbO]{Encounter Budget} handout.

• Low-threat encounters (budget = 60 XP) use some of the party’s resources, but they aren’t that scary. It would be unlikely (or the result of very poor tactics) for the entire party to be seriously threatened.

• Moderate-threat encounters (budget = 80 XP) are a serious challenge to the heroes, though unlikely to overpower them completely. Heroes usually need to use sound tactics and manage their resources wisely.

• Severe-threat encounters (budget = 120 XP) are the hardest encounters most groups of heroes can consistently defeat. These encounters should be save for important moments in your story, such as confronting a final boss. Bad luck, poor tactics, or lack of resources due to prior encounters can easily turn a severe-threat encounter against the heroes, and a wise group keeps the option to disengage open.

You might warn the players when they enter a severe fight, especially if they’re new to Pathfinder. Their heroes likely can tell when they’re up against an enemy that looks really tough, even if the players aren’t sure yet!

Step 2: Spend Your Budget

Next, we can use our budget to choose creatures and hazards to populate our encounter. To do this, consult tables 10-3 and 10-4 on the @UUID[.LhKbKh6JlJKFhwbO]{Encounter Budget} handout.

The Pathfinder Second Edition system includes a huge number of creatures, which are available to you from the system compendiums. You can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pf2e-macros.s2sa8lo9dcIA6UGe]{Compendium Browser} to search the Bestiaries for creatures of the appropriate levels, with the option to filter for certain traits if you want to narrow your search.

Try to think about the location the encounter is happening, and choose creatures that might appear there or that can make good use of the terrain. The goal is to engage your players and get them to think tactically, while also making the world feel more real.

Once you've chosen the specific creatures that will constitute your encounter, make sure that you drag them out of the Compendium Browser and into your world. They'll appear in the Actors tab of your sidebar (the silhouette icon). If you'd like, you can also assign them a portrait and token here, although this is entirely optional.

Step 3: Run the Encounter!

That's right- that's all it took! Now that you know which creatures you have in mind, you're ready to run the encounter. The rules for how an encounter plays out are detailed in the @UUID[.hZz7TLxyIJpNZbHF]{Running Encounters} page.

Running Encounters.name: 主持遭遇 Running Encounters
Running Encounters.text:
当你身处紧张的战斗、每一个单独动作都至关重要时，你就进入了一场遭遇。时间被划分为若干轮，每一轮在游戏世界中等于 6 秒的时间。（十轮等于 1 分钟。）每一轮中，战斗中的每个生物都会按一个既定顺序进行自己的回合，该顺序称为先攻。一场遭遇依照以下四个步骤进行。

步骤 1：投掷先攻

当遭遇开始时，GM 会要求进行先攻。你投掷你的察觉（除非你在战斗爆发前一直处于“避免被注意”，此时你投掷隐匿 Stealth）。GM 会为遭遇中除英雄以外的所有人投掷先攻。与典型的检定（将结果与 DC 比较）不同，先攻投掷的结果会从高到低排序。

步骤 2：进行一轮

这一轮从先攻最高的生物开始，它先进行自己的回合。进行回合的流程如下所述。

当第一个生物完成其回合后，先攻次高的生物进行其回合，以此类推。若先攻结果相同，敌人先于英雄行动。若同一阵营的生物先攻相同，则在他们的先攻第一次出现时自行决定行动顺序。此后，直到该遭遇剩余部分结束为止，每个人在先攻顺序中的位置都不会改变。

当所有人都进行过一个回合后，本轮结束，下一轮开始。

步骤 3：开始下一轮

先攻就像时钟一样——当所有参战者都完成回合后，你将开始新的一轮。回到最高的先攻数值，所有人按照新一轮中的相同顺序再进行一个回合。

步骤 4：结束遭遇

当一方全员被击败、达成某种停战，或有其他事件或情势使战斗停止时，遭遇结束。你与其他参与者不再遵循先攻顺序，游戏回到探索。

在遭遇结束时，GM 可能会向队伍奖励经验值，或者你们可能会找到宝藏并进行分配。

进行你的回合

当战斗中的先攻轮到你时，你就可以进行自己的回合！你可以在回合中使用你的动作，并且在你的回合开始与结束时会适用一些特殊规则。以下是你在回合各个部分要做的事。

你的回合开始

• 若你创造了一个效果，其持续时间以轮数计（如许多法术），则将剩余轮数减少 1。若持续时间降至 0，则该效果结束。

• 若你处于濒死状态，则进行一次复苏检定（见 @UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.SucJycHedcDPml60]{生命值、治疗和死亡 Hit Points, Healing, and Dying}）。

• 失去你上一回合的反应动作，并恢复你的 3 个动作与 1 个反应动作。你不能把之前回合未用完的动作或反应动作“豁免起来”。若某个状态或效果阻止你使用部分但不是全部动作，你仍会恢复剩余可用的动作。若某个状态或效果阻止你使用全部动作，你就不会恢复任何动作或反应动作。

使用动作

• 现在你有了动作，该是使用它们的时间了！你可以以任意顺序执行你的动作，但必须完成一个后才能开始下一个。例如，除非某个特殊行动允许，否则你不能在进行一次跨步 Stride 的过程中发动一次打击 Strike。你可以从所有角色都可用的基础动作中选择，也可以使用你从职业、族裔、装备或你在创建角色期间所做的其他选择中获得的任何动作。

• 当你花完动作后，进入你的回合结束部分。

你的回合结束

• 失去你 3 个动作中尚未使用的那些。若你在本回合未使用反应动作，则保留该反应动作；你会在下一个回合开始时失去它。

• 若你正承受 @UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.9H0Jrj0siUcpFC1s#persistent-damage]{持续性伤害}，你在此时间承受该伤害。承受该伤害后，你可以尝试进行纯骰检定以结束该持续性伤害。

• 结束所有“持续至你回合结束”为止的效果。

• 处理任何其他被指定为在你回合结束时发生的事项。

• 你的回合结束，下一位生物的回合开始。



原文:

When you’re in a tense fight and every individual action counts, you enter an encounter. Time is divided into rounds, each of which is 6 seconds of time in the game world. (Ten rounds is 1 minute.) Every round, each creature in that combat takes a turn in an established order called initiative. An encounter takes place following these four steps.

Step 1: Roll Initiative

When the encounter starts, the GM calls for initiative. Roll your Perception (unless you were Avoiding Notice in the lead-up to the battle, in which case you roll Stealth). The GM rolls initiative for anyone other than the heroes in the encounter. Unlike a typical check, where the result is compared to a DC, the results of initiative rolls are ranked from highest to lowest.

Step 2: Play a Round

The round starts with the creature who rolled the highest initiative taking their turn first. The process of taking a turn is described below.

Once the first creature has taken their turn, the one with the next highest initiative takes their turn, and so on. If initiative results are tied, enemies go before the heroes. If creatures on the same side tie, they choose what order to go the first time their initiative comes up. After that, everyone’s place in the initiative order doesn’t change for the rest of that encounter.

Once everyone has taken a turn, the round ends, and the next one begins.

Step 3: Begin the Next Round

Initiative is like a clock—after all combatants have taken their turns, you’ll start a new round. Go back to the highest initiative number and everyone takes another turn in the same order in the new round.

Step 4: End the Encounter

When everyone on one side is defeated, some sort of truce is reached, or another event or circumstance stops the combat, the encounter ends. You and the other participants no longer follow the initiative order, and the game returns to exploration.

At the end of an encounter, the GM may award Experience Points to the party, or you may find treasure to divvy up.

Taking Your Turn

When it reaches your initiative in combat, you get to take your turn! You can use your actions on your turn, and some special rules apply at the start and end of your turn. Here’s what you do during each part of your turn.

Start of Your Turn

• If you created an effect with a duration lasting a certain number of rounds, like many spells do, reduce the number of rounds remaining by 1. The effect ends if the duration is reduced to 0.

• If you’re dying, roll a recovery check (see @UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.SucJycHedcDPml60]{Hit Points, Healing, and Dying}).

• Lose the reaction from your previous turn, and regain your 3 actions and 1 reaction. You can’t “save up” unused actions or reactions from previous turns. If a condition or effect prevents you from using some, but not all, of your actions, you still regain the remaining actions. If a condition or effect prevents you from using all of your actions, you don’t regain any actions or your reaction.

Using Actions

• Now that you have your actions, it’s time to use them! You can perform your actions in any order you wish, but you have to complete one before beginning another. For example, you couldn’t Strike while in the middle of a Stride unless a special activity lets you. You can pick your actions from the basic actions available to all characters as well as any actions you get from your class, ancestry, equipment, or any other choices you made during character creation.

• Once you’re done spending actions, go to the end of your turn.

End of Your Turn

• Lose any of your 3 actions that remain. You keep your reaction if you didn’t use it on your turn; you lose it at the start of your next turn.

• If you are suffering from @UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.9H0Jrj0siUcpFC1s#persistent-damage]{Persistent Damage}, you take the damage at this time. After taking the damage, you can attempt the flat check to end the persistent damage.

• End any effects that last until the end of your turn.

• Resolve anything else specified to happen at the end of your turn.

• Your turn is over, and the next creature’s turn begins.

Creatures.name: 生物 Creatures
Creatures.text:
生物的种类从平凡到非凡，从巨龙到群狼。虽然它们最常在战斗中作为对手出现，但生物也能在遭遇之外提供有趣的情境。

阅读生物数据

每个生物的统计数据都会显示在其角色卡上。你可以在侧边栏的“角色（Actors）”标签页中找到它们——这里以@UUID[Actor.r9w1n85mp9Ip4QiS]{狗头人战士 Kobold Warrior}为例。

这些角色卡包含关于某个生物的大量信息，其中有些与玩家角色的运作方式非常相似。几个关键点如下：

  • 生物的数据表顶部列出其名称与等级。英雄从1级等级开始，但某些弱小的生物可能是0级等级，甚至是-1级等级。

  • 名称下方是该生物的特征行。所有生物都有稀有度、阵营以及体型。随后将该生物的其他特征按字母顺序列出。

  • 数据表也会列出该生物除每个生物都可使用的基础动作之外，还能使用的所有动作与能力。动作图标会标注某个能力需要多少个动作。

  • 有些生物拥有法术或装备；这些内容会收录在其角色卡的其他标签页中。

生物体型

生物可能是超小型、小型、中型或大型。中型生物（如英雄）在网格上占据1格，小型生物也是如此。最多有四个超小型生物可以挤在同一格里，而且一个超小型生物可以与一个小型或更大的生物共用同一格。大型生物占据2×2的区域。

选择怪物动作

作为GM，你需要扮演怪物并选择它们的战术。玩家经常会协调计划以尽可能高效，但怪物未必如此！大多数生物对简单战术（如夹击或集火单一目标）有基本理解。但也别忘了：它们也会受情绪影响、会犯错！有些生物只有动物般的智力或根本没有心智，你就应当以相应方式来扮演它们。

怪物通常不会攻击一个已被击败的英雄。即使某个生物知道倒下的英雄可能会重返战斗，也只有最残忍的生物才会把注意力放在无助的敌人身上，而不是周围更迫切的威胁。

辨识生物

你可以用“回忆知识（Recall Knowledge）”动作来辨识一个生物。DC取决于该生物的等级。

所用的技能取决于该生物最重要的特征，如下所示。成功辨识某个生物的英雄会得知它的一项能力——例如巨魔（特征）的再生。在大成功或大失败成功时，英雄还会额外得知第二项较少为人知的细节，例如该生物反应的触发。

原文:

Creatures range from the mundane to the extraordinary, from dragons to wolves. While they’re most often opponents in combat, creatures can provide interesting situations outside of encounters.

Reading Creature Statistics

Each creature’s statistics appear on their character sheet. You can find these in the Actors tab of your sidebar- here is the @UUID[Actor.r9w1n85mp9Ip4QiS]{Kobold Warrior} as an example.

These sheets include a lot of information about a creature, some of which is very similar to how player characters work. A few key points are:

  • The top of a creature’s stat block lists its name and its level. While heroes start at 1st level, some weak creatures can be level 0 or even level -1.

  • Underneath the name is the creature’s traits line. All creatures will have a rarity, an alignment, and a size. The creature’s other traits are then listed alphabetically.

  • The stat block also lists all the actions and abilities the creature can use other than the basic actions available to every creature. Action icons note how many actions an ability requires.

  • Some creatures have spells or equipment, which are included in the other tabs of their character sheet.

Creature Size

Creatures can be Tiny, Small, Medium, or Large. Medium creatures, like the heroes, take up one square on a grid, as do Small creatures. Up to four Tiny creatures can fit in one square, and a Tiny creature can share a square with a Small or larger creature. Large creatures take up a 2 × 2 area.

Choosing Monster Actions

As the GM, you roleplay monsters and choose their tactics. Players often coordinate and plan to be as efficient as possible, but monsters might not! Most creatures have a basic grasp of simple tactics like flanking or focusing on a single target. But remember that they also react based on emotions and make mistakes! Some creatures have only animal intelligence or are mindless, and you should play them that way.

Monsters usually don’t attack a hero who’s knocked out. Even if a creature knows a fallen hero might come back into the fight, only the most vicious creatures focus on helpless foes rather than the more immediate threats around them.

Identifying Creatures

The Recall Knowledge action can be used to identify a creature. The DC is based on the creature’s level.

The skill used depends on that creature’s most important trait, as shown below. A hero who identifies a creature learns one of its abilities—such as a troll’s regeneration. On a critical success, the hero also learns a second detail that’s less commonly known, like the trigger for the creature’s reaction.

Hazards.name: 危害 Hazards
Hazards.text:
地城中充斥着用来守护其中财宝的狡猾陷阱，从发射飞镖的装置，到落下沉重巨石的机关，或揭露隐藏的陷坑皆有。

虽然危害通常在@UUID[.zvGaSL2IpbvcyeUQ]{探索}期间遭遇，但它们也可能在与生物的@UUID[.ZFjG6Np42VRz5hFu#combat-encounters]{Combat 遭遇}中成为额外的麻烦，甚至本身就构成一整个遭遇。想了解更多如何在你的游戏中运用危害，请继续阅读！

主持危害

侦测危害

每个危害都有某种触发，例如绊线或压力板。当角色接近危害时，他们有机会在触发危害之前发现其机关。在探索期间，当英雄首次进入危害所在的区域时，决定队伍是否侦测到该危害。只有正在主动搜寻的人（在探索时使用“搜索”行动，或在遭遇中使用“探察”动作）才有机会注意到它们。任何成功者都会察觉该危害，而你可以描述他们注意到了什么。

触发危害

若队伍未能侦测到危害，且该危害的触发依赖于旅行中的标准行为（例如踩到地板机关），则该危害的反应便会发生。只有在有人直接操作环境时才会触发的危害 Hazards——例如打开一扇门——仅在英雄明确采取该行动时才会使用其反应。

解除危害

解除陷阱最通用的方法，是使用“解除装置”动作（巧手技能）。其DC列于危害的数据表中。正如技能规则所述，生物必须受训于巧手，才能使用“解除装置”动作。要完全解除某些陷阱，需要多次成功的“解除装置”动作。例如，解除镰刃机关需要分别对两片刀刃各进行一次成功的检定。任何用于解除危害的掷骰若出现大成功或大失败失败，都会触发该危害。

角色必须先侦测到危害（或由他人指出）才能尝试解除它。无论危害是否已被触发，他们都可以尝试解除；不过大多数危害在其反应发生后便不再构成威胁。

破坏危害

对陷阱造成伤害的方式如同对盾牌造成伤害：陷阱会以其硬度减少所受的伤害。若危害的生命值降至其破损阈值（BT）或更低，则该危害变为破损且无法再被启动。若降至0生命值，则它被摧毁且无法修复。通常，陷阱在遭到攻击时会被触发；但若它在一次攻击中就被摧毁，则不会被触发，因为剩余部分不足以伤害任何人！若它在一次攻击中变为破损但未被摧毁，你可根据陷阱类型决定它是否会被触发。

危害的AC、豁免、硬度、生命值与BT皆列于其数据表中。若危害未列出其中某项数据，则无法被任何以该数据为目标的效果影响。例如，具有生命值但没有BT的危害无法被破损，但仍可被摧毁。危害 Hazards只能被明确写明可目标物体的事物作为目标。某些能力，如流血伤害、毒素、心灵效果与恶心状态，对危害无效；任何对物体而言不合理会生效的其他效果也同样无效。

危害经验值

角色在克服危害时获得XP——无论他们是解除它、避开它，或只是承受其攻击。若他们之后再次触发同一个危害，则不会再次因该危害获得XP。危害提供的XP取决于队伍的等级，如下所示。例如，一项0等级危害面对1级队伍时价值6 XP，因为0级等于队伍等级 -1。

原文:

Dungeons are rife with devious traps meant to protect the treasures within, ranging from devices that shoot darts to those that drop heavy blocks or expose hidden pit traps.

While hazards are often encountered during @UUID[.zvGaSL2IpbvcyeUQ]{Exploration}, they can also be a complication during a @UUID[.ZFjG6Np42VRz5hFu#combat-encounters]{Combat Encounter} with creatures, or even be the subject of an entire encounter of their own. To learn more about how to use hazards in your game, keep reading!

Running Hazards

Detecting a Hazard

Every hazard has a trigger of some kind, like a trip wire or a pressure plate. When characters approach a hazard, they have a chance of finding the mechanism before triggering the hazard. During exploration, determine whether the party detects a hazard when the heroes first enter the area in which it appears. Only someone actively searching (using the Search activity while exploring or the Seek action in an encounter) has a chance to notice them. Anyone who succeeds becomes aware of the hazard, and you can describe what they notice.

Triggering a Hazard

If the group fails to detect a hazard and the hazard’s trigger depends on a standard part of traveling (such as stepping on a floor plate), the hazard’s reaction occurs. Hazards that would be triggered only when someone directly manipulates the environment—by opening a door, for example—use their reactions only if a hero explicitly takes that action.

Disabling a Hazard

The most versatile method for deactivating traps is the Disable a Device action of the Thievery skill. The DC is listed in the hazard’s stat block. As noted in skills, a creature must be trained in Thievery to use the Disable a Device action. Fully disarming some traps requires multiple successful Disable a Device actions. For example, disabling scythe blades requires a successful check on each of two blades. A critical failure on any roll to disable a hazard triggers it.

A character must first detect a hazard (or have it pointed out to them) to try to deactivate it. They can attempt to deactivate a hazard whether or not it has already been triggered, though most hazards no longer pose a danger once their reactions have occurred.

Damaging a Hazard

Damaging a trap works like damaging a shield: the trap reduces the damage it takes by its Hardness. If a hazard’s Hit Points are reduced to its Broken Threshold (BT) or lower, the hazard becomes broken and can no longer be activated. If it’s reduced to 0 HP, it’s destroyed and can’t be repaired. Usually, the trap is triggered when attacked, though it isn’t triggered if it’s destroyed in one hit because there’s not enough left to harm anyone! If it’s broken in one hit but not destroyed, you decide whether it triggers based on the type of trap.

Hazards’ AC, saving throws, Hardness, HP, and BT are listed in their stat blocks. A hazard that doesn’t list one of these statistics can’t be affected by anything targeting that statistic. For example, a hazard that has HP but no BT can’t be broken, but it can still be destroyed. Hazards can be targeted only by things that specifically say they can target objects. Certain abilities like bleed damage, poison, mental effects, and the sickened condition don’t work against a hazard, nor do any other effects that wouldn’t reasonably work on an object.

Hazard Experience

Characters gain XP for overcoming a hazard, whether they disable it, avoid it, or simply endure its attacks. If they trigger the same hazard later on, they don’t gain XP for the hazard again. The XP a hazard gives depends on the party’s level, as shown below. For example, a 0-level hazard faced by a 1st-level party is worth 6 XP because level 0 is the party’s level -1.
