Exploration.name: 探索 Exploration
Exploration.text:
当英雄们在各处移动、探索地城、荒野或城市时，游戏的运作相当灵活。若在探索期间爆发战斗，游戏就会转入@UUID[.LhKbKh6JlJKFhwbO]{遭遇}，并遵循一套更为明确的规则。

探索包含移动与角色扮演，而GM会依据英雄们的行动来决定时间的流动。你的英雄可能正从一座城镇前往另一座城镇，途中在某个前哨与几位商人闲聊，或在目的地与警觉的城卫进行一段简短而紧绷的对话。若GM需要追踪旅行所耗费的时间，他们会使用此表——队伍以其中最慢成员的速度旅行。

英雄速度

每小时英里数

每日英里数

20尺

2

16

25尺

2.5

20

30尺

3

24

在各次遭遇之间，英雄们经常会探索地城或其他环境。时间在探索期间比在遭遇中更为弹性，通常以10分钟或更长的区间来衡量。你向玩家描述发生的事，并且可以略过他们旅程中任何不有趣的部分！

设定队伍顺序

当队伍开始探索时，让玩家们自行决定在探索过程中各自的英雄位于队伍的什么位置。这个顺序可能会决定当敌人或陷阱从不同方向威胁时，谁会最先遭到攻击。至于在特定情境下会锁定谁为目标，则由你依据状况来裁定细节。

当一场遭遇开始时，队伍通常会维持大致相同的队形。结合英雄们的意见，在你把指示物放上场景时决定他们的位置。若他们抢先下手、先一步发现危害，则在处理它之前，他们可以依照需要自由调整站位。

探索活动

当队伍进行探索时，每位玩家若想做的不只是单纯旅行，就为其角色选择一个探索行动。玩家通常会从默认活动中选择，但他们不必死记探索活动并严格照表操课。相反地，当你的玩家想在单纯移动之外做点别的，就让他们描述其尝试行为的基本内容，例如「我在寻找危害」或「我让盾保持就绪以防被袭击」。作为GM，你挑选最符合其描述的探索行动，并叙述该行动的效果。有些探索活动会限制角色能够有效进行旅行的速度：

@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.IE2nThCmoyhQA0Jn]{避免注意} @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.cYtYKa1gDEl7y2N0]{防御} @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Yb0C1uLzeHrVLl7a]{侦测魔法} @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JuqmIAnkL9hVGai8]{疾行} @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.EwgTZBWsc8qKaViP]{调查} @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.kV3XM0YJeS2KCSOb]{侦察} @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{搜索} @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.fJImDBQfqfjKJOhk]{辨识方向}

若玩家想做的事不在上述探索活动清单中，只要在边走边行动时合理可行，你也可以允许。若该行动类似某人在遭遇中会用到的动作，它通常等同于每分钟大约重复一次单动作约10次。你也可能遇到玩家想做的事，相当于每6秒花费3个动作（也就是每分钟18次），就像战斗中那样。然而，英雄无法在探索模式下长时间维持那种强度的用力而不致疲惫。他们之所以能在战斗中做到，是因为战斗持续的时间非常短。

叙述探索

当队伍进行探索时，描述他们所见、所闻与各种感受。鼓励其他玩家让他们的英雄真正去探索，并奖励他们的好奇心。他们在探索模式中尝试做的事，会让你看出他们对什么感兴趣、他们认为什么重要。随着游戏进行，你应当能更清楚哪些事物会引起特定玩家的兴趣，并能在你的冒险中加入更多这类内容，或在已发布的冒险中强调这些要点。

像是侦测魔法、调查与搜索等活动，能让玩家察觉某个区域似乎有些不对劲。但这并不代表他们确切知道是什么！相反地，把这些当作开展一段角色扮演场景的起点。举例来说，如果某个角色用侦测魔法发现了某种魔法事物，队伍很可能仍需要停下来、更仔细地观察周遭环境，才能弄清楚那究竟是什么。

同样地，若某个角色在穿越包含陷阱的区域时进行搜索，并在其察觉检定中掷出22，而该陷阱需要DC 20才能侦测到，你应告诉玩家其角色注意到了该区域中的陷阱，并可以给出对陷阱位置与性质的大致概念。队伍仍需要停下脚步并更进一步检查该区域，才能得知陷阱的具体细节

As heroes move from place to place, exploring a dungeon, wilderness, or city, the game is flexible. If a fight breaks out during exploration, the game turns into an @UUID[.LhKbKh6JlJKFhwbO]{Encounter}, which follows a more specific set of rules.

Exploration involves movement and roleplaying, and the GM determines the flow of time based on what the heroes do. Your hero might be traveling from one town to another, chatting with a couple of merchants at an outpost along the way, or having a terse conversation with the watchful city guards at your destination. If the GM needs to track how long travel takes, they'll use this table- the party travels at the speed of its slowest member.

Hero's Speed

Miles per Hour

Miles per Day

20 feet

2

16

25 feet

2.5

20

30 feet

3

24

Between encounters, the heroes often explore dungeons or other environments. Time is more flexible during exploration than in encounters and is measured in 10-minute intervals or more. You tell the players what happens, and you can skip over any parts of their travels that aren’t interesting!

Set a Party Order

When the group starts exploring, let the players decide among themselves where in the group their heroes are while exploring. This order can determine who gets attacked first when enemies or traps threaten from various directions. It’s up to you to determine the specifics of who gets targeted based on the situation.

When an encounter starts, the group usually remains in the same general formation. With the heroes' input, decide their positions when you put the tokens on the scene. If they get the drop on their enemies or detect a hazard in advance, they can move around as they see fit before dealing with it.

Exploration Activities

While the party explores, each player who wants to do something beyond just traveling chooses an exploration activity for their character. Players usually choose from the default activities, but there’s no need for them to memorize the exploration activities and use them exactly. Instead, when your players want to do something in addition to simply traveling, have them describe the basics of what they're attempting to do, such as “I’m searching for hazards” or “I’m keeping my shield ready in case we’re attacked.” As the GM, you find the best exploration activity to match their description and describe the effects of that activity. Some exploration activities limit how fast a character can travel and be effective:

@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.IE2nThCmoyhQA0Jn]{Avoid Notice} @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.cYtYKa1gDEl7y2N0]{Defend} @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Yb0C1uLzeHrVLl7a]{Detect Magic} @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JuqmIAnkL9hVGai8]{Hustle} @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.EwgTZBWsc8qKaViP]{Investigate} @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.kV3XM0YJeS2KCSOb]{Scout} @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{Search} @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.fJImDBQfqfjKJOhk]{Sense Direction}

If a player wants to do something not on the list of exploration activities above, you can let them if they could reasonably do it while walking around. If the activity is similar to an action someone could use in an encounter, it usually consists of a single action repeated roughly 10 times per minute. You might find that a player wants to do something equivalent to spending 3 actions every 6 seconds (18 times per minute), just like they would in combat. However, heroes can’t maintain that level of exertion in exploration mode without getting exhausted. They can do so in combat only because combat lasts such a short time.

Narrating Exploration

As the group explores, describe the sights, sounds, and sensations. Encourage the other players to have their heroes truly explore, and reward their curiosity. The things they try to do in exploration mode show you what they’re interested in and what they consider important. As you play, you should get a good feel for what intrigues certain players, and you can add more of those things to your adventures or emphasize these points in published adventures.

Activities like Detect Magic, Investigate, and Search can tip off a player that something is odd about an area. But that doesn't mean they know exactly what it is! Instead, use these as a starting point for a roleplaying scene. For instance, if a character finds something magical with detect magic, the party likely still needs to stop and look at the surroundings in more detail to figure out what it is.

Similarly, if a character got a 22 on their Perception check to Search while traveling through an area containing a trap that needs a DC 20 to detect it, you should tell the player that their character noticed a trap in the area, and you can give a rough idea of the trap’s location and nature. The party needs to stop and examine the area more to learn specifics about the trap

Locations.name: 地点 Locations
Locations.text:
通过令人难忘的场景来激发玩家的好奇心——这些场景应包含神秘而奇幻的地点，供英雄前往探访！探索每一处地点本身就应是一种享受，而不只是玩家为了从一场战斗走到下一场战斗所必须完成的步骤。当你创造一个地点时，在脑海中勾勒它的画面，并写下你在叙述游戏时可以加入的细节。描述装饰、自然地标、野生动物、古怪的气味，甚至温度的变化，都能让一个地方显得更加真实。

除了怪物与战利品之外，你的地点还可以包含基于环境的挑战，从暴风雪等天气状况，到谜题、陷阱或其他危害。这些挑战应当符合你冒险发生的地点：例如，被植被侵占的城堡废墟中的荆棘墙；被诅咒的沼泽里的酸液水池；或是偏执巫师之墓中的魔法陷阱。可查阅讲义中的@UUID[.AJZOnRliAzq7nbDM]{环境}、@UUID[.mhP6TyghfJ6AE3ia]{天气}与@UUID[.f82BLxCvoOGIzQ7U]{危害 Hazards}以获取灵感。



原文:

Bring out the players’ curiosity through memorable settings that include mysterious and fantastical locations for the heroes to visit! Exploring each location should be a treat in itself, not just a step the players must complete to get from one fight to the next. As you create a locale, picture it in your mind’s eye, and write down details you can include as you narrate the game. Describing decorations, natural landmarks, wildlife, peculiar smells, and even temperature changes makes a place feel more real.

Beyond monsters and loot, your locations can include challenges based on the environment, from weather conditions like blizzards to puzzles, traps, or other hazards. These challenges should suit your adventure’s location: walls of brambles in a castle ruin overrun with vegetation, pools of acid in a cursed swamp, or magical traps in the tomb of a paranoid wizard. Consult the handouts for @UUID[.AJZOnRliAzq7nbDM]{Environments}, @UUID[.mhP6TyghfJ6AE3ia]{Weather}, and @UUID[.f82BLxCvoOGIzQ7U]{Hazards} for inspiration.

Environments.text:
环境规则能让你的队伍所穿行的各个地点栩栩如生。你在不同环境中进行游戏时往往只需依常识处理，但对那些真正与众不同的环境，你就需要特殊规则。下列条目提供了若干特殊类型的地形规则，并附上一些感官细节建议，供英雄探索该环境时加入描述。许多地点同时具有多种环境要素——例如，一座覆雪山岳可能同时使用极地与山地环境规则。此处的DC为便于使用而提供的典型值。你可以按需更改DC，使用设定的常规规则@UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy]{简易DC}，而且你也可以随时只采用最适合你游戏的那部分环境规则。

许多冒险发生在地下城中——地下要塞、洞穴巢穴，或已成为危险生物巢穴的墓穴。地下城可能是人工建造的，也可能是天然形成的；但无论哪种，它都结合了下文所述地下与城市环境的特征。不管怎样，你的冒险可以设定在任何地方！

水域

水域环境是对英雄而言最具挑战性的环境之一，仅次于异界与异常次元。

• 游泳：使用运动学技能进行@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{游泳}（静水DC 10，流水DC 15，急流DC 20）。

• 水流：洋流、河流与类似的流动水域，对逆流游泳的生物而言为@UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.hYwHTbxIwLVsCIhJ#difficult-terrain]{困难地形}。若某个生物在其回合结束时仍处于水流中，它会依据水流速度移动一定距离（通常为5英尺或10英尺）。例如，10英尺水流会在该生物的回合结束时，将其沿水流方向推进10英尺。

描述

景象：翻涌的水面、滚动的波涛、闪烁的阳光、地平线的弧度、漂流木

声音：海浪拍击船身、海鸟鸣叫、船帆扑动、海兽破浪而出

气味：咸水、清冽的新鲜空气、死鱼味

触感：刺骨的海水、黏滑的海藻、表面结起的粗硬盐霜

极地

极地环境的主要挑战是低温，如@UUID[.mhP6TyghfJ6AE3ia]{天气}日志所述；但极地环境也包含冰与雪。

• 冰面：使用特技技能进行@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{保持平衡}以避免坠落摔倒（DC 12）。

• 积雪：困难地形。

描述

景象：令人目眩的反射日光、雪原、远方冰川、深邃冰裂隙、岩壁峭崖、浮冰与冰山、雪地上的动物足迹

声音：呼啸狂风、融冰滴落、万籁俱寂

气味：洁净空气、半冻结沼泽、地衣、海藻

触感：脚下嘎吱作响的积雪、坚硬冰面

天气：刺骨强风、小雪、狂暴暴风雪

沙漠

沙漠既包括沙质与岩质沙漠，也包括崎岖的荒地。

• 碎石：岩质沙漠遍布碎石，其为困难地形。碎石密集到足以让人“走在上面”而非“穿行其间”时，还需要使用特技进行@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{保持平衡}（DC 15）。

• 沙地：压实沙地不妨碍移动，但松散沙地为困难地形。特别深或特别松的沙地，穿越的生物需要使用特技进行保持平衡（DC 20）。

描述

景象：令人目眩的反射日光、起伏沙丘、海市蜃楼、盘旋的秃鹫

声音：沙风窸窣、沙粒倾泻、夜里的昆虫声

气味：尘土、沙漠香草

触感：粗砺的砂粒、温热的岩石、干枯灌木

天气：直射酷热、尘卷风、沙暴

森林

这些环境包括丛林与其他林地。

• 树木：使用运动学@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{攀爬}树木（DC 15）。在地图上占满一个5英尺方格（或更大）的树足够粗大，可提供标准掩蔽；更细的树则不能。

• 下层植被：困难地形。茂密下层植被会为其中的任何人提供标准掩蔽，但穿行其间更为艰难。每个方格需要额外花费10英尺移动，而不只是5英尺！

• 藤蔓：使用特技或运动学技能借藤蔓摆荡（DC 15）。

描述

景象：参天巨木、浓密灌丛、葱郁树冠、色彩斑斓的野生动物、穿透枝叶的斑驳日光、覆苔树干、盘结树根

声音：树叶沙沙、树枝折断、兽鸣鸟叫

气味：腐解植被、花香、松木气息、带土腥的蘑菇味

触感：脚下落叶碎响、刮擦的枝条、头顶滴落的水、粗糙树皮

天气：凝滞空气、阴凉树荫、零星微风、雨打树冠、枝条覆着厚雪

山地

山地环境也包括丘陵；丘陵与山地共享许多方面，但不具备山地更极端的特征。

• 峡谷：使用运动学进行@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{跳远}以跨越峡谷或类似的天然坑陷（跨距10英尺的峡谷DC 15；每多5英尺宽度，DC+5）。未能跳过意味着因坠落而受到钝击伤害，数值等于坠落距离的一半。或者，生物也可以选择更安全但更慢的路线：先攀爬下到峡谷近侧底部，再攀爬上到远侧以通过。峡谷的合适深度为30英尺或50英尺；再深的话，坠落很可能会杀死英雄！

• 峭壁与坡面：使用运动学@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{攀爬}峭壁（倾斜崖壁DC 10，陡峭崖壁DC 15，垂直崖壁或几乎无落手点的陡崖DC 20）。若无充分的安全措施（例如让上方的生物固定绳索），一次大成功或大失败 失败可能导致严重的坠落 伤害。

• 熔岩：火山可能有小股熔岩流。仅仅靠近熔岩的热量就有害，会对10英尺内的任何人每轮造成1d6火焰伤害。跳入熔岩对任何不免疫火焰者几乎等同于必死——每轮造成20d6火焰伤害！

• 碎石与石坡：困难地形。特别深或遍布的碎石也需要使用特技进行@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{保持平衡}（DC 15）。

• 下层植被：困难地形。山地厚密下层植被很罕见，使用森林条目中的规则。

描述

景象：裸露峭壁、雪冠山顶、耐寒树木、遍布石坡的山腰、坠落岩块、借气流翱翔的鸟群、峰峦间的雾气

声音：呼啸狂风、坠落的落石、清晰回声、脚下碎石咯吱声、远处雪崩

气味：扬起的尘土、松木、清新的新雪味

触感：粗糙岩面、粉雪、松动不稳的碎石

天气：旋卷云层、高海拔寒意、直射日光、强风暴雨

平原

平原环境涵盖草原（如稀树草原与农田）。此类地形通常相当平坦，易于通行。

• 下层植被：困难地形。平原上厚密下层植被很少见（通常是人工种植的树篱或高杆作物如玉米），使用森林条目中的规则。

描述

景象：轻轻起伏的草浪、零星野花、裸露岩脊或巨石、地平线的弧度

声音：风声沙沙、鸟鸣、遥远声音被传得很远

气味：新鲜空气、带土腥的泥土、远处的尸臭

触感：高草拂身的接触、灌木的粗糙摩擦、干土碎裂的咯吱感

天气：和风带来的凉意、直射日光的热度、巨大而漆黑的雷暴云

沼泽

湿地是最常见的沼泽类型，但本类别也包括较干的沼泽地，如荒泽。

• 泥沼：浅泥沼对中型生物而言为困难地形。深泥沼中的方格会让中型生物每格额外花费10英尺速度，而不只是5英尺！若泥沼深到使生物无法触及底部，该生物必须使用运动学游泳（DC 12）。

• 下层植被：困难地形。茂密下层植被会为其中的任何人提供标准掩蔽，但穿行其间更为艰难。每个方格需要额外花费10英尺移动，而不只是5英尺！

描述

景象：繁茂叶片、成团蠓虫、覆藻水面、高脚屋棚、穿梭的小鱼

声音：青蛙呱鸣、虫鸣啁啾、咕嘟作响的水泡、扑通溅水声

气味：浓郁苔藓与藻类味、刺鼻沼泽气体

触感：拨开漂浮腐屑、纠缠的蔓生植物、黏稠厚泥

天气：令人窒闷的潮湿、凝滞空气、倾盆大雨、透下的阳光束

地下

大多数地下环境由洞穴与其他天然地貌构成。人工地下城与遗迹会将地下特征与城市特征（如楼梯与墙壁）结合在一起。深地下穹窖具有一些与山地相同的地形特征，例如峡谷与峭壁。

• 峭壁与坡面：使用运动学@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{攀爬}峭壁（倾斜崖壁DC 10，陡峭崖壁DC 15，垂直崖壁或几乎无落手点的陡崖DC 20）。若无安全措施（例如让上方的生物固定绳索），一次大成功或大失败 失败可能导致显著的坠落 伤害（钝击伤害等于坠落距离的一半）。

• 地面：天然洞穴地面很少平坦，往往有突兀的高差变化：要么是困难地形，要么需要使用特技进行@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{保持平衡}（DC 10或12）。

• 狭缘：在狭窄岩缘上移动需要使用特技保持平衡（DC 12）。

• 岩浆：深地下洞穴可能有岩浆流动。仅靠近岩浆的热量就有害，会对10英尺内的任何人每轮造成1d6火焰伤害。跳入岩浆对任何不免疫火焰者几乎等同于必死——每轮造成20d6火焰伤害！

• 碎石：困难地形。特别深或遍布的碎石在穿越时也需要使用特技在其上保持平衡（DC 17）。

• 墙壁：使用运动学攀爬天然洞壁（DC 20）。由于大多数洞穴由水形成，洞壁常常潮湿，使DC变为22或25。

景象：蜿蜒通道、噼啪作响的昏黄火把光、不平或开裂的地面、古老文字或建筑、石笋与钟乳石

描述

声音：冷凝水滴落、老鼠或昆虫窸窣爬行、远处机械的咣当声、你话语与脚步的尖薄回声

气味：凝滞空气的陈腐味、硫磺、金属沉积的腥涩味

触感：粗糙岩壁、被侵蚀磨平的石面、蛛网

天气：地下冷空气的寒意、地热暖流

城市

城市环境包括开阔的城市空间以及建筑物。本节中的建筑信息同样适用于遗迹与人造地下城。

• 人群：拥挤的主干道与类似区域为困难地形。你可以允许生物用交涉、威吓或表演来说服人群让开一条通路。

当人群暴露在明显危险中（如火灾或横冲直撞的怪物）时，会试图尽快远离危险；但人群也会被自身规模拖慢。逃散的人群通常以25英尺的速度移动，并可能踩踏或抛下移动较慢的成员。

• 门：开门需要一个互动动作。上锁的门需要生物使用盗贼技能进行@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{开锁}。DC与开启该锁所需成功次数取决于锁的品质。记住，大成功或大失败 成功等同于两次成功！

• 屋顶：平屋顶易于穿行。斜屋顶要求生物使用特技进行@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{保持平衡}（DC 13）；若屋顶特别陡，则改为使用运动学攀爬（DC 13）。

从一处屋顶飞跃到另一处，往往需要使用运动学进行@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{跳远}，不过有些建筑距离足够近，可以直接跃过。若要触及更高的屋顶，可能需要跳高。

• 下水道：下水道通常位于街道等级以下10英尺或更深，并配有梯子或其他上下通行方式。沿墙的抬高步道为下水道工人提供许可，而中央水道则输送污物。下水道格栅通常需要2个或更多互动动作才能打开；不过也可能上锁，使用上文“上锁的门”的规则。

• 楼梯：对向上移动的生物而言为困难地形；对向下移动的生物而言为正常地形。

• 墙壁：使用运动学@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{攀爬}（砌石墙DC 18，砖墙DC 20）。

描述

景象：熙攘人群、家畜、多层建筑、在街上翻飞的垃圾

声音：报信人吆喝、孩子叫喊、车轮辘辘作响

气味：新鲜出炉的面包、烟囱炊烟、工业废气、香水、污水

触感：光滑的鹅卵石路

天气：雨点打在屋顶上

在奥塔里

这些细节在@UUID[JournalEntry.sgxbTVNpwJ0jWBvw]{奥塔里 Otari}尤为明显。

描述

景象：停泊的渔船满载鲜鱼、木材沿着道路滑向码头

气味：刚捕捞的鱼、 تازه切下的木材清香

声音：锯木厂锯片的嗡鸣



原文:

Environment rules bring the locales your party travels through to life. You can often just use common sense as you run the game in different environments, but you need special rules for ones that really stand out. The entries below provide rules for special types of terrain, plus a few suggestions of sensory details you can add in as the heroes explore that environment. Many places have elements from multiple environments—for example, a snow-covered mountain might use both the arctic and mountain environment rules. The DCs here are typical ones provided for convenience. You can change the DCs as needed, using the normal rules for setting @UUID[.7ki36LtGrCjGHugy]{Simple DCs}, and you can always choose to use just the environment rules that work best for your game.

Many adventures take place in dungeons—underground strongholds, warrens, or crypts that have become the dens of dangerous creatures. A dungeon could be constructed or naturally occurring, but either way, it combines the features of underground and urban environments found below. Regardless, your adventure can be set anywhere!

Aquatic

Aquatic environments are among the most challenging for heroes, short of other worlds and unusual dimensions.

• Swimming: Athletics skill to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swim}(DC 10 for still water, 15 for flowing water, and 20 for swiftly flowing water).

• Currents: Ocean currents, flowing rivers, and similar moving water are @UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.hYwHTbxIwLVsCIhJ#difficult-terrain]{Difficult Terrain} for a creature swimming against the current. If a creature’s in a current at the end of its turn, it moves a certain distance depending on the speed of the current (usually 5 feet or 10 feet). For instance, a 10-foot current moves a creature 10 feet in the current’s direction at the end of that creature’s turn.

Descriptions

Sights: choppy water, rolling waves, sunlight glinting, the curve of the horizon, driftwood

Sounds: waves lapping against a ship, seabirds' cries, fluttering sails, creatures breaching the surface

Smells: salt water, crisp fresh air, dead fish

Textures: frigid water, slimy seaweed, crusty salt collecting on surfaces

Arctic

The main challenge in an arctic environment is the low temperature, as described in the @UUID[.mhP6TyghfJ6AE3ia]{Weather} journal, but arctic environments also contain ice and snow.

• Ice: Acrobatics skill to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{Balance} without falling down (DC 12).

• Snow: Difficult terrain.

Descriptions

Sights: blinding reflected sunlight, snowy plains, distant glaciers, deep crevasses, rocky cliffs, ice floes and bergs, animal tracks in snow

Sounds: howling winds, drips of melting ice, utter quiet

Smells: clean air, half-frozen bog, lichen, seaweed

Textures: crunching snow, hard ice

Weather: frigid gales, light snowfall, pounding blizzard

Desert

Desert encompasses both sandy and rocky deserts as well as rugged badlands.

• Rubble: Rocky deserts are strewn with rubble, which is difficult terrain. Rubble dense enough to be walked over rather than navigated through requires Acrobatics to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{Balance}as well (DC 15).

• Sand: Packed sand doesn’t impede movement, but loose sand is difficult terrain. Especially deep or loose sand requires a creature crossing it to use Acrobatics to Balance (DC 20).

Descriptions

Sights: blinding reflected sunlight, rolling dunes, a mirage, circling vultures

Sounds: rustling winds, cascading sand, insects at night

Smells: dust, desert herbs

Textures: coarse sand, warm rock, dry brush

Weather: direct heat, dust devil, sandstorm

Forest

These environments include jungles and other wooded areas.

• Trees: Athletics to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} a tree (DC 15). Trees that take up an entire 5-foot square on the map (or more) are big enough to provide standard cover; narrower trees don’t.

• Undergrowth: Difficult terrain. Heavy undergrowth gives standard cover to anyone in it, but it’s even harder to move through. Each square costs 10 extra feet of movement, not just 5!

• Vines: Acrobatics or Athletics skill to swing on a vine (DC 15).

Descriptions

Sights: towering trees, dense undergrowth, verdant canopies, colorful wildlife, dappled sunlight through the trees, mossy tree trunks, twisted roots

Sounds: rustling leaves, snapping branches, animal calls

Smells: decomposing vegetation, flowering plants, pine trees, earthy mushrooms

Textures: leaves crunching underfoot, scraping branches, water dripping from above, rough bark

Weather: still air, cool shade, sporadic breeze, rain on the canopy, branches coated in thick snow

Mountain

Mountain environments also include hills, which share many aspects of mountains, though not their more extreme features.

• Chasms: Athletics to make a @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump} across a chasm or similar natural pit (DC 15 for a chasm 10 feet across; add 5 to the DC for every 5 feet wider). Failing to make the jump means taking bludgeoning damage from the fall equal to half the distance fallen. Alternatively, creatures can take the safer but slower route of Climbing down the near side of the chasm and then ascending the far side to get across. Good depths for chasms are 30 feet or 50 feet. Much deeper, and the fall is likely to kill a hero!

• Cliffs and Slopes: Athletics to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} a cliff (DC 10 for sloped cliffs, 15 for steep cliffs, or 20 for sheer cliffs or steep ones with few handholds). Without extensive safety precautions, such as having a creature farther up secure a rope, a critical failure can result in significant falling damage.

• Lava: A volcano might have small lava flows. Just the heat from being near lava is harmful, dealing 1d6 fire damage each round to anyone within 10 feet. Going into the lava is almost certain death for anyone not immune to fire. It deals 20d6 fire damage every round!

• Rubble and Scree: Difficult terrain. Especially deep or pervasive rubble requires Acrobatics to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{Balance} as well (DC 15).

• Undergrowth: Difficult terrain. Thick undergrowth on mountains is rare and follows the rules found under forests.

Descriptions

Sights: bare cliffs, snow caps, hardy trees, slopes littered with scree, fallen rocks, birds flying on currents, fog among the peaks

Sounds: howling wind, falling rocks, clear echoes, crunch of rocks underfoot, distant avalanche

Smells: blowing dust, pine trees, fresh snow

Textures: rough stone, powdery snow, unstable rubble

Weather: swirling clouds, chill of high altitude, direct sunlight, powerful wind and rain

Plains

The plains environment encompasses grasslands, such as savannas and farmland. Such terrain is usually fairly flat and easy to traverse.

• Undergrowth: Difficult terrain. Thick undergrowth in plains is rare (usually planted hedges or tall crops like corn) and follows the rules found under forests.

Descriptions

Sights: grass waving gently, scattered wildflowers, rocky outcroppings or boulders, the curve of the horizon

Sounds: rustling wind, birdsong, distant sounds carried far

Smells: fresh air, earthy soil, distant carcasses

Textures: touch of tall grass, rasp of scrub brush, crunch of dry dirt

Weather: cooling of gentle wind, heat of direct sunlight, massive black thunderclouds

Swamp

Wetlands are the most common kind of swamp, but this category also includes drier marshes such as moors.

• Bogs: Shallow bogs are difficult terrain for Medium creatures. Squares in deep bogs cost Medium creatures 10 extra feet of Speed per square, not just 5! If a bog is deep enough that a creature can’t reach the bottom, the creature has to use Athletics to Swim (DC 12).

• Undergrowth: Difficult terrain. Heavy undergrowth gives standard cover to anyone in it, but it’s even harder to move through. Each square costs 10 extra feet of movement, not just 5!

Descriptions

Sights: lush leaves, clouds of gnats, algae-coated water, shacks on stilts, darting fish

Sounds: croaking frogs, chirping insects, bubbling waters, splashing

Smells: rich moss and algae, pungent swamp gases

Textures: pushing through floating detritus, tangling creepers, thick mud

Weather: oppressive humidity, still air, pouring rain, rays of sunlight

Underground

Most underground environments consist of caves and other natural formations. Artificial dungeons and ruins combine underground features with urban features, like stairs and walls. Deep underground vaults have some of the same terrain features as mountains, such as chasms and cliffs.

• Cliffs and Slopes: Athletics to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} a cliff (DC 10 for sloped cliffs, 15 for steep cliffs, or 20 for sheer cliffs or steep ones with few handholds). Without safety precautions like a creature farther up securing a rope, a critical failure can result in significant falling damage (bludgeoning damage equal to half the distance fallen).

• Floors: Natural cavern floors are rarely flat. They tend to have abrupt changes in elevation that are difficult terrain or require using Acrobatics to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{Balance} (DC 10 or 12).

• Ledges: Moving across a narrow ledge requires using Acrobatics to Balance (DC 12).

• Magma: Caverns deep underground might have magma flowing within. Just the heat from being near magma is harmful, causing 1d6 fire damage each round to anyone within 10 feet. Going into the magma is almost certain death for anyone not immune to fire. It deals 20d6 fire damage every round!

• Rubble: Difficult terrain. Especially deep or pervasive rubble requires Acrobatics to Balance on when crossing it as well (DC 17).

• Walls: Athletics to Climb a natural cave wall (DC 20). Since most caves are formed by water, cave walls are often damp, making the DC 22 or 25.

Sights: winding passages, sputtering yellow torchlight, uneven or cracked floors, ancient writings or architecture, stalagmites and stalactites

Descriptions

Sounds: dripping condensation, scurrying rats or insects, distant clunks of machinery, tinny echoes of your voices and footsteps

Smells: staleness of still air, sulfur, tang of metal deposits

Textures: rough rock walls, stone smoothed by erosion, cobwebs

Weather: chill of underground air, geothermal heat

Urban

Urban environments include open city spaces as well as buildings. The building information in this section also applies to ruins and constructed dungeons.

• Crowds: Crowded thoroughfares and similar areas are difficult terrain. You might allow a creature to persuade a crowd to part and allow it to pass using Diplomacy, Intimidation, or Performance.

A crowd exposed to an obvious danger, like a fire or a rampaging monster, attempts to move away from the danger as quickly as possible, but a crowd is slowed by its own mass. A fleeing crowd typically moves at a Speed of 25 feet, potentially trampling or leaving behind slower-moving members of the crowd.

• Doors: Opening a door takes an Interact action. Locked doors require a creature to use Thievery to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick a Lock}. The DC and number of successes required to open the lock depend on the quality of the lock. Remember that a critical success is worth two successes!

• Rooftops: Flat roofs are easy to move across. Angled roofs require creatures to use Acrobatics to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{Balance} (DC 13) or, if they’re especially steep, Athletics to Climb (DC 13).

Hurtling from roof to roof often requires using Athletics for a @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}, though some buildings are close enough to Leap between. A High Jump might be necessary to reach a higher roof.

• Sewers: Sewers are generally 10 feet or more below street level and are equipped with ladders or other means to ascend and descend. Raised paths along the walls allow sewer workers access, while channels in the center carry waste. Sewers grates require 2 or more Interact actions to open, though they might be locked using the rules for locked doors above.

• Stairs: Difficult terrain for creatures moving up them, normal for creatures moving down.

• Walls: Athletics to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} (DC 18 for a constructed stone wall, DC 20 for a brick wall).

Descriptions

Sights: milling crowds, domesticated animals, multi-story buildings, trash blowing in the streets

Sounds: town criers, shouting children, rattling wagon wheels

Smells: freshly baked bread, chimney smoke, industrial fumes, perfume, sewage

Textures: smooth cobblestones

Weather: rain on the rooftops

In Otari

These details are especially pronounced in @UUID[JournalEntry.sgxbTVNpwJ0jWBvw]{Otari}.

Descriptions

Sights: docked boats laden with fish, lumber sliding down the road toward the dock

Smells: caught fish, freshly cut lumber

Sounds: sawmill blades whirring
Environments.name: 环境 Environments

Drawing a Map.name: 绘制地图 Drawing a Map
Drawing a Map.text:
许多冒险都聚焦于单一地点或地下城。一旦你了解了你的冒险故事，就可以开始绘制地图，让你更容易追踪各处事物的位置。最好先在方格纸上画出地图草图，让方格纸上的每一格代表 5 英尺见方。然后，在你主持游戏时，你可以使用带有 1 英寸网格的地图（其中每一平方英寸代表 5 英尺见方）。

当你第一次绘制地图时，应该用铅笔，这样便于你轻松修改。你也可以随手为每个房间记下注释，比如“岗哨”或“蜘蛛巢”。

示例地图

这里你可以看到用于制作《奥塔里 Otari之下的威胁》地图第一等级的草图！在它下方是一组符号，你可以用来表示大多数地下城里常见的要素：门、楼梯、陷阱、立柱等等。

绘图建议

• 避免空房间：不要加入太多空房间，因为它们会让你的地图变得臃肿，而且很快就会变得无聊与重复。

• 预留扩展空间：除非你确定不会再回到这座地下城，否则应当为未来冒险预留可扩展的空间。一条通往地图边缘之外的隧道、一段向下延伸的楼梯或一个巨大的深坑，都能引导通往新的区域。

• 避免对称：避免制作左右对称、其中一半完全镜像另一半的地下城——这不现实，而且当玩家意识到他们只需探索地下城的一半就能“看完全部”时，可能会感到失望。

• 变化房间形状：别只画一堆矩形房间，加入一些奇形怪状的房间、壁龛、多层房间、不规则洞窟以及其他变化。你可以参考现实世界地点的地图来获取灵感。

• 使用宽走廊：记住《探路者》的战斗以 5 英尺方格为基础。如果你把地下城塞满 5 英尺宽的走廊，可能会出现某些英雄或怪物实际上根本进不了战斗的情况！

• 不要做成迷宫：避免把地图做成迷宫的诱惑——一旦实际游玩，探索迷宫很快就会变得乏味，尤其是当你在游戏中把大部分时代都花在垫子上画曲折走廊，而不是用来主持战斗时！

完善地图

当你对地图满意后，用墨水描绘铅笔线会让地图更容易阅读。你可以用粗头笔绘制实墙；细笔则非常适合画门与地图符号。添加颜色（无论用彩笔还是彩铅）会让地图更清晰易读。给每个房间编号，便于你在笔记中引用。如果可能，编号标记使用与地图其他内容不同的颜色，让数字标签更醒目。

如果你有电脑和扫描仪，可以扫描你的地图，然后用图像编辑程序进行优化。这样做很方便：如果你用墨水在地图上画错了，就可以用这种方式修正。诸如家具、火坑、立柱等细节能为有人居住的地下城增添一丝接触的真实感；不过如果你愿意即兴处理，也可以在战斗网格上绘制时再把这些细节补上。

完成地图后，你可以把它上传到你选择的 VTT，并按需添加墙体、光源或棋子。即使是手绘地图，在数字环境中也完全可用——只要记得配上房间描述，为你的创作注入生命力！

奇特房间

如果你在为地图构思点子时很难挤出时代，可以从《奥塔里 Otari之下的威胁》中获取灵感，或使用下面这些经典点子。

  • 怪物兵营，里面满是肮脏的稻草巢。

  • 俯瞰深渊的狭窄岩架。

  • 岩壁中的天然烟囱，英雄可攀爬而上以触及更高的等级。
  • 布满尘埃的古老图书馆。
  • 长走廊，两侧排列着雕像或成列的护甲。
  • 下水道室，两侧被栅门封堵，而开启栅门的拉杆在另一间房里。
  • 宴饮大厅，中央有一个大型火坑。
  • 关押守卫兽的围栏区。
  • 博物馆，展示由永久幻术制成的艺术品。
  • 别忘了厕所！


原文:

Many adventures focus on a single location or dungeon. Once you know your adventure's story, you can start drawing the map to make it easier to keep track of where everything is. It's best to draw the map on a sheet of graph paper first, with each square on the graph paper representing a 5-foot square. Then, when you run the game, you can use a map with a 1-inch grid (where every square inch represents a 5-foot square).

When you first draw your map, you should use a pencil so you can make changes easily. You can also jot down notes for each room as they come to you, like "guard post" or "spider nest."

Sample Map

Here you can see the sketch used to make the first level of the "Menace under Otari" map! Below it is a set of symbols you can use to represent common features found in most dungeons: doors, stairs, traps, pillars, and more.

Mapping Tips

• Avoid Empty Rooms: Don’t add too many empty rooms, as they can clutter your map and get boring and repetitive quickly.

• Leave Room for Expansion: Unless you’re certain you don’t want to return to your dungeon, allow for places to expand later for future adventures. A tunnel running off the edge of the map, a flight of stairs leading down, or a large pit can all lead the way to new areas.

• Avoid Symmetry: Refrain from creating symmetrical dungeons in which one half is an exact mirror image of the other— it's unrealistic, and the players might be disappointed when they realize that they only have to explore half of a dungeon to see it all.

• Vary Room Shapes: Instead of just a bunch of rectangles, include strangely shaped rooms, alcoves, multilevel rooms, irregular caverns, and other variations. You can look at maps of real-world locations to get some ideas.

• Use Wide Corridors: Remember that combat in Pathfinder is based on 5-foot squares. If you fill your dungeon with 5-foot-wide hallways, you might end up with combats in which some of the heroes or monsters can’t actually get into the fight!

• Don't Make a Maze: Avoid the temptation to make your map into a maze- exploring one gets old quick once you're playing, especially if you spend most of your time during the game drawing twisted corridors on your mat when you could be running combat!

Finishing the Map

Once you're happy with your map, inking in the pencil lines makes the map a lot easier to read. You can use a fat-tipped pen to draw solid walls. Thinner pens are great for drawing doors and map symbols. Adding color (whether with pens or colored pencils) makes your map even easier to read. Number each room so you can easily refer to it in your notes. If possible, use a pen of a different color from anything else on your map so the number tags are easy to see.

If you have a computer and scanner, you can scan your map and then use an image-editing program to refine it. This is handy if you make an error on the map with ink and need to fix things. Details such as furniture, fire pits, pillars, and so on add a touch of realism to inhabited dungeons, but you can also add these when you draw it on a battle grid if you feel comfortable doing so on the fly.

Once you've finished your map, you can upload it to your VTT of choice and add walls, lights, or tokens as you see fit. Even a hand-drawn map can work perfectly well in a digital environment- just be sure to supplement it with descriptions of the rooms to breathe some life into your creation! 

Strange Rooms

If you’re having a hard time coming up with ideas for your map, you can take ideas from “Menace under Otari,” or use some of these classic ideas.

  • Monster barracks full of filthy straw nests.

  • Narrow ledge overlooking a chasm.

  • Natural chimney in the rock that the heroes can climb up to reach a higher level.
  • Ancient library covered in dust.
  • Long hallway with rows of statues or suits of armor.
  • Sewer chamber blocked by gates on each side, with the levers to open them in another room.
  • Feasting hall with a large fire pit in the center.
  • Pens where guard animals are kept.
  • Museum with art made of permanent illusions.
  • Don't forget the latrines!

Downtime.name: 休整模式 Downtime
Downtime.text:
当英雄们返回家中或因其他原因而不在冒险时，他们处于休整模式。这段时代是他们进行日常活动的机会，例如购买道具。你的游戏里甚至可能完全没有休整模式！如果英雄们在两次冒险之间确实有一些空闲时代，只要请玩家花几分钟描述他们的英雄在这段时代里做了什么即可。你很可能不需要扮演任何场景。完整的《探路者》游戏会更重视休整模式，因为英雄所做的选择会贯穿全部20个等级的游戏过程。

英雄们在休整模式期间很可能会做的两件事，是购买魔法物品，以及休息足够长的时间来从各种病痛中恢复。一名英雄若在完整的24小时里除了休息什么也不做，则其恢复的生命值等于其体质属性的两倍，而非通常8小时休息所恢复的正常数值。1级以上的英雄 Heroes将该数值再乘以其等级。



原文:

When the heroes return home or otherwise aren’t adventuring, they’re in downtime. This is their time to do everyday activities, such as buying gear. You might not have any downtime in your games at all! If the heroes do have some time off between adventures, just ask the players to spend a few minutes describing what their heroes do in that time. You probably won’t need to roleplay any scenes. Downtime is a bigger focus of the full Pathfinder game since the choices the heroes make carry across all 20 levels of play.

Two things heroes can likely do during downtime are shop for magic items and rest long enough to recover from ailments. A hero who does nothing but rest for a full 24-hour period recovers Hit Points equal to double their Constitution instead of the normal amount from an 8-hour rest. Heroes above 1st level multiply this amount by their level.

Menace Under Otari.name: 奥塔里地下的威胁 Menace Under Otari

Hungry Rats.name: 饥饿的巨鼠 Hungry Rats
Hungry Rats.text:
第一场遭遇发生在奥塔里渔场（Otari Fishery）的地下室里。巨鼠已经被布置在房间里了，但目前处于隐藏状态。它们会在发动攻击时现身；在此之前，先让它们保持隐藏，并把以下内容读给玩家听：

通往奥塔里渔场地下室的楼梯因为上了年纪而嘎吱作响，你们下楼去寻找那只吃了所有鱼的野兽。在房间的中央，在支撑着渔场上方结构的石柱之间，是装满咸鱼的木桶。其中两个桶被砸开了，里面的东西都洒到了地上。在东面的墙上有一个大洞，通向黑暗。
就在几小时前，你们与其他几位冒险家一起聚集在塔米莉·坦德威尔（Tamily Tanderveil）的办公室里；她表示只要你们能终结这场威胁，就会付给你们每人10金币。你们同意帮她完成这件简单差事时，她欣喜若狂；但当你们沿楼梯下行时，却不禁开始怀疑：这趟差事或许会比你们原先预想的更像一场真正的冒险。

依序绕桌一圈，询问每位玩家他们的英雄在房间里想做的第一件事是什么。当每位玩家描述行动时，允许他们在这个区域内移动自己的指示物，但暂时不要让他们离开房间。

房间北侧与南侧沿墙的架子上堆满了渔场的各类常备物资。检查东侧墙上洞口的英雄，会在房间内侧发现成堆的松散岩石与泥土；看起来像是有什么东西从另一侧把墙撞穿了！

当每位玩家都有机会做完一件事后，一阵不祥的窸窣声从墙上的洞里传来——巨鼠现身并发动攻击！把以下内容读给玩家听。

墙上的洞里传出一种古怪的吱吱声。突然，一只体型如狗般巨大的老鼠从黑暗中钻出——而且它并不孤单！巨鼠朝你们猛冲而来，巨大的牙齿喀哒作响。

战斗和先攻 Combat and Initiative

 知识库：战斗

开始一场战斗 Starting a Combat

你需要每位玩家各对应一只巨鼠。当你准备好后，你应当：

  • 在地图上揭示老鼠指示物：选中它们，右键其中一个，然后点击“Toggle Visibility State”。
  • 通过拖拽框选来同时选中老鼠与英雄的指示物。右键其中一个，选择“Toggle Combat State”。
  • 当它们被加入战斗追踪器后，你可以选择“Roll NPCs”来为所有老鼠快速掷先攻。
  • 玩家可以在战斗追踪器中点击自己角色旁的 d20 图标来掷先攻。

弹出一个侧边栏标签页 Popping Out a Sidebar Tab

战斗开始后，你需要留意聊天栏以查看掷骰结果。与其在遭遇追踪器标签与聊天标签之间来回切换，你可以在侧边栏中对标签的图标（交叉的双剑）进行“双击右键”将战斗追踪器弹出。这样你就能把它放在任何你想放的位置，而不必分散注意力。事实上，你可以对任何标签页这么做，包括聊天记录本身！

在战斗中，每位玩家轮流行动，并遵循关于能做什么与不能做什么的特定规则。关于如何逐步处理战斗，请参见 @UUID[JournalEntry.S1UnJk4t55aRFaCs.JournalEntryPage.ZFjG6Np42VRz5hFu]{Encounters} 日志。

遭遇 Encounter

@Actor[AYwdybUfm4meGUTJ]{巨鼠 Giant Rats (4)}

点击上方的 Giant Rats 可查看巨鼠的属性。

在它们的回合中，每只老鼠都会朝不同的英雄移动并攻击；若有英雄倒地昏迷，老鼠便转而移动到下一个最近的目标并攻击。

攻击 Attacks

当生物使用“打击（Strike）”动作进行一次攻击时，先从你武器的触及（或射程）内选择一个目标。接着，你可以把鼠标悬停在指示物上并按下键盘上的 T 键来将其设为目标；你也可以点击指示物菜单上的选定目标按钮。若你作为 GM 需要标记多个目标，可以选中多个指示物后按 T；而玩家若要标记多个目标，则可在悬停各指示物时按住 Shift 再按 T。

要使用巨鼠的啃咬进行攻击，打开巨鼠的角色卡（双击巨鼠指示物），在卡表的“攻击 Attacks”栏目中、啃咬（Jaws）条目下方点击“Strike (+7)”。这会弹出对话框询问是否要应用任何调整值；由于这里没有，直接点击“Roll (+7)”。

系统会自动把结果与目标的 AC 进行比较，甚至会把夹击等因素也纳入计算！这种自动化能为 GM 省下大量时间，但仍值得检查一下自己是否遗漏了诸如掩蔽等带来的调整值。

若总攻击结果至少比英雄的 AC 高出 10 点，则为大成功或大失败命中！重击造成双倍伤害，并会在聊天卡片中以绿色标示。

要掷伤害，点击聊天侧边栏中的“伤害”按钮（若为重击，则点击“大成功或大失败”）。当伤害显示在聊天记录后，你可以选中受影响的指示物，并点击伤害总值下方的对应按钮，以应用相应的伤害数值。

经验值 Experience Points

击败巨鼠后，给予每位英雄 80 XP。

战斗之后 After Combat

一旦其中一方被击败或逃离，你就不再需要追踪动作，英雄也不必再按顺序行动。改为再绕桌一圈，询问玩家英雄接下来想做什么。若英雄回去与塔米莉交谈，她得知老鼠已死会如释重负，但她确信这些破坏不可能全是老鼠造成的。英雄若想拿到报酬，就必须继续深入探索。当玩家决定探索此房间之外的区域时，请翻到 @UUID[.VLztUZ1H5YEYPcx9]{02: 深入黑暗 Drop into Darkness}。



原文:

The first encounter happens in the basement of the Otari Fishery. The giant rats are already placed in the room for you, but currently, they're hidden. You'll reveal them when they attack, but for now, leave them hidden and read the following to the players:

The stairs leading into the basement of the Otari Fishery creak with age as you make your way downstairs to find the beast that has been eating all the fish. In the center of the room, between stone pillars holding up the fishery overhead, are barrels filled with salted fish. Two of these barrels have been smashed open, spilling their contents on the floor. In the east wall is a large hole, opening into darkness.
Just a few hours ago, you gathered with a few other adventurers in the office of Tamily Tanderveil, where she offered you ten gold pieces each if you could put an end to this menace. She was thrilled when you agreed to help her with this simple task, but as you make your way downstairs, you can't help but wonder if this might be a lot more adventure than you bargained for.

Go around the table and ask each player the first thing they want their hero to do in the room. As each player describes their action, allow them to move their token around this area, but don't let them leave the room just yet.

The shelves along the walls on the north and south sides of the room are piled high with general supplies that belong to the fishery. Heroes who investigate the hole in the wall on the east side of the room find piles of loose rock and dirt on the inside of the room. It looks like something has broken open the wall from the other side!

After each player has had a chance to do one thing, an ominous skittering noise comes from the hole in the wall- giant rats emerge to attack! Read the following to the players.

A strange chittering comes from the hole in the wall. Suddenly, a massive rat the size of a dog emerges from the darkness—and it isn't alone! The giant rats rush toward you, their huge teeth snapping.

Combat and Initiative

 Knowledge Base: Combat

Starting a Combat

You'll need one giant rat for each player. When you're ready, you should:

  • Reveal the rat tokens on the map by selecting them, right-clicking on one, and clicking "Toggle Visibility State".
  • Select the tokens for the rats and the heroes by drag-selecting them all. Right-click one of them, and choose "Toggle Combat State"
  • Once they're added to the combat tracker, you can quickly roll initiative for all of the rats by choosing "Roll NPCs."
  • Your players may roll initiative by clicking the d20 icon next to their character in the combat tracker.

Popping Out a Sidebar Tab

Once combat's begun, you'll need to keep an eye on the chat to see the results of rolls. Instead of needing to tab between the encounter tracker tab and the chat tab, you can pop the combat tracker out by double right-clicking on the tab's icon (the crossed swords) on your sidebar. This will let you position it wherever you'd like without needing to split attention. In fact, you can do this to any tab, including the chat log itself!

In combat, each player takes turns and follows specific rules about what they can and can't do. See the @UUID[JournalEntry.S1UnJk4t55aRFaCs.JournalEntryPage.ZFjG6Np42VRz5hFu]{Encounters} journal for step-by-step instructions on how to handle combat.

Encounter

@Actor[AYwdybUfm4meGUTJ]{Giant Rats (4)}

The Giant rats' statistics can be viewed by clicking Giant Rats above.

On its turn, each rat moves toward a different hero and attacks. If a hero falls unconscious, the rat moves to the next nearest and attacks.

Attacks

When a creature uses the Strike action to make an attack, first pick a target within the reach (or range) of your weapon. Then, you can hover over a token and press 'T' on your keyboard to designate it as a target. You can also click the targeting button on the token menu. If you need to mark more than one target as a GM, you can select multiple tokens and press T, while as a player you can hold shift before pressing T while hovering each token you wish to target.

To attack using the Jaws of a Giant Rat, open the character sheet for the rat (by double-clicking on the Giant Rat Token) and click the "Strike (+7)" button in the Attacks section of the sheet listed below the Jaws attack. This will open a dialog box asking if there are any modifiers that need to be applied. Since we have none, simply click "Roll (+7)".

The system will compare your result to the target's AC automatically. It even takes into account things like flanking! This automation can save a lot of time for the GM, but it's always worth checking to make sure you didn't forget a modifier from something like cover.

If the total attack roll is at least 10 more than the hero's Armor class, it's a critical hit! These deal twice as much damage, and are marked in green in the chat card.

To roll damage, click the "Damage" button in the chat sidebar (or "Critical" if the attack was a critical hit). Once the damage appears in the chat log, you can select the token affected and click the appropriate button beneath the damage total to apply the appropriate damage value. 

Experience Points

For defeating the giant rats, give each hero 80 XP.

After Combat

Once one side is defeated or flees, you don't need to track actions anymore and heroes no longer need to act in order. Instead, go around the table and ask the players what the heroes would like to do next. If the heroes return to talk to Tamily, she’s relieved to learn that the rats are dead, but she is certain that rats couldn't have caused all of the destruction below. The heroes will have to explore further if they want to earn their reward. When the players decide to explore beyond this room, turn to @UUID[.VLztUZ1H5YEYPcx9]{02: Drop into Darkness}

Drop into Darkness.name: 深入黑暗 Drop into Darkness
Drop into Darkness.text:
在对付老鼠后，英雄们可以自由探索储藏室东墙上的洞。它足够大，足以让人类轻松爬行通过。一旦第一个英雄进入洞口另一端的区域，大声朗读以下内容。

从洞口挤过去之后，你发现自己置身于一个洞穴中，这个洞穴似乎在奥塔里的街道下方无尽延伸。谁知道下面潜伏着什么威胁呢？前方，通道尽头是一道断崖，陡然坠入黑暗之中。

闯入储藏室的怪物使用这条通道挖穿了墙壁，但他们来自奥塔里地下那片庞大洞穴群的更深处。

技能检定 Skill Checks

为了继续他们的冒险，玩家必须想办法爬下这道又短又滑的断崖。这里不需要使用战斗能力；相反，每位英雄都需要各自尝试一次@UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.DyVmklA6nwuY8sgU]，以确定他们成功或失败。该检定需要使用运动技能，而运动技能用于攀爬墙壁、绳索和树木。其他技能及其用途列表可在@UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.UexG8C5tSZQUdV7z]中找到。

断崖只有10英尺高，但表面因潮湿而光滑。安全@Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]需要一次@Check[athletics|dc:15]检定。

技能和检定 Skills and Checks

@UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.nQgj1rvfQhLtlspj] @UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.DyVmklA6nwuY8sgU]

你可能已经注意到，上面的技能检定其实是一个按钮！当你选中一个指示物时点击该按钮，会使用该生物的数据来结算检定——在此例中，是一个DC为15的运动技能检定。生成的聊天卡会自动计入你的调整值，并给出你的成功度。

当然，理想情况下，你会希望玩家自己来掷这个检定。你仍然可以让他们进行运动技能检定并由你自行将结果与DC对比；另一种做法则是按下检定按钮上的小对话泡图标。这样会把按钮发到聊天栏，但不会分享按钮周围仅GM可见的文字，让玩家能在不担心剧透的情况下轻松掷出他们的技能检定！

绳索与其他形式的援助

玩家可能会决定用绳子帮助他们攀下断崖。他们可以轻易把绳子系在附近众多结实的石笋之一上。完成后，上下攀爬所需的运动检定仅需进行一次@Check[athletics|dc:10]；角色只有在骰出自然1时才会大失败，且若总和达到20或更高，则为大成功。

英雄们也可能尝试互相帮助上下攀爬。帮助他人攀爬的角色必须先尝试自己的运动检定来援助。若成功，正在攀爬的角色其检定获得+1环境加值（若援助者大成功则为+2）。提供援助的英雄之后自己上下攀爬时，仍必须掷出自己的运动检定。

投骰结果 Roll Result结果 Outcome

大成功 Critical Success
(投出自然20或总和大于等于25)

角色爬上或爬下断崖，安全抵达目的地。

成功 Success
(结果总和大于等于15)

角色在墙面上向上或向下攀爬5尺。他们必须再进行1次检定才能完成全程。

失败 Failure
(结果总和少于15)

角色完全没有进展，仍停留在墙面原处。

大失败 Critical Failure
(投出自然1或总和少于等于5)

角色摔落到地面。若他们位于顶端，则因坠落受到5点伤害；若他们在半途，则因坠落受到2点伤害。若角色正尝试向上攀爬且这是他们的第1次检定，他们只是摔成倒地且不受任何伤害。

经验值 Experience Points

一旦所有英雄都爬下断崖，给予每位英雄10XP，以奖励他们克服此挑战。

探索地下城 Exploring the Dungeon

一旦英雄爬下断崖，他们就可以继续前进到下一个区域。此隧道没什么值得注意的东西，但任何认真查看的人都能在尘垢中发现一条痕迹，清楚表明近来有生物从这里经过。然而，潮湿与时间已抹去诸如脚印等细节。洞室下部的蘑菇格外苦涩，但可以食用。

从这一刻起，角色可以按自己的节奏自由探索地下城。他们可以继续推进，或撤回上方的城镇休息并补充物资。

一旦英雄们探索过一个区域，该区域会保持他们上次离开时的状态。任何仍活着的怪物会恢复失去的生命值，但被杀死的怪物在英雄返回时依旧死亡。

光照 Light

从本区域开始，所有洞室都完全黑暗，除非其描述另有说明。因族裔或传承而拥有黑暗视觉的角色可以如常视物；其他人则需要自备光源才能看清。只要有一名角色手持火把，多数房间都足够狭小，火把便能照亮整个区域。

动态光照 Dynamic Lighting

 知识库：光照 @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4] @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.8Jdw4yAzWYylGePS]

Foundry VTT支持动态光照，这意味着指示物在移动时可以随身携带光源。

如果你的玩家持有火把，或能施放@Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]，他们可能会想在这里使用这些工具。不过，你不需要直接编辑指示物的光照设置——只要将法术卡上的“光亮术”光照效果拖到指示物上，他们就会立刻发出光源，为玩家及其盟友照亮场景。类似地，若角色用火把提供照明，他们可以在角色卡的动作（Actions）页签中，将火把装备在一只手上，并通过勾选框将其点燃。



原文:

After dealing with the rats, the heroes are free to explore the hole in the east wall of the storeroom. It is big enough for a human to crawl through with ease. Once the first hero enters the area beyond, read the following aloud.

Squeezing through the hole, you find yourself in a cavern that seems to stretch endlessly beneath the streets of Otari. Who knows what menace could be lurking down here? Up ahead, the passageway ends in a cliff that plunges sharply into the darkness.

The monsters that broke into the storeroom used this passageway to break through the wall, but they came from much deeper parts of the vast series of caverns beneath Otari.

Skill Checks

To continue on their adventure, the players must find a way to climb down a short, slippery cliff. Instead of using combat abilities, the heroes each need to attempt a @UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.DyVmklA6nwuY8sgU]{Skill Check} to see if they succeed or fail. This check requires the Athletics skill, which is used for climbing up and down walls, ropes, and trees. A list of the other skills and their uses can be found @UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.UexG8C5tSZQUdV7z]{here}.

The cliff is only 10 feet tall, but the surface is slick with moisture. @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climbing} safely requires a @Check[type:athletics|dc:15]{Athletics Skill Check}.

Skills and Checks

@UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.nQgj1rvfQhLtlspj]{Skills} @UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.DyVmklA6nwuY8sgU]{Checks}

You might have noticed that the skill check above is actually a button! Clicking it while you have a token selected will use that creature's statistics to resolve the check- in this case, an Athletics skill check with a DC of 15. The resulting chat card will take into account your modifiers and give you your degree of success, automatically.

Of course, ideally, you'd want your players to be able to roll that check. While you can still ask for an athletics skill check and compare the result to the DC yourself, another option is to press the little speech bubble icon on the check button. This will post the button to chat without sharing any of the GM-only text that surrounds it, allowing your players to easily roll their skill checks without risk of spoilers!

Rope and Other Forms of Aid

The players might decide to use rope to help them scale the cliff. They can easily tie a rope to one of numerous sturdy stalagmites nearby. Once this is done, the Athletics check to climb up or down is only a @Check[type:athletics|dc:10]{Athletics Skill Check}; a character critically fails only by rolling a 1 on the die, and they score a critical success if the total is 20 or higher.

The heroes might also try and help each other get up and down. A character helping someone else climb must attempt their own Athletics check to assist. If they succeed, the character climbing gets a +1 circumstance bonus to their check (+2 if the assisting character critically succeeds). A hero providing assistance must still roll their own Athletics check to climb up or down themself.

Roll ResultOutcome

Critical Success
(roll of 20 or total of 25 or more)

The character climbs up or down the cliff, reaching their destination safely.

Success
(total of 15 or more)

The character climbs 5 feet up or down the wall. They must roll another check to complete the journey.

Failure
(total of less than 15)

The character makes no progress at all. They stay where they are at on the wall.

Critical Failure
(roll of 1 or total of 5 or less)

The character falls to the ground. If they were at the top, they take 5 damage from the fall. If they were halfway up, they take only 2 damage from the fall. If the character was trying to climb up and this was their first check, they simply fall prone and take no damage.

Experience Points

Once the heroes have all climbed down the cliff, award them each 10 XP for overcoming this challenge.

Exploring the Dungeon

Once the heroes climb down the cliff, they can continue onward to the next area. There is little of interest in this tunnel, but anyone who looks can find a trail in the dust and grime, making it clear that creatures have come this way in the recent past. Moisture and time have obscured any details such as footprints, however. The mushrooms in the lower part of the chamber are particularly bitter, but edible.

From this point onward, the characters are free to explore the dungeon at their own pace. They can continue to press forward, or they can retreat back to the town above to rest and get new supplies.

Once the heroes have explored an area, that area remains as the heroes left it the last time they were there. Any monsters left alive recover lost Hit Points, but those that were killed remain dead upon the heroes’ return.

Light

From this area onward, the chambers are completely dark unless their descriptions state otherwise. Characters who have darkvision from their ancestry or heritage can see normally. Others need to provide their own source of light so that they can see. As long as one character is holding a torch, most of the rooms are small enough that the torch illuminates the entire area.

Dynamic Lighting

 Knowledge Base: Lighting @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.8Jdw4yAzWYylGePS]{Torch}

Foundry VTT supports dynamic lighting, which means that tokens can carry light sources around with them as they move.

If one of your players has access to a torch, or the light spell, they might want to make use of those tools here. There's no need to edit their token's light settings directly, however- if they drag the Light effect from their spell card to their token, they will immediately begin emanating a light source which will illuminate the scene for the player and their allies. Similarly, if a character is using a torch to provide light, they can equip the torch in a hand and light it with the checkbox on the actions tab of their character sheet.

The Spider’s Web.name: 蛛网 The Spider’s Web
The Spider’s Web.text:
这个房间里结有厚厚的网和一只巨大的蜘蛛。巨蜘蛛 Giant Spider指示物已帮你放置好了，但和前一个遭遇中的老鼠一样，它对玩家视野是隐藏的。当英雄们进入该区域时，大声朗读以下内容。

隧道继续向地下深处延伸，最终通向一个大洞窟。成片发光的蓝色真菌附着在天花板上，提供昏暗光照。你们只能勉强辨认出横跨洞穴地面与墙壁的巨大蛛丝，它们在钟乳石之间伸展，宛如闪烁的帷幕。

这场战斗使用与第一次对抗老鼠相同的规则，但它也加入了处理蛛网时的技能检定，并包含一种新的@UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.DyVmklA6nwuY8sgU]{检定}——豁免检定（saving throw）——用来抵抗蜘蛛带毒的噬咬！

这个洞窟是一只大蜘蛛的巢穴，它正等待伏击任何在蛛网间徘徊的东西。蛛网并不够黏，尚不足以让任何接触到它的人无法移动，但它确实会减慢角色的速度。每一个有蛛网的方格都是困难地形——特别难以通过的地形。移动进入一个困难地形的方格需要额外消耗5尺的移动，且生物不能以快步（Step）进入困难地形方格。蜘蛛不受蛛网影响，可以在洞窟内正常移动。

当玩家进入洞窟时，蜘蛛位于房间东北角的巢穴中。它不会现身攻击，直到有人触碰到它的蛛网。任何试图穿越房间且不触碰蛛网的人，都必须尝试一次@Check[type:acrobatics|dc:15]{Acrobatics 技能 检定}，小心地在岩石与狭窄的岩架上保持平衡。如果有人未通过该检定，蜘蛛就会感官到他们在洞窟中并现身攻击。

与蜘蛛的战斗流程和与老鼠的战斗非常相似。只要有人触到蛛网，或在穿越洞窟时进行特技检定保持平衡失败，就让所有人掷先攻——通常使用察觉，而任何当时在躲藏（Hiding）的人则使用隐秘（Stealth）。蜘蛛以察觉掷其先攻。

在你拿到所有人的先攻结果后，让先攻最高的角色开始第一轮战斗。每个角色在其回合到来时可以使用3个动作；当所有人都完成一个回合后，从头开始下一轮。

英雄们可能通过小心绕开蛛网来避免这场战斗；他们也可能从蜘蛛身边逃走。蜘蛛拒绝离开这个区域；如果所有英雄都逃离，它会撤回东北角结网的巢穴。

蜘蛛战 Spider Fight

@Actor[6NdqvKIlxo4cGhf8]

豁免检定 Saving Throws

每当蜘蛛用尖牙成功攻击命中角色时，它会在该攻击中一并注入毒素。每当角色受到毒素影响时，都必须尝试一种称为豁免检定的特殊检定来抵抗其效果。豁免检定有三种：强韧豁免通常用于抵抗毒素或疾病；反射豁免用于躲避坠落的碎石或躲开法术造成的致命光束；意志豁免通常用于抵抗迷乱心智的法术与魔法。

任何被蜘蛛咬中的人都必须立刻进行一次强韧豁免检定：点击其角色卡中豁免栏位“Fortitude”下的d20图标。若结果等于或大于16，则抵抗毒素，不受任何不良效果；若结果小于16，则毒素生效！毒素效果的细节包含在蜘蛛的数据表中。

远程打击 Ranged Strikes

巨蜘蛛还拥有一种特殊的远程打击，让它能投掷蛛丝以困住附近的生物。与近战打击不同，巨蜘蛛不必与英雄相邻也能用远程打击将其作为目标——它可以将房间内任何英雄作为目标。除此之外，远程打击与近战打击运作方式相同：将鼠标悬停在指示物上并按T来选择目标，接着点击巨蜘蛛蛛网打击（Web Strike）的“Strike+ 7”按钮，然后将总结果与目标英雄的护甲职业比较以判断是否命中。

虽然远程打击通常和近战打击一样造成伤害，但蛛网打击是例外。若攻击掷骰为成功，目标不受任何伤害；取而代之，目标会陷入@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}，且在成功使用逃脱（Escape）基础动作之前无法离开其所在方格。你可以将禁足（Immobilized）效果从本日志直接拖到受影响的指示物上。目标可以用特技（Acrobatics）技能检定、运动（Athletics）技能检定，或徒手（fists）攻击掷骰来尝试一次逃脱；DC为17。每次尝试逃脱都只需要一个动作。

若逃脱的检定总结果为17或更高，目标便挣脱蛛网并可自由移动。你可以通过右键点击受影响的指示物、点击右侧“Assign Status 效果 Effects”，再右键点击禁足效果以移除该效果。被困住的英雄仍可攻击、施放法术或进行其他行动，但无法从地图上的当前空间移动。

经验值 Experience Points

有些挑战为英雄提供多种克服方式。无论英雄如何克服挑战，他们都会因此获得XP——但仅在他们第一次克服该挑战的时代获得！若英雄避开了与蜘蛛的战斗且你因此给予XP，那么他们之后若返回并与蜘蛛战斗，也不会再获得更多XP。

英雄第一次通过蜘蛛挑战时——无论是击败它还是避开它——每人奖励40XP。

搜索蜘蛛巢穴 Searching the Spider's Lair

@Actor[PziNyZC7L7e9SsGr]

英雄们击败蜘蛛后，玩家可能会想要检定蜘蛛巢穴，看看蛛网里是否藏着值钱的东西。让任何探索该区域的人尝试一次@Check[type:perception|dc:15]{察觉 检定}。若成功，他们会发现一捆被蛛丝裹住的骨头与干枯皮肤，看起来像某种小型爬行动物的生物（事实上，那是一只狗头人，正是闯入渔场地下室的生物之一）。

这捆残骸里还藏着几件值钱物品——一瓶治疗药水，以及一把剑柄底端镶着小块绿宝石的短剑。该短剑并非魔法物品，但精良工艺与宝石使其若出售可值5gp。

战利品角色 Loot Actors

Pathfinder Second Edition系统包含汇编（compendiums），其中收录了Paizo在OGL许可下发布的全部物品，使分发战利品给玩家变得轻松。为替你节省更多时代，我们已在场景中放置了一种名为“战利品角色（loot actor）”的特殊角色，并预先装好了可供拾取的物品。若玩家找到狗头人的遗骸，你只需在地图上揭示该角色，玩家就能打开其物品栏查看（并领取！）其中的物品。

后续多个房间也包含类似的战利品角色，请留意这些箱子！

特殊物品 Special Items

战利品清单中的物品之一——@Item[LKjaRu3wDgEBpb9C]{治疗药水 Healing Potion}——是一件魔法消耗品。本冒险中的少数特殊物品可能有独特插画；你可以在物品页签中右键该物品，点击“view 物品 artwork”，再选择“show to players”与玩家分享。

若你愿意，你也可以使用“神秘化（mystification）”功能来隐藏玩家尚未鉴定的物品名称与描述。做法是：在你揭示战利品清单之前，点击其物品栏中对应物品的问号图标。

避开威胁 Avoiding the Threat

如果英雄在本房间中移动得非常谨慎，他们也许能完全避免与蜘蛛战斗。他们也可能从蜘蛛身边逃走，不击败该区域中的遭遇而直接通过。无论哪一种情况，蜘蛛都会在英雄每次穿过这个洞窟时继续构成威胁。

在一些冒险中，如果玩家拖得太久或过于频繁地休息，局势会发生变化；但在本冒险中，无论玩家探索这座地下城花多久时间，其遭遇都保持不变。英雄击败的生物仍将死亡或被摧毁，而英雄避开的生物仍留在原处——如果英雄之后再次经过该区域，它们可能仍会带来危险！



原文:

This room contains thick webs and an enormous spider. The Giant Spider token has already been placed on the scene for you, but like the rats in the previous encounter is hidden from player view. When the heroes enter this area, read the following aloud.

The tunnel continues deeper underground, eventually opening into a large chamber. Patches of glowing blue fungus cling to the ceiling and provide dim light. You can just barely make out vast strands of webbing across the floor and walls of this cavern, stretching between stalactites like shimmering curtains.

This fight uses the same rules as the first fight against the rats, but it also incorporates skill checks when dealing with webs and includes a new kind of @UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.DyVmklA6nwuY8sgU]{Check}—a saving throw—to resist the spider’s poisonous bite!

This chamber is home to a very big spider, waiting to ambush anything that wanders through its web. The webs aren’t sticky enough to make anyone who touches them unable to move, but they do slow characters down. Each square that has webbing in it is difficult terrain—terrain that’s particularly hard to move through. Moving into a square of difficult terrain costs an extra 5 feet of movement, and a creature can’t Step into a square of difficult terrain. The spider isn’t affected by its webs and can move normally throughout the chamber.

When the players enter the chamber, the spider is in its lair in the northeast corner of the room. It does not emerge to attack until someone touches one of its webs. Anyone trying to cross through the room without touching the webs must attempt an @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:15]{Acrobatics Skill Check} to carefully balance on rocks and narrow ledges. If anyone fails the check, the spider senses them in the room and emerges to attack.

The fight with the spider plays out very much like the combat with the rats. As soon as someone touches one of the webs or fails an Acrobatics check to balance while crossing the room, call for everyone to roll for initiative—usually using Perception, or Stealth for anyone who was hiding at the time. The spider rolls Perception for its initiative.

After you have everyone’s initiative results, start the first round of combat with the character who rolled the highest initiative result. Each character gets to use 3 actions when their turn comes up, and when everyone has had a turn, start over again at the beginning.

The heroes might avoid this fight by carefully moving around the webs. They might also flee from the spider. The spider refuses to leave this area, retreating to its webbed den in the northeast if all the heroes flee.

Spider Fight

@Actor[6NdqvKIlxo4cGhf8]{Giant Spider}

Saving Throws

Whenever the spider manages to successfully attack a character with its fangs, it injects poison as part of the attack. Whenever a character is subjected to poison, they must attempt a special check called a saving throw to resist its effects. There are three types of saving throw: a Fortitude save is typically for resisting poison or disease, a Reflex save is for dodging away from falling debris or avoiding a deadly beam from a spell, and a Will save is usually for resisting spells and magic that befuddle the mind.

Anyone who is bitten by the spider must immediately attempt a Fortitude saving throw by clicking the d20 icon under "Fortitude" in the saves section of their character sheet. If the result is equal to or greater than 16, they resist the poison and suffer no ill effect. If the result is less than 16, the poison takes hold! The details of the poison's effects are included in the spider's stat block.

Ranged Strikes

The giant spider also has a special ranged Strike that lets it throw webbing to trap a nearby creature. Unlike for a melee Strike, the giant spider doesn’t have to be adjacent to a hero to target them with a ranged Strike—it can target a hero anywhere in the room. Otherwise, a ranged Strike works just like a melee Strike. Choose a target by hovering over the token and pressing T, then click the "Strike+ 7" button on the giant spider’s Web Strike, and then compare the total to the Armor Class of the target hero to see if it hits.

While ranged Strikes normally deal damage just like melee Strikes, this web Strike is special. If the attack roll is a success, the target doesn’t take any damage. Instead, the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and can’t move out of their square until they successfully use the Escape basic action. You can apply the Immobilized effect by dragging it from this journal directly to the affected token. The target can attempt a check to Escape using the Acrobatics skill or Athletics skill, or a fists attack roll, and the DC is 17. Each attempt to Escape is a single action.

If the total result of the check to Escape is 17 or greater, the target breaks free from the webs and can move freely. You can remove the immobilization effect by right-clicking on the affected token, clicking the "Assign Status Effects" button on the right, and then right-clicking the immobilized effect.  A stuck hero can still attack, cast spells, and otherwise act normally, but they can’t move from their current space on the map.

Experience Points

Sometimes challenges offer multiple ways for the heroes to overcome them. No matter how the heroes overcome a challenge, they earn XP for doing so- but only the first time they overcome it! If the heroes avoid the fight with the spider and you award them XP for doing so, they don't get more XP if they later go back and fight the spider.

The first time the heroes get past the spider, whether by defeating or avoiding it, award them each 40 XP.

Searching the Spider's Lair

@Actor[PziNyZC7L7e9SsGr]{Spider's Lair}

Once the heroes defeat the spider, the players might think to check the spider's lair to see if there is anything of value hidden in the webs. Ask anyone who explores the area to attempt a @Check[type:perception|dc:15]{Perception Check}. If they succeed, they spot a wrapped up bundle of bones and dried skin that looks like it was some sort of small, reptilian creature (in fact, it's a kobold, one of the creatures responsible for breaking into the basement of the fishery).

The bundle also contains a few items of value- a healing potion and a shortsword that has a small emerald in the pommel. While the sword isn't magical, the fine craftsmanship and precious gem make it worth 5 gp if sold.

Loot Actors

The Pathfinder Second Edition system includes compendiums containing every item released by Paizo under the OGL license, which makes handing out loot to players a breeze. To save you even more time, though, we've placed a special type of actor called a "loot actor" on the scene with the items ready for them to pick up. If your players locate the kobold's remains, you can simply reveal the actor on the map, and they'll be able to open its inventory and see (and claim!) the items within.

Several future rooms include loot actors like this one, so keep an eye out for these boxes!

Special Items

One of the items inside the loot sheet- the @Item[LKjaRu3wDgEBpb9C]{Healing Potion}- is a magical consumable. A small number of special items in this adventure may have unique artwork, which you can share with your players by right-clicking on it in the items tab and clicking "view item artwork" followed by "show to players".

If you'd like, you can use the mystification feature to hide the names and descriptions of items that the players have yet to identify. To do this, before you reveal the loot sheet, click on the question mark icon on the corresponding item within its inventory.

Avoiding the Threat

If the heroes are very careful moving around this room, they might avoid the fight with the spider entirely. They might also flee from the spider, moving past the encounter in this area without defeating it. In either case, the spider remains a threat every time the heroes pass through this chamber.

In some adventures, the situation changes if the players take too long or rest too often, but this adventure and its encounter remain the same no matter how long the players take in exploring this dungeon. Any creatures the heroes defeat remain dead or destroyed, and any creatures they avoid remain in the same place—potentially posing a danger if the heroes pass through that area again later!

The Barricade.name: 路障 The Barricade
The Barricade.text:
英雄们在这个路口可以选择前进的方向，而且这里还包含了一个可能会改变他们之后在地下城中遭遇的技能挑战。

离开蛛网密布的洞穴后，通道在奥塔里的街道下方进一步深入；它看起来大多是自然形成的，但有人——或有什么东西——曾设法拓开洞穴并整平地面，使这条通道易于通行。一个用旧木板和半截木桶拼成的粗糙路障挡住了侧向隧道的入口，而主通道则继续延伸进幽暗之中。

如果有英雄检查路障，让他们尝试1次@Check[perception|dc:15]检定。成功时，他们会听到从路障另一边传来的微弱碰撞声。该区域完全没有照明，但持火把或拥有黑暗视觉的角色能看出隧道在前方通向一个更大的房间，房间中央有一个大型的矩形物体。

英雄们有两种方法可以拆除路障。他们可以轻易地用武器破坏路障，但这会制造很大的噪音，并警告第5区域的怪物英雄们正在接近。

他们也可以尝试1次@Check[crafting|dc:15]检定或@Check[thievery|dc:15]检定来安静地拆除路障。无论成功或失败，他们都能拆除路障；但若失败，他们会制造足够的噪音，从而警告@UUID[.mJ3pVc1aJi98duaA]的敌人。若成功，则不会惊动怪物。

如果你正在使用增强版地图，可能还有一些额外工具能让这一段流程更顺畅。请务必阅读下方的信息框以了解更多！

门 Doors

 知识库：墙

在这里，玩家会遇到一个障碍物，它会阻碍向北进一步前进时的移动与视线。你可能会注意到地图上路障处有一个门的图标——因为这个路障就是一扇门！

FVTT中的门 Doors in Foundry

在FVTT中，门只是墙壁的一种类型；玩家或GM点击图标即可打开或关闭。它们可以与其他类型的墙具有相同的特性——可阻挡光线、声音、视线与移动的任意组合，或完全不阻挡。门还拥有普通墙壁没有的额外选项：你可以把门上锁，让玩家无法打开；甚至还能对玩家隐藏图标，使其成为只有GM能打开的“暗门”。要查看这些设置，请切换到工具栏上的墙壁图层（神庙图标），然后对任意墙壁节点执行双击右键。

清除路障 Clearing the Barricade

在本例中，这面墙已经为你预先配置好了。它是“暗门”，意味着只有GM能看见或打开它，并且会同时阻挡移动与视线。玩家需要通过一次技能检定才能清除路障；此时你只要移除它就能让他们通过。在原版地图上，你也可以直接点击门的图标来处理。

如果你在使用我们的增强版地图，还可以更进一步：我们在场景里加入了一块可替换的tile，用于在路障被拆除时进行切换；甚至还提供了一个宏来替你完成！运行该宏后，它会根据队伍是吵闹拆除还是安静拆除来播放相应的音效，然后在短暂延迟后，同时切换tile并打开门。

要使用该宏，你只需要点击这里@Macro[saQTdI63wy22v5yk]，然后在背景音效播放的同时开始叙述玩家如何绕过障碍。

本冒险里的另外的门 Other Doors In This Adventure

@UUID[.UCEZLyerntYnmzgX]有一扇上锁的门，而@UUID[.2KRdW68qNXeJ6JpN]与@UUID[.CMjhAWaRWlbFVoF0]也有与本路障类似的障碍物，并同样提供了宏。

经验值 Experience Points

如果英雄们安静地拆除了路障，奖励他们每人10 XP。



原文:

This intersection presents the heroes with a choice of which direction to go, and it includes a skill challenge that can affect their encounters further within the dungeon.

After the web-infested cave, the passageway leading deeper underneath the streets of Otari appears to be mostly natural, but someone, or something, has worked to open the cavern and level out the floor, making the passage easily traveled. A crude barricade made from old wooden planks and part of a barrel blocks the entrance to a side tunnel, while the main passage continues off into the gloom.

If any hero examines the barricade, ask them to attempt a @Check[type:perception|dc:15]{Perception Check}. On a success, they hear a faint clattering noise coming from somewhere beyond the barricade. The area is totally unlit, but characters with a torch or darkvision can tell that the tunnel opens up into a larger room ahead, with a large rectangular object in the middle.

There are two ways the heroes can take apart the barricade. They can easily destroy the barrier with their weapons, but this makes a great deal of noise and alerts the monsters in Area 5 of the heroes’ approach.

They can also try to take the barricade apart quietly by rolling a @Check[type:crafting|dc:15]{Crafting Skill Check} or @Check[type:thievery|dc:15]{Thievery Skill Check}. Their effort removes the barricade whether they succeed or fail, but if they fail, they make enough noise to alert the enemies in @UUID[.mJ3pVc1aJi98duaA]{Area 05}. If they succeed, they avoid alerting the monsters.

If you're using the Enhanced maps, there might be additional tools you can use to make this moment as smooth as possible. Make sure to read the informational box below to find out more!

Doors

 Knowledge Base: Walls

Here, the players are faced with an obstacle which inhibits movement and vision further down the tunnel to the north. You might notice a door icon on the map over the barricade- that's because this barricade is a door!

Doors in Foundry

In Foundry VTT, doors are simply a type of wall that can be opened by players or GMs that click on the icon. They can have the same traits as other types of walls- they block any combination of light, sound, vision, and movement, or none of them. Doors also have some extra options that normal walls can't- you can lock doors so that players can't open them, or even hide their icon from players to make "secret" doors that only the GM can open. To see these settings for yourself, you can navigate to the walls layer on your toolbar (the temple icon), and then double right-click on any wall node.

Clearing the Barricade

In this case, this wall is already preconfigured for you. It's "secret", which means it can only be seen or opened by the GM, and it blocks both movement and vision. Players will need to succeed a skill check to clear the barricade, at which point you simply need to remove it to let them pass. On the original maps, you can do this by simply clicking on the door icon.

If you're using our enhanced map, you also have the option of going a little further. We've included a tile on the scene that can be swapped out when the barricade is dismantled. We've even provided a macro to do it for you! When run, it plays a sound effect, determined by whether your party dismantled the barricade noisily or quietly. Then, after a short delay, it swaps out the tile and opens the door at the same time.

To use the macro, you need only click here @Macro[saQTdI63wy22v5yk]{Area 04 - Barricade} and begin narrating how your players bypass the obstacle as the sounds play in the background.

Other Doors In This Adventure

There's a locked door in @UUID[.UCEZLyerntYnmzgX]{Area 07}, and there are similar obstacles to the barricade in @UUID[.2KRdW68qNXeJ6JpN]{Area 12} and @UUID[.CMjhAWaRWlbFVoF0]{Area 15} which both have macros provided as well.

Experience Points

If the heroes quietly take apart the barricade, award them each 10 XP.

Forgotten Crypt.text:
这个房间里有许多不死生物，如果玩家不够小心的话，这将是一个非常危险的遭遇。当英雄们进入该区域时，大声朗读以下内容：

在路障的另一边，一条古老的洞穴走廊蜿蜒向下，深入大地，尽头是一座古老的墓室。墓室里有一块散发蓝色火焰的诡异发光水晶，照亮了整个空间。墙壁两侧排列着壁龛，每个壁龛里都有一口腐朽的木棺；房间中央则有一座抬高的平台，上面安放着一具石棺。

音频提示 Audio Cue

你可以在这里播放音轨“邪恶的死者 The Malevolent Dead”，让玩家对即将踏入的危险有所预警。为了让希望用不死生物突袭来“惊喜”玩家的GM也能如愿，该音轨未被作为环境音预先放置在场景中。

这座墓穴里盘踞着邪恶的不死生物，它们会爬起来攻击任何愚蠢到打扰它们沉眠的活物。如果玩家在@UUID[.Ccp3c9A1WH9tOCVO]中破开路障时制造了很大的声响，那么骷髅与丧尸（特征）早已挣脱棺材，站起身来，准备战斗。反之，如果英雄拆除路障时足够安静，不死生物仍躺在棺中；当英雄踏入房间时，它们会推开棺盖，战斗随即开始。在这种情况下，每个不死生物都必须在其第一个回合的第一个动作仅用于站立（Stand）。

和其他战斗一样，先让玩家投掷察觉来决定先攻。骷髅与丧尸（特征）也同样以察觉投掷先攻。

和不死生物战斗 Undead Fight

@Actor[5H8ZX7y5IkUBhvhF]{4个骷髅守卫 Skeleton Guards}，@Actor[0plBflWwrCWQO2RO]{蹒跚丧尸 Zombie Shambler}

不死生物能力 Undead Abilities

这些不死生物有特殊规则，会影响它们如何承受@UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.9H0Jrj0siUcpFC1s]。骷髅具有某些伤害抗力，会如其上方角色卡所列，减少特定类型的伤害；而丧尸则具有弱点，使其对特定类型的伤害格外脆弱。

这两类不死生物也都有免疫，使某些类型的伤害与能力无法影响它们。它们不受任何带有心灵特征的效果影响，不会受到毒素伤害，也不会陷入昏迷——即使面对带有非致命特征的效果也是如此。

Foundry VTT在结算伤害时可以自动计算免疫、弱点与抗力的影响。当你选中一个生物时，可以点击一次伤害掷骰聊天卡上的按钮，将伤害应用到你所控制的生物上！

丧尸还有一种特殊能力叫做缓慢（Slow），用来体现它们沉重而踉跄的行动。由于它永久处于@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}状态，丧尸（特征）每轮在其回合只能使用2个动作而非3个，并且完全不能使用反应动作！

经验值 Experience Points

这场战斗尤其具有挑战性！摧毁此处的不死生物后，给予每位英雄100 XP。

失落的宝藏 Lost Treasure

@Actor[sRzrLrMdVXKZjkFA]{被遗忘的墓穴 Forgotten Crypt}

战斗结束后，英雄们有时代搜查房间寻找宝藏。那块发光水晶是一件特殊的魔法物品，称为长明水晶（everlight crystal），会持续发光。虽然看起来像火焰，但它不产生热量，也无法被熄灭！

此外，其中一具骷髅在下葬时带着一面打磨光亮的盾牌，盾面雕刻成咆哮雄狮的模样。它可以当作盾牌使用；也可以因其精湛工艺以5 gp卖出。

如果玩家拿走了水晶，记得通过光照图层（工具栏上的灯泡图标）右键该光源，关闭房间内的照明，以反映水晶已被取走。



原文:

This chamber contains a number of undead creatures, and it could make for a very dangerous encounter if the players aren’t careful. When the heroes enter this area, read the following aloud.

Beyond the barricade, an old cavern corridor winds down into the earth, ending in an ancient burial vault lit by a strange glowing crystal emitting a blue flame. Alcoves line the walls, each one containing a rotten wooden coffin, while the center of the room has a raised platform holding a stone sarcophagus.

Audio Cue

The audio track "The Malevolent Dead" can be played here to give your players some warning of what they are about to walk into. It has not been placed on the scene as an Ambient Sound to allow those GMs who wish to surprise their players with the undead to do so.

This crypt holds foul undead creatures that rise to attack any living thing foolish enough to disturb their slumber. If the players made a lot of noise breaking through the barricade in @UUID[.Ccp3c9A1WH9tOCVO]{Area 04}, the skeletons and zombie have already broken free from their coffins and are standing, ready for a fight. But if the heroes were quiet when they took apart the barricade, the undead are still in their coffins, and combat begins when they push aside their lids as soon as the heroes enter. In this case, each undead must use their first action on their first turn just to Stand.

Like for the other fights, first ask the players to roll Perception for initiative. The skeletons and zombie also roll Perception for initiative.

Undead Fight

@Actor[5H8ZX7y5IkUBhvhF]{4 Skeleton Guards}, @Actor[0plBflWwrCWQO2RO]{Zombie Shambler}

Undead Abilities

These undead have special rules that affect how they take @UUID[JournalEntry.OoPjlnYYGLn5KPZy.JournalEntryPage.9H0Jrj0siUcpFC1s]{Damage}. Skeletons have some damage resistances, reducing incoming damage of certain types as listed on its character sheet above, while Zombies have weaknesses and are especially vulnerable to certain damage types.

Both types of undead also have immunities that prevent certain types of damage and abilities from affecting them. They aren't affected by anything with the mental trait, they don't take poison damage, and they can't fall unconscious- even from effects with the nonlethal trait.

Foundry VTT can automatically calculate the effects of immunities, weaknesses, and resistances when applying damage. When you have a creature selected, you can click on the buttons on a damage roll's chat card to apply it to your controlled creature!

Zombies have one more special ability called Slow that represents their ponderous, staggering movements. Due to being permanently @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, A zombie can use only 2 actions on its turn each round instead of 3, and can't use reactions at all!

Experience Points

This fight is especially challenging! For destroying the undead creatures here, award each hero 100 XP.

Lost Treasure

@Actor[sRzrLrMdVXKZjkFA]{Forgotten Crypt}

After the fight, the heroes have time to look around the room for treasure. The glowing crystal is a special magic item called an everlight crystal that emits light constantly. Although it looks like fire, it emits no heat and can't be extinguished!

In addition, one of the skeletons was buried with a polished shield carved to look like a roaring lion. It can be used as a shield, or the heroes can sell it for 5 gp due to its fine artistry.

If the players take the crystal, remember to turn off the light in the room by going to lighting layer (the light-bulb icon on the toolbar) and right-clicking it.
Forgotten Crypt.name: 被遗忘的墓穴 Forgotten Crypt

Forgotten Shrine.name: 被遗忘的神龛 Forgotten Shrine
Forgotten Shrine.text:
从走廊上很难看到这个小神龛的门，因为壁架离地面约10尺高。英雄必须成功通过一次@Check[athletics|dc:10]检定才能爬上壁架。当英雄们进入房间时，大声朗读以下内容。

这扇古老的木门在生锈的铰链上吱呀作响地打开，露出一间残破的厅室。霉斑与腐朽的痕迹污染着每一处表面。在房间远端立着一尊巨型鱿鱼的石像，触腕伸向厅室中央的祭坛。污垢几乎覆盖了一切，但尚未染及石祭坛上那只银碗。碗中的水清澈见底。

如果玩家询问神龛的情况，让他们进行一次@Check[religion|dc:15]检定。如果成功，他们辨认出这是一座献给格兹瑞（Gozreh）的神龛——这位神祇司掌自然与海洋之怒。若有人在此施展侦测魔法（detect magic），他们会感知到魔法的存在。

银碗里的水纯净而洁清，但带着格兹瑞魔法的一丝“触感”。任何饮用碗中之水的人恢复[[/r 1d8 #healing]]生命值，但必须进行一次@Check[fortitude|dc:20]检定。

如果失败，他们感到海浪在胃中翻涌拍击，接下来1小时内都恶心难受。他们所有d20掷骰、他们的护甲等级（AC）以及法术DC都承受-1状态减值，直到1小时结束为止。（你可以将下方教学框中的该减值效果拖拽到他们的指示物上。）

如果成功，他们感到海洋之力在体内奔涌。在接下来1小时内，他们可以召唤海洋的威能来强化自身以抵御伤害。该力量是一个反应动作：当英雄在一次攻击中被重击（critical hit）命中时使用。该能力将此次重击的大成功转为普通成功（因此该次攻击造成正常伤害而非双倍伤害）。

每名英雄每天只能获得银碗的益处一次；同一天内第二次饮用没有效果。若将银碗从此神龛移走，它会失去所有魔法，但仍可售得5gp。

Pathfinder第二版：效果 Pathfinder Second Edition: Effects

@Item[XnvGgsstWwDeunij] @Item[od9RY509l6WGFawA]

有时，很难追踪具有不同持续时间与触发条件的效果。为帮助你与玩家记住祝福（或诅咒）的持续时间，你可以将这些效果从此处拖拽到他们的角色卡上，或拖到他们的指示物上——未通过强韧豁免者使用“海水恶心 Saltwater Sickness”，通过者使用“海洋之力 Ocean's Might”。

除了用于追踪持续时间外，效果也能对你角色的数值进行调整。例如，上方链接的海水恶心 Saltwater Sickness效果会自动对角色的检定与DC施加状态减值。



原文:

The door to this small shrine is hard to see from the passage, as the ledge is about 10 feet off the ground. A hero must succeed at a @Check[type:athletics|dc:10]{Athletics Skill Check} to climb up to the ledge. When the heroes enter the room, read the following aloud.

The ancient wooden door creaks open on rusty hinges, revealing a ruined chamber. Mold and rot stain every surface. On the far side of the room is stone statue of a giant squid, its tentacles reaching toward an altar in the center of the chamber. The scum covers almost everything, but it hasn’t touched the silver bowl sitting atop the stone altar. The water in the bowl is perfectly clear.

If the players ask about the shrine, ask them to roll a @Check[type:religion|dc:15]{Religion Skill Check}. If they succeed, they identify the shrine as one dedicated to Gozreh, the god of nature and the fury of the ocean. If anyone casts detect magic in this chamber, they sense the presence of magic.

The water in the silver bowl is pure and clean, but it carries a touch of Gozreh's magic. Anyone who drinks from the bowl regains [[/r 1d8 #healing]] Hit Points, but they must roll a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]{Fortitude Save}.

If they fail, they feel the ocean's waves crash through their stomach, which makes them feel sick for the next hour. They take a -1 status penalty to all d20 rolls, their Armor Class, and spell DCs until the hour has passed. (You can drag this penalty effect to their token from the instructional box below.)

If they succeed at the Fortitude save, they feel the power of the ocean surge through them. In the next hour, they can call upon the ocean's might to fortify themself against harm. This power is a reaction that the hero can use when hit by a critical hit on an attack. This ability turns the critical success into an ordinary success (so the attack deals normal damage instead of double damage).

Each hero can get the bowl's benefits once per day; drinking a second time in a day has no effect. The bowl loses all of its magic if removed from this shrine, but can be sold for 5 gp.

Pathfinder Second Edition: Effects

@Item[XnvGgsstWwDeunij] @Item[od9RY509l6WGFawA]

Sometimes it can be difficult to keep track of effects with different durations and triggers. To help you and your players remember the duration of the blessing (or the curse), you can apply these effects to their characters by dragging them from here to their character sheet or onto their token- "Saltwater Sickness" for characters that failed their fortitude save, and "Ocean's Might" for characters that succeeded.

As well as being used to track durations, effects can also apply modifications to your character's stats. For instance, the Saltwater Sickness effect linked above will automatically apply a status penalty to the character's checks and DCs.

Abandoned Storeroom.text:
环境音 Ambient Sounds

 知识库：环境音

当你的玩家靠近这个房间时，其中一些人可能会注意到狗头人试图撬开牢笼时发出的微弱声响。Foundry VTT 的声音引擎允许已放置的音效随着 Token 越靠近而变得越响。当狗头人注意到玩家时，你可以切换到场景的「声音」图层，并右键点击位于狗头人上方的音效来将其关闭。

这间房里有一小群狗头人，这些小型的爬行类类人生物。请大声朗读以下内容。

这个大房间看起来像是曾经作为上方建筑的储藏室。在房间远端，你们能辨认出某处曾是笼子或牢房的地方，但如今里面堆满了板条箱与木桶。四个蜥蜴般的生物聚在牢门旁，体型与人类孩童相仿，正试图把门撬开。

这些狗头人忙着撬开牢房，没注意到英雄进来；但只要有人移动到任意一名狗头人 10 英尺内，它们就会转过身来，龇牙低吼并发动攻击——所有人投掷先攻！

遭遇 Encounter

@Actor[r9w1n85mp9Ip4QiS]{4名狗头人战士 Kobold Warriors}

夹击 Flanking

这里的狗头人是狡猾的敌人，会利用战术与特殊能力取得优势。移动时，狗头人会尝试夹击英雄，站到同一名英雄的两侧。被夹击的英雄会获得@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及}状态（AC 承受 –2 环境减值），适用于所有参与夹击的狗头人的近战攻击。

如果你查看攻击结果卡中的 AC 对比，系统应会将此计入！

狗头人有一种称为偷袭攻击的特殊能力，使其对措手不及的英雄造成额外伤害。英雄可以在自己的回合中通过远离狗头人来避免被夹击，或者当其中一名狗头人生命值降至 0 时也会解除夹击。

经验值 Experience Points

击败狗头人后，给予每位英雄 80 XP。

上锁的仓库 Locked Storage

@Actor[yFRBdjHLEsCU66sI]{废弃储藏室 Abandoned Storeroom}

战斗结束后，英雄们可以检查敌人。一些狗头人带着从渔场偷来的鱼干——显然它们参与了盗窃，但失窃的鱼数量远非四只狗头人所能解释。

这个房间里的宝藏位于上锁的钢铁牢房内。英雄可以用两种方式打开牢房：他们可以使用盗贼工具包进行一次@Check[thievery|dc:15]来撬锁——成功即可打开！你可以右键点击门将其解锁，让玩家能够打开。或者，他们也可以强行破门，这需要一次成功的@Check[athletics|dc:25]。

牢房内是一堆旧板条箱和几个木桶。尽管其中大多数装着早已腐坏的食物与染污的布料，但其中一个箱子里藏着一小堆宝藏：200 sp、一个价值 5 gp 的金戒指，以及一把漂亮的+1 短剑——一件魔法武器！使用这把武器的英雄，其攻击检定获得 +1 加值！



原文:

Ambient Sounds

 Knowledge Base: Ambient Sounds

As your players approach this room, some of them might notice the faint sounds of the Kobolds trying to break into the cage. Foundry VTT's sound engine allows placed sound files to grow louder as tokens grow closer to them. When the kobolds notice the players, you can turn this sound off by switching to the Sounds layer of the scene and right-clicking the sound effect positioned on top of the kobolds.

This room has a small group of kobolds, small reptilian humanoids. Read the following aloud.

This large room looks like it was once a storeroom for a building above. At the far side, you can make out what might have been a cage or cell at some point, but it is now full of crates and barrels. Four lizardlike creatures the size of human children are clustered around the door to the cell, trying to pry it open.

These kobolds are so busy trying to open the cell that they don’t notice the heroes enter, but the moment someone moves within 10 feet of any of the kobolds, they turn around, snarl, and attack— have everyone roll for initiative!

Encounter

@Actor[r9w1n85mp9Ip4QiS]{4 Kobold Warriors}

Flanking

The kobolds here are cunning foes, using tactics and special abilities to gain an edge. When moving, the kobolds try to flank the heroes, standing on opposite sides of a single hero. A hero who is flanked has the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} condition (giving it a –2 circumstance penalty to AC) to all melee attacks made by the flanking kobolds.

You should see this being taken into account by the system if you look at the AC comparisons in the attack result cards!

The kobolds have a special ability called sneak attack that lets them deal extra damage against off-guard heroes. A hero can stop being flanked on their turn by moving away from the kobolds, or if one of the kobolds is reduced to 0 Hit Points.

Experience Points

For defeating the kobolds, award each hero 80 XP.

Locked Storage

@Actor[yFRBdjHLEsCU66sI]{Abandoned Storeroom}

After the fight, the heroes can examine their foes. Some of the kobolds are carrying dried fish stolen from the fishery—clearly they were involved in the thefts, but more fish are missing than can be explained by four kobolds.

The treasure in this room is in the locked steel cell. The heroes can open this cell in either of two ways. They can use a thieves’ toolkit to roll a @Check[type:thievery|dc:15]{Thievery Skill Check} to pick the lock- it opens on a success! You can right-click the door to unlock it and allow your players to open it. Alternatively, they can force open the door, which requires a successful @Check[type:athletics|dc:25]{Athletics Skill Check}.

Inside the cell is a pile of old crates and a few barrels. While most of these contain long-spoiled food and stained cloth, one of them contains a small pile of treasure: 200 sp, a gold ring worth 5 gp, and a beautiful +1 shortsword—a magic weapon!
