由于 Foundry 上的 PF2E 系统采用的是完整版本规则，我们有时会简化规则引用，使这些日志中的建议与提示既能与 Foundry 开发团队对《开拓者二版》规则的机制实现保持一致，也能与《新手包》中列出的规则一致。开拓者协会用于《新手包》的完整变体规则仍可在你的 PDF 中查阅。

鉴于我们的调整，我们在下方加入了额外指引，供希望满足组织游戏这些需求的玩家参考。

使用预制角色游玩

最简单的选择是使用预制英雄；Paizo 的指引也建议这样做，因为这有助于提升玩家对故事的沉浸感。若你选择此方式，请确保你从“Non-iconic Pregens”（非标志性预制角色）资料集中导入《新手包》版本的预制角色。这些与《新手包》中所附的角色卡完全相同。

而在其他 Paizo 产品中呈现的标志性角色（收录于 “Iconics” 资料集）则不符合获得开拓者协会记录奖励的资格。

创建你自己的角色

如果你想为开拓者协会游戏创建自己的英雄，我们建议你查阅随本模块购买所附的《新手包》PDF 中的规则，以确保符合要求。此外，上方链接的《新手包认可》指南是一份免费文件，可帮助你了解在开拓者协会中主持该冒险的全部细节。

玩得开心！

最重要的是，无论你选择以何种方式游玩这个冒险，我们都希望你与全体队友度过一段美好的时代。这正是我们加入让 GM 决定要游玩哪个版本冒险的能力的原因；我们也坚信，开心没有所谓“错误方式”。

探索、记录、协作！



原文:

Playing Menace Under Otari in Pathfinder Society

 Paizo: Beginner Box Sanctioning  Paizo: Pathfinder Society

The adventure included in the Pathfinder Beginner Box, "Menace Under Otari," is sanctioned for use in Pathfinder Society Organized Play. The rules for running this adventure and chronicle sheet are available as a free download from Paizo, at the page linked above.

One of the restrictions on playing the adventure Menace Under Otari in Pathfinder Society, outlined in the "Running the Adventure" section of the Beginner Box Sanctioning guide, is that characters that are used in the adventure must be built using the more streamlined rules contained within the Beginner Box. These can be the pregenerated iconic characters or new heroes of your own creation.

Because the PF2E system on Foundry adapts the full version of the rules, we have at times simplified our rules references so that the advice and indications in these journals are consistent with both the mechanical implementation of the Pathfinder Second Edition ruleset by its Foundry development team and the rules outlined within the Beginner Box. The full variant rules that are used by Pathfinder Society for the Beginner Box are still available in your PDF.

Because of our changes, we have included additional guidance for those seeking to meet these requirements for Organised Play below.

Playing With Pregenerated Characters

The easiest option is to use pregenerated heroes, which Paizo recommends within their guidance as improving the immersion of players within the story. If you do so, please make sure that you have imported the Beginner Box version of the pregens from the "Non-iconic Pregens" compendium. These are the same character sheets which are included in the Beginner Box.

The iconic characters as they are presented in other Paizo products, which are contained in the "Iconics" compendium, would not qualify for Pathfinder Society credits.

Creating Your Own Characters

If you would like to make your own hero for Pathfinder Society play, we suggest consulting the rules as contained within the Beginner's Box PDF that was included with your purchase of this module to ensure that you are compliant. In addition, the Beginner Box Sanctioning guide linked above is a free document which will help you understand the full details of running this adventure in Pathfinder Society.

Have Fun!

Above all, we hope that, however you choose to play this adventure, you and your entire party have a wonderful time. That's why we chose to include the ability for the GM to decide which version of the adventure they want to play, and we strongly believe there is no wrong way to have fun.

Explore, Report, Cooperate!

The Foundry Virtual Tabletop team would like to express its profound and heartfelt thanks to the development team of the PF2e game system. Their efforts to adapt Pathfinder Second Edition for virtual tabletop play have provided countless fans a place to play and experience Pathfinder at a level of quality unmatched anywhere else. Their adamant refusal to accept payment for their work on the system is a bold statement about the generosity of the Pathfinder community, and we look forward to working together with them for a long time to come.

Foundry's Pathfinder 2E System Volunteer Development Team

Development Leads: Carlos Fernandez, Kevin Hjelden, Richard Simões

Data Entry Leads: Ian Blackstone, Ian Hildebrandt

Community Manager: Viviane Charlier

Project Module Representative: Gunnar Busch

Project Manager: Tim Munsie

Past Project Manager: Nikolaj Andresen

Founding System Developer: Shaun Newsome

And the other contributors to the system too numerous to name.

Menace Under Otari.caption: 在与英雄们战斗时，狗头人们夸耀他们强大的血统和综合战力。
Menace Under Otari.description:
《奥塔里地下的威胁》旨在教新的GM和玩家如何使用Foundry VTT来游玩《开拓者》。冒险的每个部分都会教授新的概念并介绍该程序的功能，为游戏逐步增添更多的内容。同时，其他玩家每人都会扮演一名完整的英雄，学习如何运用自身能力，以及如何在他们所探索的危险世界中取得成功。



原文:

"Menace under Otari" is designed to teach new Game Masters and players how to play Pathfinder using Foundry VTT. Each section of the adventure will teach new concepts and introduce features of the program, adding more and more to the game. Meanwhile, the other players each have an entire hero to roleplay as, learning how to use their abilities and how to succeed in the dangerous world that they find themselves exploring.

在海贼王的财宝中，你不会通过按时间顺序阅读日志来推进故事。相反，在每个条目的结尾，你将看到一组选择。你所做的决定会引导你前往不同的条目，而你只需点击文中的链接即可跟随前进。

玩家资源

@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu]{冒险步骤 Adventure Steps}日志包含了冒险的每一步，你将通过在每个条目的末尾点击选项来做出选择并在其中导航。

你可以使用@UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]{草稿纸 Scratch Paper}页面，帮助你记录你进行过的动作，以及你沿途拾取的物品。

一些冒险步骤可能需要你在继续前进之前先应对某个威胁。通常情况下，描述会告诉你如何解决这种情况。如果你发现自己进入了战斗，@UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.KcImx6Pq6vjKeJm5]{战斗参考 Combat Reference}页面提供了相关规则的摘要。

当你准备好了，前往条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.dHOsZe4eRCxxK9Gb]{#01}！



原文:

In Pirate King's Plunder, you won't advance through the story by reading the journals in chronological order. Instead, at the end of each entry, you'll be presented with a set of choices. The decisions you make will lead you to different entries, which you can follow simply by clicking on the inline link.

Player Resources

The @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu]{Adventure Steps} journal contains every step of the adventure, and you'll navigate through it by making choices by clicking on the options at the end of each entry.

You can use the @UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]{Scratch Paper} page to help you keep track of actions you perform and items you pick up along the way.

Some of the adventure steps may require you to deal with a threat before you can progress. Generally, the description will tell you how to resolve the situation. If you find yourself in combat, the @UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.KcImx6Pq6vjKeJm5]{Combat Reference} page has a summary of the relevant rules.

When you're ready, advance to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.dHOsZe4eRCxxK9Gb]{#01} !

Combat Reference.name: 战斗参考 Combat Reference
Combat Reference.text:
攻击和伤害

在战斗中，你和敌人轮流互相攻击。你通过掷20面骰（或简称为d20）并加上你的攻击加值（代表你使用武器的熟练程度）来进行攻击。如果总数大于或等于目标的护甲等级（简称AC），则这次攻击命中并会造成伤害。将伤害从目标的生命值（简称HP）中扣除。为了打败对方，你必须将其HP降到0或更少。

在敌人的回合里，它很可能会攻击你——你为它掷一个d20，加上它的攻击加值，然后将结果与你的AC进行比较。如果敌人将你的HP降到0或更少，你就会死亡。

最后，如果你的攻击骰结果超过敌人的AC 10点或以上，就是一次重击，你会造成双倍伤害（掷一次骰子，然后将结果翻倍）。如果掷骰结果为“20”，你也会对敌人造成重击。当敌人攻击你时，只有掷骰结果为“20”时，它才可能造成重击。

轮次和行动

战斗以轮为单位进行。每轮中，你和敌人各有一个回合；在每个回合中，你可以使用3个动作。当你用完你的动作后，就轮到敌人的回合了。它使用完3个动作后，就再次轮到你的回合。如此重复，直到一方被击败。动作由动作符号（1）表示。

虽然你可以在一个回合内攻击三次，但在同一轮中你每进行一次攻击，之后的每次攻击就会变得更不准确。例如，你第一次短剑攻击以+7攻击加值掷骰，但第二次只有+2。



原文:

Attacks and Damage

In combat, both you and the enemy take turns attacking one another. You attack by rolling the 20-sided die (or d20 for short) and adding your attack bonus (which represents your skill at wielding a weapon). If the total is equal to or greater than the target's Armor Class (AC for short), then the attack is a hit and deals damage. Subtract the damage from the target's Hit Points (HP for short). To defeat them, you must reduce their HP to 0 bor less.

On their turn, your enemy will likely attack you- you'll roll a d20 for them, add their attack bonus, and compare the result to your AC. If the enemy reduces you to 0 HP or less, you die.

Finally, if your attack roll exceeds the enemy's AC by 10 or more, it's a critical hit and you deal double damage (roll once, and double the result). You also score a critical hit against the enemy if the result of the die roll shows a "20" on the die. When the enemy attacks you, it can score a critical hit only if the die roll is a 20.

Rounds and Actions

Combat occurs in rounds. In each round, both you and the enemy take turns, and on each turn, you can use 3 actions. Once you have used your actions, it's the enemy's turn. After it uses 3 actions, it's your turn again. This repeats until one side is defeated. Actions are denoted by the action symbol (1).

Although you can attack three times in one turn, each time you attack in a single round, each subsequent attack becomes less accurate. For instance, your first Shortsword attack is rolled with a +7 bonus, but your second only has +2.

#01.text:
你是个造访奥塔里（Otari）的流浪冒险家，这是一座位于星石岛（Starstone Isle）海岸的小镇；星石岛则是一座由一位古代神祇以魔法从海中抬升而起的巨大岛屿。奥塔里以木材与精良的木船闻名，但这并不是你来到这里的原因——你来此是为了寻求冒险！

传闻一头凶恶的野兽正在捕食镇上的家畜，镇长向任何能终结这份威胁的英雄提供10枚金币的赏金。这笔钱足够你支付一个月的开销！

在附近一家名叫乌鸦之桶（Crow’s Casks）的酒馆打听之后，你得知大多数袭击发生在镇子的西侧，离海岸不远。那似乎是开始搜索的最佳地点。你收拾好随身物品，沿着多岩的海滩出发，开始你的狩猎。没过多久，你就找到了一个黑暗而神秘的洞穴入口。巨大的爪印通向并离开那阴森的洞口。

转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.9kE4sJ5hd26pCITN]。



原文:

You are a wandering adventurer visiting Otari, a small town on the coast of the Starstone Isle, an enormous island magically raised out of the ocean by an ancient god. Otari is renowned for its lumber and fine wooden boats, but that’s not what brought you here—you came looking for adventure!

Word has it that a vicious beast is preying upon the town’s livestock, and the mayor has offered 10 gold coins to any hero who can put an end to the menace. That kind of money would pay your expenses for a month!

After asking around at a nearby tavern called the Crow’s Casks, you learn that most of the attacks occur on the west side of town, not far from the shore. That seems like the best place to start your search. You gather up your belongings and make your way out along the rocky beach to begin your hunt. It doesn’t take long for you to find the entrance to a dark and mysterious cave. Large paw prints lead to and from the gloomy opening.

Go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.9kE4sJ5hd26pCITN]{#13}.

#02.text:
在冰柱之中，你找到了一把像颅骨一样的奇怪钥匙，眼睛的位置镶嵌着小块祖母绿。如果你决定拿起钥匙，在你草稿纸上写上“骷髅（特征）钥匙”。这把钥匙仅作为艺术品就价值2金币，但它可能还有你尚不了解的其他用途。

如果你跳下滑道，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.qcI1yZVH5QBDbpaj]。

如果你决定改为沿原路返回并尝试另一条通道，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Op9v0801zCNxtVMJ]。



原文:

Inside the icicle, you find a strange key shaped like a skull, with small emeralds for eyes. If you decide to take the key, write “Skeleton Key” on your scratch paper. The key is worth 2 gold just as a piece of art, but it might have other uses that you don’t yet know about.

If you jump down the chute, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.qcI1yZVH5QBDbpaj]{#23}.

If you instead decide to head back the way you came and try the other passage, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Op9v0801zCNxtVMJ]{#05}.

#04.text:
你为了保命而逃，飞奔着越过雕像，冲向后墙的一道裂缝。你挤身穿过后，很快发现了一条通往地表的通道。你可以回到镇上领取你的赏金，但你也许仍想回去夺取海盗雕像的战利品。也许等你更有经验，再加上一点运气，就能找到击败它的方法！不过在那之前，你期待着一顿热饭，以及一张舒适的床。

尽管你没有得到所有宝藏，但你在这场单人冒险中仍表现不俗，成功一路走到了终点。

转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.2mYoaXNqTZJ4r1IF]。



原文:

You flee for your life, bolting past the statue to a crevice in the back wall. Squeezing through, you soon find a passage that leads back to the surface. You can go back to town and claim your reward, but you might still want to go back and claim the pirate statue’s plunder. Maybe with more experience and a bit of luck you’ll find a way to defeat it! But until then, you are looking forward to a warm meal and a comfortable bed.

Although you didn't get all of the treasure, you still did quite well in this solo adventure, making it all the way to the end.

Go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.2mYoaXNqTZJ4r1IF]{#09}.

#07.text:
你纵身闪避，躲开狼咆哮的利齿，将剑深深刺入它的肋侧。那可憎的生物哀嚎一声，栽进淤泥里，随即不再动弹。你擦净剑刃，然后走进洞穴，确认这只狼是否是唯一的一个。

当你的双眼适应昏暗后，你发现自己身处一座小洞窟中，显然是这头野兽的巢穴。空气中弥漫着湿毛皮的恶臭，地上散落着腐烂的碎肉与骨头——那是它先前受害者的证据。然而更引人注意的，是你在洞穴深处看到的东西。

远处的洞壁上有一道裂缝，通向黑暗之中；裂缝上方的石面被人刻出一个符号，看起来很像一个宝箱。当你走近时才意识到，那道裂缝其实是地下隧道的入口——很可能正是某些被遗忘的宝藏的藏身之处。

如果你挤进裂缝，深入洞穴探索，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.52p05nmu3S1MHK2o]。

如果你转身返回城镇领取你的财富，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.2mYoaXNqTZJ4r1IF]。



原文:

You leap aside, avoiding the wolf’s snarling jaws and drive your sword deep into its flank. With a yowl, the wretched creature falls into the muck and goes still. You clean off your blade then wander into the cave to make sure that this wolf was the only one.

As your eyes adjust to the gloom, you find yourself inside a small cavern that was obviously the beast’s home. It stinks of wet fur, and there are scraps of rotting meat and bone lying about—evidence of its previous victims. Far more interesting, though, is what you spot at the back of the cave.

A crack in the far wall leads into darkness, and just above it, scratched into stone, is a symbol that looks a lot like a treasure chest. As you draw closer, you realize the crack is actually the entrance to an underground tunnel- it might just be the hiding place of some forgotten treasure.

If you squeeze through the crack to explore deeper into the cave, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.52p05nmu3S1MHK2o]{#18}.

If you turn around and head back to town to collect your riches, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.2mYoaXNqTZJ4r1IF]{#09}.

#08.text:
嗖的一声，你的剑直接将那条蛇一刀两断，它随即砰的一声倒在你脚边。绕过它的尸体，你检定了一下房间，看看有没有什么值钱的东西。你在地板两块石头之间发现了一枚非常古老、已经失去光泽的银币。它一定在这里躺了很久，但等这一切结束后，它足够让你回到镇上在旅店住上一晚。

在你的草稿纸上加上1银币。

将死去的巨蛇抛在身后，你朝入口对面的通道走去。与先前的洞穴不同，这条隧道看起来像是被人小心翼翼地从土里挖掘出来，并用木材与石块一丝不苟地加固过。大约走了20尺后，通道出现岔路，分别通向右侧与左侧。右边隐约传来水花飞溅的声音，而左边的通道则飘出一阵极其寒冷的微风。你要走哪条路？

如果你走右边，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Op9v0801zCNxtVMJ]。

如果你走左边，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.zt9iBaumtu3CAHrD]。



原文:

With a swish, your blade slices right through the snake and it falls dead at your feet with a loud thud. Stepping around its body, you check the room for anything of value. You find a very old, tarnished silver coin wedged between two stones on the floor. It must have been here for ages, but it will buy you a night at the inn back in town when this is all over.

Add 1 silver to your scratch paper.

Leaving the dead serpent behind, you head toward the passageway opposite the entrance. Unlike the caves that came before, this tunnel looks like it was carefully dug out of the earth and meticulously reinforced with wood and stone. After about 20 feet, the passageway forks, heading off to the right and the left. You can hear the faint sound of splashing water to the right, while a very cold breeze drifts out of the passage to the left. Which way do you go?

If you go to the right, go to Entry@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Op9v0801zCNxtVMJ]{#05} .

If you go to the left, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.zt9iBaumtu3CAHrD]{#15}.

#10.text:
虽然通道蜿蜒穿过古老的岩石，但很明显有人用镐子将其拓宽，尽管看起来这些工作已经是许多年前完成的。在匆忙挤过一道顶棚仅由一根腐朽圆木支撑的狭窄裂隙后，你发现自己来到了一间小石室。上方有树根向下生长，穿破顶棚，使得洞窟里各处都透进些许微弱、斑驳的光。入口对面还有另一条走廊，但在你能朝那边前进之前，你听见通道里传来一阵可怕的嘶嘶声。从黑暗中现身的是一条长着骇人尖牙的巨蛇！

你现在要与蛇战斗了！就跟刚才与狼战斗那样，你与蛇轮流攻击彼此，直到一方被击败，但这场战斗中有一些新的东西需要注意。此次战斗中，蛇会先行动，但是在它的第一个回合，它必须花费它3个动作中的2个来拉近距离，然后才能攻击。因此在蛇的第一个回合，它只能使用1个动作来攻击你。在之后的回合，它使用全部3个动作攻击。

在你的回合，你可以攻击，就像前一场战斗那样。不幸的是，这间石室无处藏身，所以你不能像同狼战斗那样提升你的护甲等级。同时，如果你在上一场战斗中受过任何伤害，记住你的生命值仍未恢复！

1 用短剑打击

查看@UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]来确认你的短剑属性。

蛇 Snake

蛇的AC：15

蛇的生命值：8

1 移动 Move

蛇移动20尺。这叫做行走（Stride）。它必须在第一个回合使用两次该动作才能与你相邻，以便能够攻击。

1 啃咬 Bite

蛇尝试用尖牙咬你。

第一次攻击：[[/r 1d20+8 #Snake Bite 1]]

第二次攻击：[[/r 1d20+3 #Snake Bite 2]]

第三次攻击：[[/r 1d20-2 #Snake Bite 3]]

伤害：[[/r 1d4 #Snake Damage]]

处理毒素效果

当蛇啃咬你时，它可能会对你下毒。这是啃咬的一部分，所以它不消耗动作。当你被蛇的啃咬命中时，你必须尝试一次豁免骰（Saving Throw）以抵抗毒液的效果。豁免骰是一种特殊的掷骰，用于抵抗试图伤害或控制你角色的效果。有三种豁免骰：反射（Reflex）豁免用于躲避一道闪电或一头恶龙的炎息；意志（Will）豁免用于抵抗试图接管你心智的法术；而强韧（Fortitude）豁免用于对抗毒素或疾病。

每次蛇咬中你时，你必须尝试一次强韧豁免（[[/r 1d20+8 #Fortitude Save]]）。如果结果大于等于16（毒素的DC），你成功抵抗，无事发生。如果结果为15或更低，你受到一次来自毒素的[[/r 1d8 #Poison Damage]]伤害。

如果你打败蛇，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.2VEQBTTitpdxSDrL]。

如果你败给蛇及其毒素，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]。



原文:

The passageway winds through ancient rock, but it's clear that someone has made it wider with a pickaxe, although it looks like the work was done many years ago. After squeezing hurriedly through a narrow crevice with a ceiling supported only by a rotting log, you find yourself in a small chamber. Roots grow down from above, breaking through the ceiling and letting in faint, dappling light here and there across the cavern. Opposite the entrance is another corridor, but before you can head down that way, you hear a terrible hissing sound coming from the passageway. Emerging from the darkness is a gigantic snake with terrifying fangs!

You are now in combat with a snake! Just as when fighting the wolf, you and the snake will take turns attacking one another until one side is defeated, but there are a few new things to pay attention to in this combat. In this fight, the snake gets to go first, but during its first turn, it must spend 2 of its 3 actions to close the distance before it can attack. So, on the snake’s first turn, it gets to spend only 1 action to attack you. On the rest of its turns it spends all 3 actions attacking.

On your turn, you can attack, just like in the previous fight. Unfortunately, there’s nothing to hide behind in this chamber, so you can’t boost your Armor Class like you could in the wolf fight. Also, if you took any damage in the last fight, remember that your HP still hasn't recovered!

1 Strike with Your Shortsword

See @UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]{Scratch Paper} for your Shortsword's statistics.

Snake

Snake's AC: 15

Snake's Hit Points: 8

1 Move

The snake moves 20 feet. This is called a Stride. It must use this action twice on its first turn to be next to you so that it can attack.

1 Bite

The snake tries to bite you with its fangs.

First Attack: [[/r 1d20+8 #Snake Bite 1]]

Second Attack: [[/r 1d20+3 #Snake Bite 2]]

Third Attack: [[/r 1d20-2 #Snake Bite 3]]

Damage: [[/r 1d4 #Snake Damage]]

Dealing with Poison

Whenever the snake bites you, it might poison you. This happens as part of the bite, so it doesn't use an action. When you are hit by the snake's bite, you must attempt a Saving Throw to resist the effects of the venom. Saving throws are special rolls to resist things that try to harm or control your character. There are three kinds of saving throws: Reflex saving throws are used to dodge a bolt of lightning or a fearsome dragon's fire breath; Will saving throws are used to resist spells that try to take over your mind; and Fortitude saving throws are used to fight off poisons and diseases.

You must attempt a Fortitude saving throw every time the snake bites you. Roll [[/r 1d20+8 #Fortitude Save]]. If the result is equal to or greater than 16 (the DC of the poison), you fight it off and nothing happens. If the result is 15 or lower, you take an additional [[/r 1d8 #Poison Damage]] damage from the poison.

 

If you defeat the snake, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.2VEQBTTitpdxSDrL]{#08}.

If you succumb to the snake and its poison, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}.

#03.text:
你沿着通道前行了相当一段距离，来到一间巨大而空旷的洞窟。上方天花板上有个洞口，一道细窄的光束透入，照亮了一堆钱币，以及至少两颗闪闪发亮的宝石。财宝堆中央立着一尊木制雕像，粗糙地雕成海盗模样。雕像手持一把木制弯刀，凶狠地指向你。

再走近些，你看得出这尊雕像的手臂与腿部装有关节与铰链，但等你意识到时已靠得太近——雕像竟活了过来！它来回挥舞弯刀，带着威胁步步逼近。当它靠近时，你注意到雕像脖颈中央有一个外形古怪的钥匙孔。

如果你在草稿纸上写有“骷髅钥匙”，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Eds15d6ZIMNit3Ke]。

如果你没有骷髅钥匙，你可以拔出武器发动攻击。转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.KsWF7M95ULTstLeI]。



原文:

You travel down quite a distance before arriving in a large, cavernous chamber. A hole in the ceiling above allows in a thin shaft of light that illuminates a pile of coins and at least a couple glittering jewels. Standing in the center of this pile is a wooden statue, crudely carved to look like a pirate. The statue holds a wooden saber pointed menacingly in your direction.

Drawing closer, you can tell that the statue has joints and hinges on its arms and legs, but by the time you realize it, you have drawn too close, and the statue comes to life! Swinging its saber back and forth, the menacing statue approaches you. As it draws near, you spot a strange-looking keyhole located in the middle of the statue’s neck.

If you have “Skeleton Key” written on your scratch paper, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Eds15d6ZIMNit3Ke]{#19}.

If you don’t have the skeleton key, you can draw your weapons and attack. Go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.KsWF7M95ULTstLeI]{#25}.

#05.text:
潺潺声从前方某处回荡而来，每前进一步都变得更响，直到你能清楚听见湍急的水声。当你转过一个拐角，声音的来源便一目了然。前方的石室被一条穿过房间中央的溪流分成两半。

这条湍急的地下河从右侧注入房间，向左侧流出。对岸处，你看见一条继续向前延伸的通道，并且隐约能辨出一段向下的楼梯。你面前的地面上丢着一根旧火把，可能是某位先前的探险者留在这里的。

如果你拿起火把，在你的草稿纸上写下“火把”。

如果你的记录写着“拉动了拉杆”，前往条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.niD4XcjQN86Qnd3G]。否则，前往条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.5V6qs50dyvOqDvJm]。



原文:

The burbling sound, echoing from somewhere up ahead, grows louder with every step until you can hear the sound of rushing water clearly. As you turn a corner, the source of the sound becomes apparent. The chamber up ahead is split in half by a stream that flows through the center of the room.

This swift underground river enters the room from the right and flows out to the left. Across the way, you see a passageway that continues onward, and you can just make out a staircase going down. Discarded on the ground in front of you is an old torch, probably left here by a previous explorer.

If you take the torch, write “Torch” on your piece of scratch paper.

If your notes say “Pulled the lever,” go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.niD4XcjQN86Qnd3G]{#16}. Otherwise, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.5V6qs50dyvOqDvJm]{#11}.

#06.text:
海盗雕像倒在地上发出雷鸣般的巨响，碎成了几块。随着这个最后的守卫被击败，你可以自由地收集战利品，然后再回去镇子。这堆钱币总计有79铜币，25银币，4金币。但真正的宝藏是你找到的三颗宝石。两颗是朴素的玛瑙宝石，每颗价值5金币，但最后一颗是闪亮的红宝石。它可以轻易卖到20金币，这确实是一场收获颇丰的旅行！

收集完你最后的战利品，你准备返回奥塔里，去领取你杀死那只狼的赏金。既然都到镇上了，你或许会奢侈一把，住进旅店最好的房间，也许还会和镇上的铁匠聊聊，看看能不能弄一套新盔甲。不过，那就是另一场冒险的故事了……

恭喜你完成这场单人冒险！你搜集到全部宝藏了吗？在这次事件中，你能找到总计价值40金币的钱币和宝藏，外加赏金。记住10铜币等于1银币，10银币等于1金币。

你现在已经准备好@JournalEntry[KIpNnMtah73eyPC8]了！



原文:

The pirate statue falls to the floor in a thunderous crash, breaking into several pieces. With this last guardian defeated, you are free to gather up the loot and make your way back to town. In total, the pile of coins contains 79 copper, 25 silver, and 4 gold. But the real treasure was in the three gems you found. Two are simple agate gemstones worth 5 gold each, but the last is a sparkling ruby. It can easily sell for 20 gold, making this a very rewarding trip indeed!

Gathering up the last of your loot, you prepare to head back to Otari and claim the reward for killing the wolf. While you are at it, you might just spring for the nicest room at the inn and maybe talk to the town blacksmith about getting a new suit of armor. But that is a tale for another adventure...

Congratulations on defeating this solo adventure! Did you collect all of the treasure? There is a total of 40 gold worth of coins and treasure you can find during this event, plus the reward. Remember that 10 copper is equal to 1 silver, and 10 silver is equal to 1 gold.

You are now ready to @JournalEntry[KIpNnMtah73eyPC8]{build your own character!}

#11.text:
穿越河流唯一的方法就是游过这危险的水流。

游到房间另一侧需要一次技能检定。要尝试一次技能检定，掷一次 d20，然后加上与你正在尝试使用的技能相关的加值。如果结果等于或高于该任务的 DC，你就成功了。在这种情况下，你可以使用运动（Athletics）技能来游过河流。要抵达另一边，你必须在两次运动检定中都成功；每次的 DC 均为 15。

运动技能检定： [[/r 1d20+7 #Athletics]]

这些检定可能会很危险。如果你在水中，并且在用于游泳的运动检定中失败太多次，你会被冲往下游。由于这条河通向地下深处，穿过没有空气的长隧道，如果你在成功两次检定并离开水面之前累计失败了三次运动技能检定，你就会溺亡。

如果你在运动检定中失败三次，你会被拖入地下河中，并被岩石猛力撞击。前往条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}。

如果你成功抵达对岸，你可以沿楼梯向下前进；前往条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.DKDZReQDxqTz7sgu]{#03}。

如果你决定沿来路返回并尝试另一条通道，前往条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.zt9iBaumtu3CAHrD]{#15}。



原文:

The only way to get across the river is to swim through the dangerous water.

Swimming to the other side of the room requires a Skill Check. To attempt a skill check, roll a d20 and add the bonus associated with the skill you are trying to use. If the result is equal to or greater than the DC of the task, you succeed. In this case, you can use the Athletics skill to swim across. To make it to the other side, you must succeed at two Athletics checks, which each have a DC of 15.

Athletics Skill Check: [[/r 1d20+7 #Athletics]]

These checks can be dangerous. If you are in the water and fail too many Athletics checks to swim, you get swept downstream. Since the river leads deep underground, through long tunnels without air, you’ll drown if you fail a total of three Athletics skill checks before you succeed at two checks and get out of the water.

If you fail three Athletics checks, you are dragged into the underground river and beaten against the rocks. Go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}.

If you make it to the other side, you can make your way down the stairs; go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.DKDZReQDxqTz7sgu]{#03}.

If you instead decide to head back the way you came and try the other passage, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.zt9iBaumtu3CAHrD]{#15}.

#12.text:
撩开一些苔藓后，你发现墙上凿有一些小缺口，让你能轻松爬进裂缝。一定是有人故意凿出来的！

挤进裂缝后，你发现裂缝后面有一处狭小拥挤的壁龛。里面长满苔藓，但你注意到两件事：在房间后方有一个旧皮袋，一侧被撕裂，几枚钱币散落在地上。此外，壁龛中央的地板上嵌着一根石质拉杆。

如果你把这些钱币收拢起来，在草稿纸上记下你有21枚铜币和4枚银币。

如果你决定拉动拉杆，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.SyEArZlS6nsOeKuf]。

如果你无视拉杆，你爬出壁龛，沿着下方的通道前进。转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Aj3k03uAUj6kb0OV]。



原文:

After brushing aside some of the moss, you find small notches cut into the wall, making it simple to climb up into the crack. Someone must have carved these on purpose!

Squeezing into the crevice, you find a small, cramped alcove behind it. It’s filled with moss, but you note two things: in the back of the room is an old leather pouch that is split open on one side, spilling a handful of coins across the floor. In addition, set into the floor in the center of the alcove is a stone lever.

If you gather up the coins, write on your scratch paper that you have 21 copper and 4 silver.

If you decide to pull the lever, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.SyEArZlS6nsOeKuf]{#14}.

If you ignore the lever, you crawl back out of the alcove and head down the passageway below. Go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Aj3k03uAUj6kb0OV]{#10}.

#09.text:
你安全地回到镇子上，领取杀狼的赏金——10金币！

但是你收集到了此次冒险的全部宝藏了吗？除了赏金，你能够在此次冒险中找到价值40金币的钱币和宝藏。记住10铜币等于1银币，10银币等于1金币。

如果你想再次尝试，你可以返回条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.dHOsZe4eRCxxK9Gb]，从开头重新开始。

你也可能会想为以后的冒险直接创建自己的角色。如果是这样，转到@UUID[JournalEntry.KIpNnMtah73eyPC8]开始这个旅程。



原文:

You returned to town safely and collect your reward for killing the wolf—10 gold!

But did you collect all of this adventure's treasure? Besides the reward, you can find coins and treasure worth 40 more gold during this adventure. Remember that 10 copper is equal to 1 silver and 10 silver is equal to 1 gold.

If you want to try again, you can return to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.dHOsZe4eRCxxK9Gb]{#01} and start over from the beginning.

You might also want to go straight to building your own character for future adventures. If so, go to @JournalEntry[KIpNnMtah73eyPC8]{Creating Your Hero} to begin the journey.

#13.text:
注意到通向洞窟的足迹，你躲进附近的灌木丛中，希望能伏击盘踞于此的邪恶野兽。仅仅几分钟后，你便听见有什么东西正在靠近的声响，空气中弥漫着浓重的湿皮毛气味。

从灌木丛后现身的是一匹瘦骨嶙峋、毛皮斑秃的狼，嘴里叼着一只死鸡。它看起来刚结束最近一次狩猎，正要回巢。显然，这就是一直在捕食农民牲畜的那头畜生。你等它靠近，随即拔出短剑，猛然跃出发动⟪攻击⟫！

你现在正在与一匹狼战斗！你知道这头野兽无法被驯服；为了确保农民的牲畜安全，它必须被杀死。

阅读@UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.KcImx6Pq6vjKeJm5]以了解战斗规则。

你的AC、HP以及攻击数据列在你的@UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]上。

在你的⟪回合⟫，你可以使用以下⟪动作⟫。

1 用你的短剑进行打击

查看@UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]以了解你短剑的属性。

1 躲进灌木丛

将你的AC提高至20，直到你下个⟪回合⟫开始。

记住，你先行动。如果你发现狼命中你太多次，记得用你的第三个动作躲藏，让狼更难命中你。这个过程将持续到你或狼的HP降至0。

狼 Wolf

狼的AC：14

狼的生命值：15

1啃咬 Bite

在狼的⟪回合⟫，它会用尽所有⟪动作⟫对你进行3次攻击。

第一次⟪攻击⟫：[[/r 1d20+5 #Wolf Attack 1]]

第二次⟪攻击⟫：[[/r 1d20 #Wolf Attack 2]]

第三次⟪攻击⟫：[[/r 1d20-5 #Wolf Attack 3]]

伤害：[[/r 1d6+2 #Wolf Damage]]

如果你击败了狼，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.XJfSyziljE34cQEx]。

如果狼击败了你，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]。



原文:

Noticing the tracks leading to the cave, you hide in the nearby underbrush, hoping to ambush whatever foul beast lives here. After just a few minutes, you hear the sounds of something approaching, and the scent of wet fur hangs heavy in the air.

Emerging from the bushes is a lean, mangy wolf carrying the body of a dead chicken in its maw. It appears to be returning home after its most recent hunt. Clearly, this is the beast that's been preying upon the farmers' animals. You wait until it is near then draw your shortsword and spring out to attack!

You are now in combat with a wolf! You know that this feral beast cannot be tamed and must be slain to keep the farmers' livestock safe. 

Read the @UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.KcImx6Pq6vjKeJm5]{Combat Reference} for the rules on combat. 

Your AC, HP, and attacks are listed on your @UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]{Scratch Paper}.

On your turn, you can use the following actions.

1 Strike with Your Shortsword

See @UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]{Scratch Paper} for your Shortsword's statistics.

1 Hide in the Bushes

Increase your AC to 20 until the start of your next turn.

Remember that you go first. If you find that the wolf is hitting you too much, you should remember to hide with your third action to make it harder for the wolf to hit you. This process continues until you or the wolf is reduced to 0 HP.

Wolf

Wolf’s AC: 14

Wolf’s Hit Points: 15

1 Bite

On the wolf's turn, it attacks you three times, using all of its actions.

First attack: [[/r 1d20+5 #Wolf Attack 1]]

Second attack: [[/r 1d20 #Wolf Attack 2]]

Third attack: [[/r 1d20-5 #Wolf Attack 3]]

Damage: [[/r 1d6+2 #Wolf Damage]]

 

If you defeat the wolf, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.XJfSyziljE34cQEx]{#07}.

If the wolf defeats you, go to Entry@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17} .

#14.text:
你用力拉动，石质操纵杆终于动了；当它滑入到位时，你听到附近某处传来轰隆的声响。灰尘和泥土从顶上震落，直到大约一分钟后响声才终于停下。操纵杆发出一声沉闷的咔哒声，无论你多用力，都无法将它移回原位。

将“拉动了操纵杆”写在你的草稿纸上。

这个壁龛里已无事可做，你爬回去，然后沿着下方的通道前进。转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Aj3k03uAUj6kb0OV]。



原文:

You have to pull hard, but the stone lever finally moves; as it slides into place, you can hear a rumbling sound from somewhere nearby. Dust and dirt shake loose from the ceiling until the rumbling finally stops after about a minute. There is a deep click from the lever, and no matter how hard you try, you can’t move the lever back to its original position.

Write “Pulled the lever” on your scratch paper.

With nothing else to do in this alcove, you crawl back out and head down the passageway below. Go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Aj3k03uAUj6kb0OV]{#10}.

#15.text:
你向左转，沿着一条通向黑暗的狭窄隧道前行。你每迈出一步，空气都变得更冷，很快你便能在昏暗中看见自己呼出的白雾。前方，通道向右转弯，但拐角处透出一抹淡蓝色的光辉。刚过弯道，走廊便通向一间小小的冰室。

你对面是一条覆着冰的滑槽，向下没入黑暗。边缘垂着冰锥，看起来几乎像一张饥饿的巨口。就在这条滑槽上方，直接刻在石头上的，是一则警告。上面写着：“一次冰冷的俯冲也许会带你抵达海盗王的宝藏——也可能带你走向坟墓！”

天花板上悬着一根巨大的冰锥，你能清楚看见里面有东西在闪闪发光。

如果你想用剑砸碎冰锥，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.sNjcjpScSzehvBvi]。

如果你的草稿纸上写着“火把”，并且你想点燃它来尝试融化冰锥，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.B3hPHccbWsEhVvGj]。

如果你决定跳下滑槽，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.qcI1yZVH5QBDbpaj]。

如果你决定沿原路返回并尝试另一条通道，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Op9v0801zCNxtVMJ]。



原文:

You turn left and make your way down a narrow tunnel that leads into darkness. The air grows colder with each step you take and soon you can see your breath steaming in the gloom. Up ahead, the passage turns to the right, but a pale-blue radiance can be seen from around the corner. Just beyond the bend, the corridor opens into a small, icy chamber.

Opposite you is an ice-covered chute that descends into darkness. Rimmed with icicles, it looks almost like a hungry maw. Above this chute, carved into the stone itself, is a warning. It reads, “An icy plunge may take you to the Pirate King’s treasure—or to your grave!”

Hanging from the ceiling is a large icicle, and you can clearly see something glittering inside.

If you want to try and smash the icicle with your sword, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.sNjcjpScSzehvBvi]{#20}.

If you have “Torch” written on your scratch sheet and want to light it and try to melt the icicle, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.B3hPHccbWsEhVvGj]{#02}.

If you decide to jump down the chute, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.qcI1yZVH5QBDbpaj]{#23}.

If you instead decide to head back the way you came and try another passage, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Op9v0801zCNxtVMJ]{#05}.

#16.text:
河的中心有一根石柱，看起来已经被淹没了许久。你也许可以使用它作为跳过河的垫脚石。不过，你也可以尝试游过去。

到达河对岸需要一次技能检定（Skill Check）。要尝试一次技能检定，掷一次d20然后加上与你正在尝试使用的技能相关的加值。如果结果大于等于任务的DC，你便取得成功！在此情形下，你可以使用运动（Athletics）技能来跳过去或游过去。

你的运动技能检定：[[/r 1d20+7 #Athletics]]

跳跃(DC 10)

如果你尝试跳过去，你必须在DC10的运动检定上连续成功两次（一次跳到石柱上，一次跳到对岸）。如果你任意一次检定失败，你将跌入水中，必须游完剩下的路程以抵达对岸。

游泳(DC 15)

如果你尝试游过去，你必须在DC15的运动检定上成功两次。但如果你在跌入水中前成功通过检定跳到石柱上，你只需要在运动检定上成功一次来游过去，因为你已经到半途了。

这些检定可能会很危险。如果你在水中且在游泳上失败了太多次运动检定，你便会被冲走。由于这条河通向地下深处，穿过没有空气的长隧道，如果你在成功并离开水面前累计失败了三次运动技能检定，你就会溺死。

如果你失败三次运动检定，你会被拽入地下河中，撞在岩石上。转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}。

如果你抵达了对岸，你可以走下楼梯。转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.DKDZReQDxqTz7sgu]{#03}。

如果你决定沿原路返回并尝试另一条通道，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.zt9iBaumtu3CAHrD]{#15}。



原文:

In the center of the river is a pillar of stone that looks like it’s been submerged for a long time. You might be able to use it as a stepping-stone to jump across the river. However, you could also try to swim across.

Getting to the other side of the river requires a Skill Check. To attempt a skill check, roll a d20 and add the bonus associated with the skill you’re trying to use. If the result is equal to or greater than the DC of the task, you succeed! In this case, you can use Athletics to either jump across or swim across.

Your Athletics skill check: [[/r 1d20+7 #Athletics]]

Jump (DC 10)

If you try to jump across, you must succeed at two DC10 Athletics skill checks in a row (one to jump to the pillar and another to jump to the other side). If you fail either check, you fall in and must swim the rest of the way to the other side.

Swim (DC 15)

If you try to swim across, you must succeed at two DC15 Athletics skill checks. But if you succeeded at the check to jump to the pillar before falling in the water, you only need to succeed at one Athletics check to swim across, since you were already halfway.

These checks could be dangerous. If you're in the water and fail too many Athletics checks to swim, you get swept downstream. Since the river leads deep underground, through long tunnels without air, you'll drown if you fail a total of three Athletics skill checks before you succeed and get out of the water.

If you fail three Athletics checks, you are dragged into the underground river and beat against the rocks. Go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}.

If you make it to the other side, you can make your way down the stairs. Go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.DKDZReQDxqTz7sgu]{#03}.

If you instead decide to head back the way you came and try the other passage, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.zt9iBaumtu3CAHrD]{#15}.

#17.text:
当你失去生命时，你的视野逐渐黯淡。在你最后的时刻，你忍不住想到，这不该是故事的结局。也许下一位英雄会在这个致命之地做得更好……

虽然你已经死去，但仍有冒险可供经历。你可以回到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.dHOsZe4eRCxxK9Gb]，重新开始这场冒险。你会恢复至满生命值，但你曾面对过的所有敌人也同样如此。你必须再次探索，并再次面对前方等待你的任何危险。

或者，你也可以开始创建你自己的角色，与他人一同游玩冒险。前往@JournalEntry[KIpNnMtah73eyPC8]，开始设计专属于你的英雄！



原文:

Your vision grows dark as life leaves your body. In your final moments, you can’t help but think that this is not how stories should end. Maybe the next hero will fare better in this deadly place...

Although you have died, there are still adventures to be had. You can start this adventure over by returning to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.dHOsZe4eRCxxK9Gb]{#01}. You are restored to full Hit Points, but so are all of the foes that you have faced. You must explore and face whatever dangers await you all over again.

Alternatively, you can start making your own character to play in adventures with others. Go to @JournalEntry[KIpNnMtah73eyPC8]{Creating Your Hero} to begin designing your very own hero!

#18.text:
克服恐惧后，你挤进裂缝，进入另一侧狭窄的通道，通道里只透着来自上方的微弱光线。若蜘蛛网与灰尘可作判断，那么已经有很长一段时间无人从这边经过了。前方的通道逐渐变宽，形成一个洞窟石室，随后向左转去。

小洞窟右侧的墙上垂着一帘苔藓，由洞窟顶上滴落的细小水流滋养生长。它看起来有些不对劲，但你必须成功进行一次察觉（Perception）检定，才能弄清楚究竟哪里不对。

你的察觉表示你有多擅长注意到事物。你的察觉技能检定是[[/r 1d20+4 #Perception]]。掷骰后，将总结果与困难等级（Difficulty Class，DC）比较，此处DC为15。若你的结果等于或高于DC，你就成功了！

如果你成功通过察觉检定，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.EquPwVKE6qKVRygx]{#24}。

如果你未能通过察觉检定，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Tov2M6Vpwc5JzBjM]{#21}。



原文:

Putting aside your fear, you squeeze your way through the crack into the narrow passageway beyond, lit only by faint light from above. If the cobwebs and dust are any indication, no one has been down this way for a long time. Up ahead, the passageway widens to form a cave chamber before veering to the left.

A curtain of moss grows on the right wall of the small cavern, fed by a trickle of water dripping from the cavern ceiling. Something about it looks odd, but you can’t quite figure it out without succeeding at a Perception check.

Your Perception indicates how good you are at noticing things. Your perception skill check is [[/r 1d20+4 #Perception]]. Once you have rolled, compare the total to the Difficulty Class (DC), which is 15. If your result is equal to or greater than the DC, you succeed!

If you succeed at the Perception check, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.EquPwVKE6qKVRygx]{#24}.

If you fail the Perception check, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Tov2M6Vpwc5JzBjM]{#21}.

#19.text:
你在上面的房间里找到了一把钥匙，这不可能只是巧合。也许它能帮你打败雕像，但你得先让它慢下来。

你现在正与海盗雕像进行战斗。要开始这场战斗，你和雕像必须先掷骰进行先攻，以决定谁先行动。这是一次你们双方都要尝试的察觉检定。结果更高者在战斗中先行动（若平手，则雕像先行动）。

你的察觉检定是[[/r 1d20+4 #Your Perception]]。

海盗雕像的察觉检定是[[/r 1d20+0 #Pirate's Perception]]。

为你们双方掷骰来决定谁先行动。若你先行动，你必须先花费1个动作移动到雕像身边，然后才能进行任何攻击。雕像要慢得多，因此若它先行动，它必须先花费2个动作移动到你身边，然后才能攻击。

战斗中，你可以使用以下动作。在你任意回合开始时、使用任何动作之前，你都可以决定逃离战斗，通过房间后方的一条小裂缝离开。若你这么做，转到@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.6wxOV8Kjh8dDiGuY]。

1 用短剑打击

查看@UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]了解你短剑的属性。

1 移动

你可以移动以接近或远离雕像。若你移动到它身边，你可以用剩余的动作进行攻击。若你移动远离，雕像在它的回合中必须先花费2个动作移动到你身边，然后才能攻击。

2 尝试使用钥匙

若雕像剩余生命值少于10点，你可以尝试插入钥匙以使其停止运作。这会消耗2个动作（此处的图标代表双动作）。若你尝试这么做，转到@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.CFAahkSt8huRR8RU]。

海盗雕像

AC：18

生命值：20

1 用军刀打击

若可能，雕像会使用其全部动作进行攻击。

第一次攻击：[[/r 1d20+9 #Strike with Saber 1]]

第二次攻击：[[/r 1d20+4 #Strike with Saber 2]]

第三次攻击：[[/r 1d20-1 #Strike with Saber 3]]

伤害：[[/r 1d8+2 #Pirate's Damage]]

2 移动

雕像朝你移动。这会消耗2个动作（此处的图标代表双动作）。

若你击败雕像，转到@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.HEr7Q5hCU4sUu9vG]。

若雕像击败你，转到@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]。



原文:

It can’t be a coincidence that you found a key in the chamber above. Maybe it will help you defeat the statue, but you’re going to have to slow it down first.

You are now in combat with the pirate statue. To start this combat, you and the statue must start by rolling Initiative to determine who gets to act first. This is a Perception check that both of you attempt. The one who gets a higher result acts first in the combat (if you tie, the Statue goes first).

Your Perception check is [[/r 1d20+4 #Your Perception]].

The pirate statue’s Perception check is [[/r 1d20+0 #Pirate's Perception]].

Roll for both of you to determine who goes first. If you go first, you must spend 1 action to move next to the statue before making any attacks. The statue is much slower, so if it goes first, it must spend 2 actions to move up to you before attacking.

During combat, you can use the actions below. At the start of any of your turns, before using any actions, you can decide to flee the combat, leaving through a small crevice in the back of the chamber. If you do this, go to @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.6wxOV8Kjh8dDiGuY]{#04}.

1 Strike with Your Shortsword

See @UUID[JournalEntry.MNx5B6xIGsHwGzqe.JournalEntryPage.IrDInT1GRf8tKGyg]{Scratch Paper} for your Shortsword's statistics.

1 Move

You can move up to or away from the statue. If you move up to it, you can attack with your remaining actions. If you move away, the statue must spend 2 of its actions on its turn to move up to you before attacking.

2 Try the Key

If the statue has fewer than 10 Hit Points left, you can try to insert the key to deactivate it. This uses 2 actions (the symbol here represents two actions). If you try this, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.CFAahkSt8huRR8RU]{#22}.

Pirate Statue

AC: 18

Hit Points: 20

1 Strike with Saber

The statue uses all of its actions to attack if possible.

First attack: [[/r 1d20+9 #Strike with Saber 1]]

Second attack: [[/r 1d20+4 #Strike with Saber 2]]

Third attack: [[/r 1d20-1 #Strike with Saber 3]]

Damage: [[/r 1d8+2 #Pirate's Damage]]

2 Move

The statue moves toward you. This uses 2 actions (the symbol here represents 2 actions).

 

If you defeat the statue, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.HEr7Q5hCU4sUu9vG]{#06}.

If the statue defeats you, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}.

#20.text:
你开始用剑朝着冰柱乱砍，但当你第一次砍中它时，一道强大的魔法冰寒冲刷着你的手臂。

你受到1点伤害。看起来如果你想要破坏冰柱，你至少还需要击中它三次，再受到3点伤害。

如果你决定用剑破坏冰柱，再受到3点伤害，然后转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.B3hPHccbWsEhVvGj]。

如果伤害让你减至0生命值，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]。

如果你决定不管冰柱，跳下滑道，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.qcI1yZVH5QBDbpaj]。

如果你决定返回来时的路并尝试另一条通道，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Op9v0801zCNxtVMJ]。



原文:

Using your blade, you begin to hack away at the icicle, but the first time you strike it, a wave of powerful, magical cold washes up your arm.

You take 1 damage. It looks like if you want to destroy the icicle, you’ll need to hit it at least three more times, taking another 3 damage.

If you decide to destroy the icicle with your sword, take 3 more damage and go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.B3hPHccbWsEhVvGj]{#02}.

If the damage reduces you to 0 Hit Points, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}.

If you decide to leave the icicle alone and jump down the chute, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.qcI1yZVH5QBDbpaj]{#23}.

If you instead decide to head back the way you came and try the other passage, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Op9v0801zCNxtVMJ]{#05}.

#21.text:
你环顾四周，却没发现任何值得留意的东西。既然没有别的路可走，你便沿着通往左侧的走廊前进。沿着那条隧道走下去时，你注意到有一阵微弱的微风。

转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Aj3k03uAUj6kb0OV]。



原文:

You look around but fail to spot anything of interest. With no other way to go, you head down the corridor that leads off to the left. You notice a faint breeze as you make your way down that tunnel.

Go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Aj3k03uAUj6kb0OV]{#10}.

#22.text:
现在雕像的速度慢了下来，你可以尝试插入钥匙看看这是否能帮助你击败这一威胁。

插入钥匙需要你尝试一次DC 20 运动技能检定来擒抱雕像。骰[[/r 1d20+7 #Athletics]]。如果你的结果等于或高于擒抱雕像的DC，它就会倒在地上，停止运作。

如果你成功，你便击败了雕像！转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.HEr7Q5hCU4sUu9vG]{#06}。

如果你失败，则继续战斗。回到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Eds15d6ZIMNit3Ke]{#19}。



原文:

Now that the statue is slowed down, you can try to insert the key to see if it might help defeat this menace.

Inserting the key requires you to attempt an DC 20 Athletics Skill Check to grapple the statue. Roll [[/r 1d20+7 #Athletics]]. If your result is equal to or greater than the DC to grapple the statue, it falls to the ground, deactivated.

If you succeed, you defeat the statue! Go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.HEr7Q5hCU4sUu9vG]{#06}.

If you fail, continue the fight. Return to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Eds15d6ZIMNit3Ke]{#19}.

#23.text:
不再谨慎，你冲下滑道，一头扎进冰冷的黑暗中！

滑道表面光滑又冰冷，你在向地底更深处下滑时速度越来越快。就在滑道开始变平缓时，你看见前方有一根巨大的冰柱，挡住了大部分通道。以这样的速度撞上去肯定会很疼！

你可以通过尝试一次DC 17的反射豁免来避免撞上冰柱并免于受到严重伤害。掷骰[[/r 1d20+5 #Reflex]]。

如果你的检定结果低于DC，你会因撞上冰柱而受到[[/r 1d8 #Damage]]点伤害。如果你成功，则受到一半伤害（掷d8并将结果减半，向下取整）。如果你的掷骰结果为20，则你大成功，完全避开冰柱，不受任何伤害！最后，如果你的掷骰结果为1或2，则你在豁免上大失败，受到双倍伤害（掷d8并将结果翻倍）。

如果你活了下来，滑道会把你抛进一个大房间。转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.DKDZReQDxqTz7sgu]{#03}。

如果撞上冰柱使你降至0点生命值或更少，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}。



原文:

Abandoning caution, you dive down the chute, heading into the freezing darkness!

The surface is slick and freezing cold, and you pick up quite a bit of speed as you descend deeper into the earth. Just as the chute begins to level out, you see a massive icicle up ahead, blocking most of the tunnel. At this speed, running into it is going to hurt!

You can try to avoid hitting the icicle and taking any serious harm by attempting a DC 17 Reflex saving throw. Roll [[/r 1d20+5 #Reflex]].

If your check result is less than the DC, you take [[/r 1d8 #Damage]] points of damage from running into the icicle. If you succeed, you take half damage (roll the d8 and divide the number rolled in half, rounding down). If your roll results in a 20, you critically succeed and avoid the icicle completely, taking no damage! Finally, if your roll results in a 1 or a 2, you critically fail the saving throw and take double damage (roll the d8 and double the result).

If you survive, the chute drops you into a large chamber. Go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.DKDZReQDxqTz7sgu]{#03}.

If hitting the icicle reduces you to 0 Hit Points or fewer, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.vvHdmlShxCXYyelw]{#17}.

#24.text:
环顾四周，你注意到墙上有一道狭窄的裂缝，就在那帘苔藓上方。水似乎正从裂缝中滴落出来，而且裂缝看起来足够宽，也许你能挤进去。你要怎么做？

如果你无视这道裂缝，转身沿通道向下走，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Aj3k03uAUj6kb0OV]。

如果你爬进裂缝，转到条目@UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.h6jHD9J3VD3Auxo1]。



原文:

Looking around, you notice a narrow crack in the wall, just above the curtain of moss. Water seems to be dripping out from the crack, and it looks wide enough that you might be able to squeeze inside. What do you do?

If you ignore the crack and turn to head down the passageway, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.Aj3k03uAUj6kb0OV]{#10}.

If you crawl into the crack, go to Entry @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.h6jHD9J3VD3Auxo1]{#12}.

#25.text:
你现在处于与海盗雕像的战斗中。要开始这场战斗，你和雕像必须先掷骰先攻（Initiative）来决定谁先行动。这是一次你们双方都需要进行的察觉（Perception）检定。谁掷骰点数更高则先行动（如果双方一致，则雕像先行动）。

你的察觉检定是[[/r 1d20+4 #Your Perception]]。

海盗雕像的察觉检定是[[/r 1d20 #Pirate's Perception]]。

原文:

You are now in combat with the pirate statue. To start this combat, you and the statue must start by rolling Initiative to determine who gets to act first. This is a Perception check that both of you attempt. The one who gets a higher result acts first in the combat (if you tie, the Statue goes first).

Your Perception bonus is [[/r 1d20+4 #Your Perception]].

The pirate statue’s Perception bonus is [[/r 1d20 #Pirate's Perception]].

Roll for both of you to determine who goes first. If you go first, you must spend 1 action to move next to the statue before making any attacks. The statue is much slower, so if it goes first, it must spend 2 actions to move up to you before attacking.

During combat, you can use the actions below. At the start of any of your turns, before using any actions, you can decide to flee the combat, leaving through a small crevice in the back of the chamber. If you do this, go to @UUID[JournalEntry.84g4A22otQbtAqYu.JournalEntryPage.6wxOV8Kjh8dDiGuY]{#04}.

Pirate King's Plunder.description:
海贼王的财宝是一场简单的冒险，不需要GM，单名玩家即可完成。

在海贼王的财宝中，你无需按时间顺序阅读日志来推进故事。相反，在每个条目的末尾，你将看到一组选项。你所做的决定会将你引导至不同的条目；你只需点击这些相互链接的日志条目即可继续。为方便起见，我们还加入了一条实用的日志条目，用于记录你的笔记，并让你能方便地为攻击和各项数据进行掷骰。



原文:

Pirate King's Plunder is a simple adventure which requires no GM and can be completed by a single player.

In Pirate King's Plunder, you won't advance through the story by reading the journals in chronological order. Instead, at the end of each entry, you'll be presented with a set of choices. The decisions you make will lead you to different entries, which you can follow simply by clicking through the linked journal entries. For convenience, we have included a helpful journal entry to keep track of your notes and allow you to conveniently roll dice for your attacks and statistics.
